        All remaining (rules) should be applied.

        SesÄ sabbe yojetabbÄ.

        ğ‘€²ğ‘‚ğ‘€²ğ‘€¸ ğ‘€²ğ‘€©ğ‘†ğ‘€©ğ‘‚ ğ‘€¬ğ‘„ğ‘€šğ‘‚ğ‘€¢ğ‘€©ğ‘†ğ‘€©ğ‘€¸ğ‘‡

        à¤¸à¥‡à¤¸à¤¾ à¤¸à¤¬à¥à¤¬à¥‡ à¤¯à¥‹à¤œà¥‡à¤¤à¤¬à¥à¤¬à¤¾à¥¤

        1. CSCD incorrectly spells “canatassa” as “cantassa” ↩︎

        6 - Pali Learning Notes and Answers to Warder's textbook

        Notes from the Pali course based on Warder’s “Introduction to Pali”

        This section contains various notes on learning PÄli. I attended Bhante Sujato’s PÄli course held on 1 August 2023 till 31 October 2023, and then continued by John Kelly from 7 November till February 2024. The textbook used for the course was A.K. Warder’s Introduction to Pali 3rd edition, Pali Text Society, Oxford (2001)

        6.1 - My Translations from "Pali Buddhist Texts"

        My independent translation of the excerpts from the Tipiá¹­aka in Pali Buddhist Texts Explained to the Beginner, Rune E A Johansson, Curzon Press, Copenhagen, Scandinavian Institute of Asian Studies Monograph Series, Third Edition, 1981.

        1. EXPERIENCE IS THE ONLY CRITERION

        MahÄtaá¹‡hÄsaá¹…khayasutta MN 38 PTS 1.257â€“1.271 (Majjhima Nikaya I 265):

        24.4 â€œApi nu tumhe, bhikkhave, evaá¹ jÄnantÄ evaá¹ passantÄ evaá¹ vadeyyÄthaâ€”
        ğŸ”¼(apinu) ğŸ¤˜â‘ â¨‚(tvaá¹ƒ) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨‚(bhikkhu) ğŸ”¼(evaá¹ƒ) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(jÄnanta) ğŸ”¼(evaá¹ƒ) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(passanta) â¯ğŸ¤˜â¨‚(vadati)
        are? | youse | bhikkhave | thus | knowing | thus | seeing | will say
        Thus knowing and thus seeing, bhikkhave, will you say -

        24.5 satthÄ no garu, satthugÄravena ca mayaá¹ evaá¹ vademÄâ€ti?
        ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(satthar) ğŸ‘†â‘¥â¨‚(ahaá¹ƒ) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(garu) , ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨€(satthugÄrava) ğŸ”¼(ca) ğŸ‘†â‘ â¨‚(ahaá¹ƒ) ğŸ”¼(evaá¹ƒ) â¯ğŸ‘†â¨‚(vadati) ğŸ”¼(ti)
        teacher | of us | respected , with respect for the teacher | and | we | thus | will say | quote
        â€œOur teacher is respected, and we will say thus with (relying on) the respect for our teacher.â€

        24.6 â€œNo hetaá¹, bhanteâ€.
        ğŸ”¼(no hetaá¹ƒ) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨€(bhavant)
        no | certainly | Bhante
        Certainly not, Bhante.

        24.7 â€œApi nu tumhe, bhikkhave, evaá¹ jÄnantÄ evaá¹ passantÄ evaá¹ vadeyyÄthaâ€”
        ğŸ”¼(apinu) ğŸ¤˜â‘ â¨‚(tvaá¹ƒ) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨‚(bhikkhu) ğŸ”¼(evaá¹ƒ) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(jÄnanta) ğŸ”¼(evaá¹ƒ) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(passanta) â¯ğŸ¤˜â¨‚(vadati)
        are? | youse | bhikkhave | thus | knowing | thus | seeing | will say
        Thus knowing and thus seeing, bhikkhave, will you say -

        24.8 samaá¹‡o evamÄha, samaá¹‡Ä ca nÄma mayaá¹ evaá¹ vademÄâ€ti?
        ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(samaá¹‡a) ğŸ”¼(evamÄha) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(samaá¹‡a) ğŸ”¼(ca) ğŸ”¼(nÄma) ğŸ‘†â‘ â¨‚(ahaá¹ƒ) ğŸ”¼(evaá¹ƒ) â¯ğŸ‘†â¨‚(vadati) ğŸ”¼(ti)
        ascetic | one said thus | ascetics | and | called | we | thus | will say | quote
        An ascetic said thus, and (those) called ascetics, (so) we say thus.

        24.9 â€œNo hetaá¹, bhanteâ€.
        ğŸ”¼(no hetaá¹ƒ) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨€(bhavant)
        no | certainly | Bhante
        Certainly not, Bhante.

        24.10 â€œApi nu tumhe, bhikkhave, evaá¹ jÄnantÄ evaá¹ passantÄ aÃ±Ã±aá¹ satthÄraá¹ uddiseyyÄthÄâ€ti?
        ğŸ”¼(apinu) ğŸ¤˜â‘ â¨‚(tvaá¹ƒ) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨‚(bhikkhu) ğŸ”¼(evaá¹ƒ) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(jÄnanta) ğŸ”¼(evaá¹ƒ) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(passanta) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(aÃ±Ã±a) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(satthar) â¯ğŸ¤˜â¨‚(uddisati)
        are? | youse | bhikkhave | thus | knowing | thus | seeing | another | teacher | appoint
        Thus knowing and thus seeing, bhikkhave, will you appoint another teacher?

        24.11 â€œNo hetaá¹, bhanteâ€.
        ğŸ”¼(no hetaá¹ƒ) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨€(bhavant)
        no | certainly | Bhante
        Certainly not, Bhante.

        24.12 â€œApi nu tumhe, bhikkhave, evaá¹ jÄnantÄ evaá¹ passantÄ yÄni tÄni puthusamaá¹‡abrÄhmaá¹‡Änaá¹ vata kotÅ«halamaá¹…galÄni tÄni sÄrato paccÄgaccheyyÄthÄâ€ti?
        ğŸ”¼(apinu) ğŸ¤˜â‘ â¨‚(tvaá¹ƒ) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨‚(bhikkhu) ğŸ”¼(evaá¹ƒ) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(jÄnanta) ğŸ”¼(evaá¹ƒ) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(passanta) ğŸš»â‘ â¨‚(ya) ğŸš»â‘ â¨‚(ta) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(puthusamaá¹‡abrÄhmaá¹‡Ä) ğŸ”¼(vata) ğŸš»â‘ â¨‚(kotÅ«halamaá¹…gala) ğŸš»â‘ â¨‚(ta) ğŸ”¼(sÄrato) â¯ğŸ¤˜â¨‚(paccÄgacchati)
        are? | youse | bhikkhave | thus | knowing | thus | seeing | whatever | that | various religious practitioners | certainly | noisy debates and auspicious ceremonies | that | as essential/valuable | will return to
        Thus knowing and thus seeing, bhikkhave, will you return to whatever (you regarded as) valuable, such as various religious practitioners, noisy debates and auspicious ceremonies?

        24.13 â€œNo hetaá¹, bhanteâ€.
        ğŸ”¼(no hetaá¹ƒ) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨€(bhavant)
        no | certainly | Bhante
        Certainly not, Bhante.

        24.14 â€œNanu, bhikkhave, yadeva tumhÄkaá¹ sÄmaá¹ Ã±Ätaá¹ sÄmaá¹ diá¹­á¹­haá¹ sÄmaá¹ viditaá¹, tadeva tumhe vadethÄâ€ti.
        ğŸ”¼(nanu) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨‚(bhikkhu) ğŸ”¼(yadeva) ğŸ¤˜â‘¥â¨‚(tvaá¹ƒ) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(sÄma) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(Ã±Äta) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(sÄma) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(diá¹­á¹­ha) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(sÄma) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(vidita) , ğŸ”¼(tadeva) ğŸ¤˜â‘ â¨‚(tvaá¹ƒ) â¯ğŸ¤˜â¨‚(vadati)
        surely? | bhikkhave | whatever | of you | oneself | known | oneself | seen | experienced , that very thing | you | will say
        Would you say whatever amongst you that you have known by yourselves, seen by yourselves, experienced by yourselves?

        24.15 â€œEvaá¹, bhanteâ€.
        ğŸ”¼(evaá¹ƒ) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨€(bhavant)
        yes | Bhante
        Yes, Bhante.

        25.1 â€œSÄdhu, bhikkhave, upanÄ«tÄ kho me tumhe, bhikkhave, iminÄ sandiá¹­á¹­hikena dhammena akÄlikena ehipassikena opaneyyikena paccattaá¹ veditabbena viÃ±Ã±Å«hi.
        ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(sÄdhu) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨‚(bhikkhu) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(upanÄ«ta) ğŸ”¼(kho) ğŸ‘†â‘¢â¨€(ahaá¹ƒ) ğŸ¤˜â‘ â¨‚(tvaá¹ƒ) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨‚(bhikkhu) ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨€(ima) ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨€(sandiá¹­á¹­hika) ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨€(dhamma) ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨€(ehipassika) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(paccatta) ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨€(veditabba) ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨‚(viÃ±Ã±Å«)
        Excellent | bhikkhave | instructed | indeed | by me | you | bhikkhave | by this | by evident | by doctrine | by verifiable | personal | by should be experienced | by intelligent
        Excellent, bhikkhave. Bhikkhave, you have indeed been instructed by me with an evident doctrine that is verifiable and should be personally experienced by those who are intelligent.

        2. DEFINITION OF SUFFERING

        MahÄsatipaá¹­á¹­hÄnasutta DN 22 PTS 2.290â€“2.315 (Digha Nikaya II 305):

        18.1 KatamaÃ±ca, bhikkhave, dukkhaá¹ ariyasaccaá¹?
        ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(katama) ğŸ”¼(ca) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨‚(bhikkhu) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(dukkha) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(ariyasacca)
        what? | and | bhikkhave | suffering | pure truth
        And what, bhikkhave, is the pure truth of dukkha (suffering)?

        18.2 JÄtipi dukkhÄ, jarÄpi dukkhÄ, maraá¹‡ampi dukkhaá¹, sokaparidevadukkhadomanassupÄyÄsÄpi dukkhÄ, appiyehi sampayogopi dukkho, piyehi vippayogopi dukkho, yampicchaá¹ na labhati tampi dukkhaá¹, saá¹…khittena paÃ±cupÄdÄnakkhandhÄ dukkhÄ.
        ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(jÄti) ğŸ”¼(pi) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(dukkha) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(jara) ğŸ”¼(pi) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(dukkha) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(maraá¹‡a) ğŸ”¼(pi) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(dukkha) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(sokaparidevadukkhadomanassupÄyÄsÄ) ğŸ”¼(pi) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(dukkha) ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨‚(appiya) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(sampayoga) ğŸ”¼(pi) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(dukkha) ğŸš¹â‘¤â¨‚(piya) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(vippayoga) ğŸ”¼(pi) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(dukkha) ğŸ”¼(yampicchaá¹ƒ) ğŸ”¼(na) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(labhati) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(ta) ğŸ”¼(pi) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(dukkha) ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨€(saá¹…khitta) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(paÃ±cupÄdÄnakkhandhÄ) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(dukkha)
        birth | too | dukkha | old age | too | dukkha | death | too | dukkha | grief, wailing, pain, suffering and trouble | too | dukkha | with disliked | association with | too | dukkha | from loved | separation from | too | dukkha | what one desires | gets | that | too | dukkha | in summary | the five masses of fuel | dukkha
        Birth, too, is dukkha, old age, too, is dukkha, death, too, is dukkha, grief, wailing, pain, suffering and trouble, too, are dukkha, association with disliked, too, is dukkha, separation from loved, too, is dukkha, not getting what one desires, too, is dukkha, in summary, the five masses of fuel are dukkha.

        3. THE CAUSE OF SUFFERING

        MahÄsatipaá¹­á¹­hÄnasutta DN 22 PTS 2.290â€“2.315 (Digha Nikaya II 308):

        19.1 KatamaÃ±ca, bhikkhave, dukkhasamudayaá¹ ariyasaccaá¹?
        ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(katama) ğŸ”¼(ca) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨‚(bhikkhu) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(dukkhasamudaya) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(ariyasacca)
        what? | and | bhikkhave | source of dukkha | pure truth
        And what, bhikkhave, is the pure truth of the source of dukkha?

        19.2 YÄyaá¹ taá¹‡hÄ ponobbhavikÄ nandÄ«rÄgasahagatÄ tatratatrÄbhinandinÄ«, seyyathidaá¹
        ğŸ”¼(yÄyaá¹ƒ) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(taá¹‡ha) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(ponobbhavika) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(nandÄ«rÄgasahagata) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(tatratatrÄbhinandÄ«) ğŸ”¼(seyyathidaá¹ƒ)
        whatever | craving | leading to rebirth | accompanied by delight and desire | who takes delight here and there; thoroughly enjoying this and that | as follows
        Whatever craving, leading to rebirth, accompanied by delight and desire, experienced by one who takes delight here and there; thoroughly enjoying this and that, as follows:

        19.3 kÄmataá¹‡hÄ bhavataá¹‡hÄ vibhavataá¹‡hÄ.
        ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(kÄmataá¹‡hÄ) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(bhavataá¹‡hÄ) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(vibhavataá¹‡hÄ)
        craving for sensual pleasure | craving for existence | craving for annihilation
        Craving for sensual pleasure, craving for existence, craving for annihilation.

        4. THE CESSATION OF SUFFERING

        MahÄsatipaá¹­á¹­hÄnasutta DN 22 PTS 2.290â€“2.315 (Digha Nikaya II 310):

        20.1 KatamaÃ±ca, bhikkhave, dukkhanirodhaá¹ ariyasaccaá¹?
        ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(katama) ğŸ”¼(ca) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨‚(bhikkhu) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(dukkhanirodha) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(ariyasacca)
        what? | and | bhikkhave | end of dukkha | pure truth
        And what, bhikkhave, is the pure truth of the end of dukkha?

        20.2 Yo tassÄyeva taá¹‡hÄya asesavirÄganirodho cÄgo paá¹­inissaggo mutti anÄlayo.
        ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(ya) ğŸ”¼(tassÄyeva) ğŸš¹â‘¥â¨€(taá¹‡ha) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(asesavirÄganirodha) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(cÄga) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(paá¹­inissagga) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(mutti) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(anÄlaya)
        whatever | of that exact | of craving | complete fading away and ending | giving up | relinquishing | freedom | non-attachment
        It is the complete fading away and ending, giving up, relinquishing, freedom, non-attachment of whatever craving (there is).

        5. THE WAY TO FREEDOM FROM SUFFERING

        MahÄsatipaá¹­á¹­hÄnasutta DN 22 PTS 2.290â€“2.315 (Digha Nikaya II 311):

        21.1 KatamaÃ±ca, bhikkhave, dukkhanirodhagÄminÄ« paá¹­ipadÄ ariyasaccaá¹?
        ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(katama) ğŸ”¼(ca) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨‚(bhikkhu) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(dukkhanirodhagÄmÄ«) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(paá¹­ipada) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(ariyasacca)
        what? | and | bhikkhave | leading to the end of dukkha | path of progress | pure truth
        And what, bhikkhave, is the pure truth of the path of progress leading to the end of dukkha?

        21.2 Ayameva ariyo aá¹­á¹­haá¹…giko maggo seyyathidaá¹â€”
        ğŸ”¼(ayameva) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(ariya) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(aá¹­á¹­haá¹…gika) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(magga) ğŸ”¼(seyyathidaá¹ƒ)
        just this | pure | 8-part | path | as follows
        It is just this, the pure path in eight parts, as follows:

        21.3 sammÄdiá¹­á¹­hi sammÄsaá¹…kappo sammÄvÄcÄ sammÄkammanto sammÄÄjÄ«vo sammÄvÄyÄmo sammÄsati sammÄsamÄdhi.
        ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(sammÄdiá¹­á¹­hi) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(sammÄsaá¹…kappa) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(sammÄvÄca) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(sammÄkammanta) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(sammÄÄjÄ«va) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(sammÄvÄyÄma) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(sammÄsati) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(sammÄsamÄdhi)
        right view | right intention | right speech | right conduct | right livelihood | right effort | right awareness | right mental composure
        Right view, right intention, right speech, right conduct, right livelihood, right effort, right awareness, right mental composure.

        6. THE IMPERMANENCE OF LIFE

        DutiyaÄyusutta SN 4.10 PTS (1st ed) 1.109 PTS (2nd ed) 1.243 (Samyutta Nikaya I 109):

        5.1 â€œAccayanti ahorattÄ,
        â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨‚(accayati) ğŸš»â‘ â¨‚(ahoratta)
        passes | time
        5.2 jÄ«vitaá¹ uparujjhati;
        ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(jÄ«vita) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(uparujjhati)
        life | is finished
        5.3 Ä€yu khÄ«yati maccÄnaá¹,
        ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(Äyu) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(khÄ«yati) ğŸš¹â‘¥â¨‚(macca)
        life energy | is exhausted | of mortal men
        5.4 kunnadÄ«naá¹va odakanâ€ti.
        ğŸšºâ‘¥â¨‚(kunnadÄ«) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(odaka)
        of stream | water

        Time passes,
        life is finished;
        the life energy of mortal men is exhausted,
        water of stream.

        7. THERE IS NO SOUL

        Buddhaghosa: Visuddhimagga, Based on the ed. by C.A.F. Rhys Davids, 2 vols., London : Pali Text Society 1920-1921, Input by the Dhammakaya Foundation, Thailand, 1989-1996 GRETIL-Version vom 4.9.2014

        SaccÄni suÃ±Ã±atekavidhÄdÄ«hi 513 (Buddhaghosa, Visuddhimagga XVI 90):

        Dukkham eva hi na koci dukkhito
        ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(dukkha) ğŸ”¼(eva) ğŸ”¼(hi) ğŸ”¼(na) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(kaci) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(dukkhita)
        dukkha | only | for | no | anyone | suffering
        kÄrako na kiriyÄ va vijjati,
        ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(kÄraka) ğŸ”¼(na) ğŸš»â‘ â¨‚(kiriya) ğŸ”¼(va) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(vijjati)
        doer | no | one who is doing | or | exists
        atthi nibbuti, na nibbuto pumÄ,
        â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(atthi) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(nibbuti) ğŸ”¼(na) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(nibbuta) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(puma)
        there is | extinguishment | not | extinguished | male
        maggam atthi, gamako na vijjatÄ« ti.
        ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(magga) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(atthi) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(gamaka) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(vijjati) ğŸ”¼(ti)
        path | there is | one who goes | no | exist | quote

        There is suffering, but no one is suffering
        There is action, but no one is performing
        There is entinguishment, but no one is extinguishing
        There is a path, but no one is travelling.

        8. DEFINITION OF PERSONALITY

        The nun VajirÄ was harrassed with doubts by MÄra, the Tempter or god of Death: What is a “person”? How does he arise? Who creates him? However, VajirÄ understood that questions of this type are misleading and gave the following answer:

        VajirÄsutta SN 5.10 PTS (1st ed) 1.135 PTS (2nd ed) 1.296â€“1.297 (Samyutta Nikaya I 135):

        4.1 â€œKiá¹ nu sattoti paccesi,
        ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(ka) ğŸ”¼(nu) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(satta) ğŸ”¼(iti) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤˜â¨€(pacceti)
        what | ? | being | like this | you believes to be
        4.2 mÄra diá¹­á¹­higataá¹ nu te;
        ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨€(mÄra) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(diá¹­á¹­higata) ğŸ”¼(nu) ğŸ¤˜â‘¥â¨€(tvaá¹ƒ)
        MÄra | misconception | ? | of you
        4.3 Suddhasaá¹…khÄrapuÃ±joyaá¹,
        ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(suddhasaá¹…khÄrapuÃ±ja) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(ima)
        merely a pile of processes | this
        4.4 nayidha sattupalabbhati.
        ğŸ”¼(nayidha) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(satta) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(upalabbhati)
        not here | being | is found
        5.1 YathÄ hi aá¹…gasambhÄrÄ,ğŸ”¼(yathÄ hi) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(aá¹…gasambhÄra)
        like | definitely | collection of parts
        5.2 hoti saddo ratho iti;
        â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(hoti) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(sadda) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(ratha) ğŸ”¼(iti)
        is | sound | chariot | like this
        5.3 Evaá¹ khandhesu santesu,
        ğŸ”¼(evaá¹ƒ) ğŸš¹â‘¦â¨‚(khandha) ğŸš¹â‘¦â¨‚(santa)
        thus | in mass | existence
        5.4 hoti sattoti sammuti.
        â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(hoti) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(satta) ğŸ”¼(iti) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(sammuti)
        is | being | like this | general consensus

        What you refer as a â€œbeingâ€,
        MÄra, a misconception of yours?
        This is merely a pile of saá¹…khÄra (volitional formations),
        No being is found in here.
        Like a collection of parts,
        Is (referred by) the word â€œchariotâ€.
        Thus in the collection of the (five fuel) masses,
        Is generally regarded as a â€œbeing.â€

        9. THE FACTORS OF PERSONALITY

        The Five Masses of Fuel (â€œpaÃ±cupÄdÄnakkhandhÄâ€).

        MahÄmÄlukyasutta MN 64 PTS 1.433â€“1.437 (Majjhima Nikaya I 435):

        9.3 So yadeva tattha hoti rÅ«pagataá¹ vedanÄgataá¹ saÃ±Ã±Ägataá¹ saá¹…khÄragataá¹ viÃ±Ã±Äá¹‡agataá¹ te dhamme aniccato dukkhato rogato gaá¹‡á¸ato sallato aghato ÄbÄdhato parato palokato suÃ±Ã±ato anattato samanupassati.
        ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(ta) ğŸ”¼(yadeva) ğŸ”¼(tattha) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(hoti) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(rÅ«pagata) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(vedanÄgata) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(saÃ±Ã±Ägata) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(saá¹…khÄragata) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(viÃ±Ã±Äá¹‡agata) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(ta) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨‚(dhamma) ğŸš¹â‘¤â¨€(anicca) ğŸš¹â‘¤â¨€(dukkha) ğŸš¹â‘¤â¨€(roga) ğŸš¹â‘¤â¨€(gaá¹‡á¸a) ğŸš¹â‘¤â¨€(salla) ğŸš¹â‘¤â¨€(agha) ğŸš¹â‘¤â¨€(ÄbÄdha) ğŸš¹â‘¤â¨€(para) ğŸš¹â‘¤â¨€(paloka) ğŸš¹â‘¤â¨€(suÃ±Ã±a) ğŸš¹â‘¤â¨€(anatta) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(samanupassati)
        that | whichever | in that regard | is | related to form | related to feelings | related to perception | related to volitional results | related to consciousness | those | chracteristics/processes | from impermanence | from suffering | from disease | from body disfigurement | from sharp objects | from trouble | from oppression | from infliction by others | from disintegration | from emptiness | from non-permanent self | perceived as
        Whatever that is regarded as related to rÅ«pa (form), vedanÄ (feelings), saÃ±Ã±Ä (perceptions), saá¹…khÄra (volitional results), viÃ±Ã±Äá¹‡a (consciousness), those processes are perceived as impermanent, suffering, disease, body disfigurements, cuts from sharp objects, trouble and misfortune, oppression , inflictions by others, disintegration, emptiness, and do not represent a non-permanent self.

        9.4 So tehi dhammehi cittaá¹ paá¹­ivÄpeti.
        ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(ta) ğŸš¹â‘¤â¨‚(ta) ğŸš¹â‘¤â¨‚(dhamma) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(citta) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(paá¹­ivÄpeti)
        that | from those | from processes | mind | pulls back
        That, the mind pulls back from those processes.

        10. FEELING

        CÅ«á¸·avedallasutta MN 44 PTS 1.299â€“1.305 (Majjhima Nikaya I 302 f):

        22.2 â€œTisso kho imÄ, Ävuso visÄkha, vedanÄâ€”
        ğŸšºâ‘ â¨‚(ti) ğŸ”¼(kho) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨‚(ima) ğŸ”¼(Ävuso) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨€(visÄkha) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(vedanÄ)
        three | indeed | these | friend | VisÄkha | feelings
        There are indeed three types of vedanÄ (feelings), friend VisÄkha:

        22.3 sukhÄ vedanÄ, dukkhÄ vedanÄ, adukkhamasukhÄ vedanÄâ€ti.
        ğŸšºâ‘ â¨‚(sukha) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨‚(vedanÄ) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨‚(dukkha) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨‚(vedanÄ) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨‚(adukkhamasukha) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨‚(vedanÄ) ğŸ”¼(ti)
        happy | feelings | painful | feelings | neutral | quote
        â€œHappy/pleasant feelings, unhappy/painful feelings, neutral feelings.â€

        23.1 â€œKatamÄ panÄyye, sukhÄ vedanÄ, katamÄ dukkhÄ vedanÄ, katamÄ adukkhamasukhÄ vedanÄâ€ti?
        ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(katama) ğŸ”¼(pana) ğŸšºâ‘¦â¨€(ayya) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨‚(sukha) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨‚(vedanÄ) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(katama) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨‚(dukkha) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨‚(vedanÄ) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(katama) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨‚(adukkhamasukha) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨‚(vedanÄ) ğŸ”¼(ti)
        what | morever | pure | happy | feelings | what | painful | feelings | what | neutral | quote
        And furthermore: â€œWhat are happy feelings, what are painful feelings, what are neutral feelings?â€

        23.2 â€œYaá¹ kho, Ävuso visÄkha, kÄyikaá¹ vÄ cetasikaá¹ vÄ sukhaá¹ sÄtaá¹ vedayitaá¹â€”
        ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(ya) ğŸ”¼(kho) ğŸ”¼(Ävuso) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨€(visÄkha) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(kÄyika) ğŸ”¼(vÄ) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(cetasika) ğŸ”¼(vÄ) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(sukha) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(vedayita)
        whatever | indeed | friend | VisÄkha | related to body | or | related to mind | or | pleasant | which is felt
        Friend VisÄkha, whatever is felt that is pleasant, either relating to the body or to the mind.

        23.3 ayaá¹ sukhÄ vedanÄ.
        ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(ima) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨‚(sukha) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨‚(vedanÄ)
        these | happy | feelings
        These are happy feelings.

        23.4 Yaá¹ kho, Ävuso visÄkha, kÄyikaá¹ vÄ cetasikaá¹ vÄ dukkhaá¹ asÄtaá¹ vedayitaá¹â€”
        ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(ya) ğŸ”¼(kho) ğŸ”¼(Ävuso) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨€(visÄkha) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(kÄyika) ğŸ”¼(vÄ) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(cetasika) ğŸ”¼(vÄ) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(dukkha) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(vedayita)
        whatever | indeed | friend | VisÄkha | related to body | or | related to mind | or | unpleasant | which is felt
        Friend VisÄkha, whatever is felt that is unpleasant, either relating to the body or to the mind.

        23.5 ayaá¹ dukkhÄ vedanÄ.
        ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(ima) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨‚(dukkha) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨‚(vedanÄ)
        these | painful | feelings
        These are painful feelings.

        23.6 Yaá¹ kho, Ävuso visÄkha, kÄyikaá¹ vÄ cetasikaá¹ vÄ neva sÄtaá¹ nÄsÄtaá¹ vedayitaá¹â€”
        ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(ya) ğŸ”¼(kho) ğŸ”¼(Ävuso) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨€(visÄkha) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(kÄyika) ğŸ”¼(vÄ) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(cetasika) ğŸ”¼(vÄ) ğŸ”¼(neva) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(sÄta) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(nÄsÄta) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(vedayita)
        whatever | indeed | friend | VisÄkha | related to body | or | related to mind | or | neither | pleasant | nor unpleasant | which is felt
        Friend VisÄkha, whatever is felt that is neither pleasant nor unpleasant, either relating to the body or to the mind.

        23.7 ayaá¹ adukkhamasukhÄ vedanÄâ€ti.
        ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(ima) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨‚(adukkhamasukha) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨‚(vedanÄ) ğŸ”¼(ti)
        this | neutral | feelings | quote
        â€œThese are neutral feelings.â€

        27.2 â€œSukhÄya kho, Ävuso visÄkha, vedanÄya rÄgÄnusayo pahÄtabbo, dukkhÄya vedanÄya paá¹­ighÄnusayo pahÄtabbo, adukkhamasukhÄya vedanÄya avijjÄnusayo pahÄtabboâ€ti.
        ğŸšºâ‘¢â¨€(sukha) ğŸ”¼(kho) ğŸ”¼(Ävuso) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨€(visÄkha) ğŸšºâ‘¢â¨€(vedanÄ) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(rÄgÄnusaya) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(pahÄtabba) ğŸšºâ‘¢â¨€(dukkha) ğŸšºâ‘¢â¨€(vedanÄ) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(paá¹­ighÄnusaya) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(pahÄtabba) ğŸšºâ‘¢â¨€(adukkhamasukha) ğŸšºâ‘¢â¨€(vedanÄ) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(avijjÄnusaya) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(pahÄtabba) ğŸ”¼(ti)
        with happy | indeed | friend | VisÄkha | with feelings | underlying tendency towards desire | should be given up | with painful | with feelings | underlying tendency towards aversion | should be given up | with neutral | with feelings | underlying tendency towards ignorance | should be given up | quote
        â€œFriend VisÄkha, with happy feelings, there is an underlying tendency towards desire, which should be given up. With painful feelings, there is an underlying tendency towards aversion, which should be given up. With neutral feelings, there is an underlying tendency towards ignorance, which should be given up.â€

        11. PERCEPTION AND IDEATION

        Nibbedhikasutta AN 6.63 PTS 3.410â€“3.417 (Anguttara Nikaya III 413):

        21.3 ChayimÄ, bhikkhave, saÃ±Ã±Äâ€”
        ğŸ”¼(chayimÄ) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨‚(bhikkhu) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(saÃ±Ã±a)

        21.4 rÅ«pasaÃ±Ã±Ä, saddasaÃ±Ã±Ä, gandhasaÃ±Ã±Ä, rasasaÃ±Ã±Ä, phoá¹­á¹­habbasaÃ±Ã±Ä, dhammasaÃ±Ã±Ä.

        MahÄvedallasutta MN 43 PTS 1.292â€“1.298 (Majjhima Nikaya I 293):

        12. THREE TYPES OF ACTIVITY

        CÅ«á¸·avedallasutta MN 44 PTS 1.299â€“1.305 (Majjhima Nikaya I 301):

        13.2 â€œTayome, Ävuso visÄkha, saá¹…khÄrÄâ€”
        ğŸ”¼(tayome) ğŸ”¼(Ävuso) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨€(visÄkha) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(saá¹…khÄra)
        these three | friend | VisÄkha | volitional thought processes
        Friend VisÄkha, there are three types of â€œsaá¹…khÄrÄâ€ (volitional thought processes)

        13.3 kÄyasaá¹…khÄro, vacÄ«saá¹…khÄro, cittasaá¹…khÄroâ€ti.
        ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(kÄyasaá¹…khÄra) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(vacÄ«saá¹…khÄra) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(cittasaá¹…khÄra) ğŸ”¼(ti)
        intention which results in bodily action | intention which results in verbal action | intention which result in thought formation | quote
        â€œBodily thought process (intention which result in bodily action), verbal thought process (intention which result in verbal action), mental thought process (intention which result in thought formation).â€

        14.1 â€œKatamo panÄyye, kÄyasaá¹…khÄro, katamo vacÄ«saá¹…khÄro, katamo cittasaá¹…khÄroâ€ti?
        ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(katama) ğŸ”¼(pana) ğŸš¹â‘¦â¨€(ayya) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(kÄyasaá¹…khÄra) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(katama) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(vacÄ«saá¹…khÄra) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(katama) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(cittasaá¹…khÄra) ğŸ”¼(ti)
        what | morever | pure | bodily thought process | verbal thought process | mental thought process | quote
        â€œAnd furthermore, what is a bodily thought process, a verbal thought process, a mental thought process?â€

        14.2 â€œAssÄsapassÄsÄ kho, Ävuso visÄkha, kÄyasaá¹…khÄro, vitakkavicÄrÄ vacÄ«saá¹…khÄro, saÃ±Ã±Ä ca vedanÄ ca cittasaá¹…khÄroâ€ti.
        ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(assÄsapassÄsa) ğŸ”¼(kho) ğŸ”¼(Ävuso) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨€(visÄkha) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(kÄyasaá¹…khÄra) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(vitakkavicÄrÄ) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(vacÄ«saá¹…khÄra) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨‚(saÃ±Ã±a) ğŸ”¼(ca) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(vedanÄ) ğŸ”¼(ca) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(cittasaá¹…khÄra) ğŸ”¼(ti)
        breathing in and out | indeed | friend | VisÄkha | bodily thought process | inner dialogue | verbal thought process | perceptions | and | feelings | mental thought process | quote
        â€œBreathing in and out is (an example of) a bodily thought process, inner dialogue is a verbal thought process, perceptions and feelings are mental thought processes.â€

        13. VOLITION AND THE ACTIVITIES

        UpÄdÄnaparipavattasutta SN 22.56 PTS 3.59â€“3.61 (Samyutta Nikaya III 60):

        10.1 Katame ca, bhikkhave, saá¹…khÄrÄ?
        ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(katama) ğŸ”¼(ca) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨‚(bhikkhu) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(saá¹…khÄra)

        Bhikkhave, and what are volitional thought processes?

        10.2 Chayime, bhikkhave, cetanÄkÄyÄâ€”
        ğŸ”¼(chayime) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨‚(bhikkhu) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(cetanÄkÄyÄ)
        these six | bhikkhave | classes of volitional thoughts (intentions)
        Bhikkhave, these six classes of volitional thoughts (intentions) -

        10.3 rÅ«pasaÃ±cetanÄ, saddasaÃ±cetanÄ, gandhasaÃ±cetanÄ, rasasaÃ±cetanÄ, phoá¹­á¹­habbasaÃ±cetanÄ, dhammasaÃ±cetanÄ.
        ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(rÅ«pasaÃ±cetanÄ) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(saddasaÃ±cetanÄ) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(gandhasaÃ±cetanÄ) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(rasasaÃ±cetanÄ) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(phoá¹­á¹­habbasaÃ±cetanÄ) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(dhammasaÃ±cetanÄ)
        thoughts about forms | thoughts about sounds | thoughts about smells | thoughts about tastes | thoughts about contacts | thoughts about mental characteristics
        Thoughts about forms, thoughts about sounds, thoughts about smells, thoughts about tastes, thoughts about contacts, thoughts about mental characteristics.

        10.4 Ime vuccanti, bhikkhave, saá¹…khÄrÄ.
        ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(ima) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨‚(vuccati) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨‚(bhikkhu) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(saá¹…khÄra)

        Bhikkhave, these are said to be volitional thought processes.

        14. THE ORIGIN OF CONSCIOUS PROCESSES

        MahÄtaá¹‡hÄsaá¹…khayasutta MN 38 PTS 1.257â€“1.271 (Majjhima Nikaya I 259):

        8.1 â€œYaá¹ yadeva, bhikkhave, paccayaá¹ paá¹­icca uppajjati viÃ±Ã±Äá¹‡aá¹, tena teneva viÃ±Ã±Äá¹‡antveva saá¹…khyaá¹ gacchati.
        ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(ya) ğŸ”¼(yadeva) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨‚(bhikkhu) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(paccaya) ğŸ”¼(paá¹­icca) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(uppajjati) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(viÃ±Ã±Äá¹‡a) ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨€(ta) ğŸ”¼(teneva) ğŸ”¼(viÃ±Ã±Äá¹‡antveva) ğŸšºâ‘¡â¨€(saá¹…khyÄ) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(gacchati)
        whenever | any | bhikkhave | preequisite | dependency | arise | consciousness | by that | by that alone | just consciousness | definition | becomes
        â€œWhenever any prerequisite or dependency causing consciousness arises, just by that alone â€œconsciousnessâ€ becomes defined.

        8.2 CakkhuÃ±ca paá¹­icca rÅ«pe ca uppajjati viÃ±Ã±Äá¹‡aá¹, cakkhuviÃ±Ã±Äá¹‡antveva saá¹…khyaá¹ gacchati;
        ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(cakkhu) ğŸ”¼(ca) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(paccaya) ğŸš¹â‘¦â¨€(rÅ«pa) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(uppajjati) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(viÃ±Ã±Äá¹‡a) ğŸ”¼(cakkhuviÃ±Ã±Äá¹‡antveva) ğŸšºâ‘¡â¨€(saá¹…khyÄ) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(gacchati)
        eye (faculty of seeing) | and | dependency | in form | arise | consciousness | just sight-consciousness | categorisation | becomes
        The eye (faculty of seeing) is a dependency of form causing consciousness to arise, to become categorised as â€œvisual-consciousnessâ€

        8.3 sotaÃ±ca paá¹­icca sadde ca uppajjati viÃ±Ã±Äá¹‡aá¹, sotaviÃ±Ã±Äá¹‡antveva saá¹…khyaá¹ gacchati;
        ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(sota) ğŸ”¼(ca) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(paccaya) ğŸš¹â‘¦â¨€(sadda) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(uppajjati) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(viÃ±Ã±Äá¹‡a) ğŸ”¼(sotaviÃ±Ã±Äá¹‡antveva) ğŸšºâ‘¡â¨€(saá¹…khyÄ) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(gacchati)
        ear (faculty of hearing) | and | dependency | in sound | arise | consciousness | just auditory-consciousness | categorisation | becomes
        The ear (faculty of hearing) is a dependency of sound causing consciousness to arise, to become categorised as â€œauditory-consciousnessâ€

        8.4 ghÄnaÃ±ca paá¹­icca gandhe ca uppajjati viÃ±Ã±Äá¹‡aá¹, ghÄnaviÃ±Ã±Äá¹‡antveva saá¹…khyaá¹ gacchati;
        ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(ghÄna) ğŸ”¼(ca) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(paccaya) ğŸš¹â‘¦â¨€(gandha) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(uppajjati) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(viÃ±Ã±Äá¹‡a) ğŸ”¼(ghÄnaviÃ±Ã±Äá¹‡antveva) ğŸšºâ‘¡â¨€(saá¹…khyÄ) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(gacchati)
        nose (faculty of smelling) | and | dependency | in smell | arise | consciousness | just olfactory-consciousness | categorisation | becomes
        The nose (faculty of smelling) is a dependency of smell causing consciousness to arise, to become categorised as â€œolfactory-consciousnessâ€

        8.5 jivhaÃ±ca paá¹­icca rase ca uppajjati viÃ±Ã±Äá¹‡aá¹, jivhÄviÃ±Ã±Äá¹‡antveva saá¹…khyaá¹ gacchati;
        ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(jivha) ğŸ”¼(ca) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(paccaya) ğŸš¹â‘¦â¨€(rasa) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(uppajjati) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(viÃ±Ã±Äá¹‡a) ğŸ”¼(jivhÄviÃ±Ã±Äá¹‡antveva) ğŸšºâ‘¡â¨€(saá¹…khyÄ) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(gacchati)
        tongue (faculty of tasting) | and | dependency | in taste | arise | consciousness | just gustatory-consciousness | categorisation | becomes
        The tongue (faculty of tasting) is a dependency of taste causing consciousness to arise, to become categorised as â€œgustatory-consciousnessâ€

        8.6 kÄyaÃ±ca paá¹­icca phoá¹­á¹­habbe ca uppajjati viÃ±Ã±Äá¹‡aá¹, kÄyaviÃ±Ã±Äá¹‡antveva saá¹…khyaá¹ gacchati;
        ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(kaya) ğŸ”¼(ca) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(paccaya) ğŸš¹â‘¦â¨€(phoá¹­á¹­habba) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(uppajjati) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(viÃ±Ã±Äá¹‡a) ğŸ”¼(kÄyaviÃ±Ã±Äá¹‡antveva) ğŸšºâ‘¡â¨€(saá¹…khyÄ) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(gacchati)
        body (faculty of touch) | and | dependency | in physical sensation | arise | consciousness | just tactile-consciousness | categorisation | becomes
        The body (faculty of touch) is a dependency of physical sensation causing consciousness to arise, to become categorised as â€œtactile-consciousnessâ€

        8.7 manaÃ±ca paá¹­icca dhamme ca uppajjati viÃ±Ã±Äá¹‡aá¹, manoviÃ±Ã±Äá¹‡antveva saá¹…khyaá¹ gacchati.
        ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(mana) ğŸ”¼(ca) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(paccaya) ğŸš¹â‘¦â¨€(dhamma) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(uppajjati) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(viÃ±Ã±Äá¹‡a) ğŸ”¼(manoviÃ±Ã±Äá¹‡antveva) ğŸšºâ‘¡â¨€(saá¹…khyÄ) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(gacchati)
        mind (faculty of thought) | and | dependency | in mental states | arise | consciousness | just mental-consciousness | categorisation | becomes
        The nose (faculty of thought) is a dependency of mental states causing consciousness to arise, to become categorised as â€œmental-consciousnessâ€

        15. CONSCIOUSNESS AND REBIRTH

        Paá¹­hamabhavasutta AN 3.76 PTS 1.224 (Anguttara Nikaya I 223):

        1.2 â€œbhavo, bhavoti, bhante, vuccati.
        ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(bhava) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(bhava) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨€(bhavant) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(vuccati)
        bhava | existence | Bhante | is said to be
        Existence is called â€˜bhavaâ€™, Bhante.

        1.3 KittÄvatÄ nu kho, bhante, bhavo hotÄ«â€ti?
        ğŸ”¼(kittÄvatÄ) ğŸ”¼(nu kho) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨€(bhavant) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(bhava) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(hoti) ğŸ”¼(ti)
        In what way | ? | indeed | Bhante | â€œbhavaâ€ | is | quote
        What is the nature of â€˜bhava,â€™ Bhante?

        2.1 â€œKÄmadhÄtuvepakkaÃ±ca, Änanda, kammaá¹ nÄbhavissa, api nu kho kÄmabhavo paÃ±Ã±ÄyethÄâ€ti?
        ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(kÄmadhÄtuvepakka) ğŸ”¼(ca) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨€(Änanda) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(kamma) ğŸ”€ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(nÄbhavissa) ğŸ”¼(apinu kho) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(kÄmabhava) ğŸ”µâ¯ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(paÃ±Ã±Äyati) ğŸ”¼(ti)
        ripening in the realm of sensual desire | Ä€nanda | volitional action | would not exist | what | indeed | desire for existence | is evident | quote
        â€œIt is a fruit ripening in the realm of sensual desire, Ä€nanda. If there is no volitional action, would desire for existence be evident?â€

        2.2 â€œNo hetaá¹, bhanteâ€.
        ğŸ”¼(no hetaá¹ƒ) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨€(bhavant)
        no | certainly | Bhante
        Certainly not, Bhante.

        2.3 â€œIti kho, Änanda, kammaá¹ khettaá¹, viÃ±Ã±Äá¹‡aá¹ bÄ«jaá¹, taá¹‡hÄ sneho.
        ğŸ”¼(iti kho) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨€(Änanda) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(kamma) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(khetta) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(viÃ±Ã±Äá¹‡a) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(bÄ«ja) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(taá¹‡ha) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(sneha)
        like this | indeed | Ä€nanda | action | field | consciousness | seed | craving | moisture
        It is like this, Ä€nanda. Action is the field, consciousness is the seed, and craving is the moisture.

        2.4 AvijjÄnÄ«varaá¹‡Änaá¹ sattÄnaá¹ taá¹‡hÄsaá¹yojanÄnaá¹ hÄ«nÄya dhÄtuyÄ viÃ±Ã±Äá¹‡aá¹ patiá¹­á¹­hitaá¹ evaá¹ Äyatiá¹ punabbhavÄbhinibbatti hoti.
        ğŸš»â‘¥â¨‚(avijjÄnÄ«varaá¹‡a) ğŸš¹â‘¥â¨‚(satta) ğŸš¹â‘¥â¨‚(taá¹‡hÄsaá¹ƒyojana) ğŸšºâ‘¥â¨€(hÄ«na) ğŸšºâ‘¥â¨€(dhÄtu) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(viÃ±Ã±Äá¹‡a) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(patiá¹­á¹­hita) ğŸ”¼(evaá¹ƒ) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(Äyati) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(punabbhavÄbhinibbatti) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(hoti)
        of impeded by ignorance; obstructed by not understanding | of beings | of bound by craving | of fallen away | of root | consciousness | well established | thus | future | production of renewed existence | is
        While beings are impeded by ignorance, bound by craving, fallen away from their roots, consciousness is well established and in the future produces renewed existence.

        4.5 Evaá¹ kho, Änanda, bhavo hotÄ«â€ti.
        ğŸ”¼(evaá¹ƒ) ğŸ”¼(kho) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨€(Änanda) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(bhava) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(hoti) ğŸ”¼(ti)
        thus | indeed | Ä€nanda | â€œbhavaâ€ | is | quote
        â€œThus indeed, Ä€nanda, is â€˜bhava.â€™â€

        16. CONSCIOUSNESS MAY BE CALMED

        DvayatÄnupassanÄsutta Snp 3.12 PTS 140â€“150 PTS 140, PTS 141, PTS 142, PTS 143, PTS 144, PTS 145, PTS 146, PTS 147, PTS 148, PTS 149, PTS 150 Verse 730â€“772 (Sutta Nipata, verses 734, 735):

        19.1 â€œYaá¹ kiÃ±ci dukkhaá¹ sambhoti,
        ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(ya) ğŸ”¼(kiÃ±ci) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(dukkha) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(sambhoti)
        whenever | something/anything | suffering | arises
        19.2 Sabbaá¹ viÃ±Ã±Äá¹‡apaccayÄ;
        ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(sabba) ğŸ”¼(viÃ±Ã±Äá¹‡apaccayÄ)
        all | caused by consciousness
        19.3 ViÃ±Ã±Äá¹‡assa nirodhena,
        ğŸš»â‘¥â¨€(viÃ±Ã±Äá¹‡a) ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨€(nirodha)
        of consciousness | with the cessation
        19.4 Natthi dukkhassa sambhavo.
        â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(natthi) ğŸš¹â‘¥â¨€(dukkha) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(sambhava)
        there is not | of suffering | birth

        20.1 EtamÄdÄ«navaá¹ Ã±atvÄ,
        ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(eta) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(ÄdÄ«nava) ğŸ”¼(Ã±atvÄ)
        this | danger | having known
        20.2 Dukkhaá¹ viÃ±Ã±Äá¹‡apaccayÄ;
        ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(dukkha) ğŸ”¼(viÃ±Ã±Äá¹‡apaccayÄ)
        suffering | caused by consciousness
        20.3 ViÃ±Ã±Äá¹‡Å«pasamÄ bhikkhu,
        ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(viÃ±Ã±Äá¹‡Å«pasama) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(bhikkhu)
        stilling of consciousness | bhikkhu
        20.4 NicchÄto parinibbutoti.
        ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(nicchÄta) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(parinibbuta) ğŸ”¼(iti)
        satisfied | attained final NibbÄna | and so

        Whenever any suffering arises,
        All caused by consciousness;
        With the cessation of consciousness,
        There is no birth of suffering.

        Having known this danger,
        suffering is caused by consciousness;
        The bhikkhu stills the consciousness,
        And so attained final NibbÄna satisfied.

        17. THE PSYCHOLOGICAL LAW OF CAUSALITY AND ITS USE

        Poá¹­á¹­hapÄdasutta DN 9 PTS 1.178â€“1.203 (Digha Nikaya I 180 f):

        7.4 SahetÅ« hi, poá¹­á¹­hapÄda, sappaccayÄ purisassa saÃ±Ã±Ä uppajjantipi nirujjhantipi.
        ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(sahetu) ğŸ”¼(hi) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨€(poá¹­á¹­hapÄda) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(sappaccaya) ğŸš¹â‘£â¨€(purisa) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(saÃ±Ã±a) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨‚(uppajjati) ğŸ”¼(pi) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨‚(nirujjhati) ğŸ”¼(pi)
        having a cause | definitely | Poá¹­á¹­hapÄda | conditional | for person | perceptions | arises | too | ceases | too
        Poá¹­á¹­hapÄda, having a cause is definitely a condition for saÃ±Ã±Ä (perceptions) arising and ceasing for a person.

        7.5 SikkhÄ ekÄ saÃ±Ã±Ä uppajjati, sikkhÄ ekÄ saÃ±Ã±Ä nirujjhati.
        ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(sikkhÄ) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(eka) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(saÃ±Ã±a) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(uppajjati) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(sikkhÄ) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(eka) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(saÃ±Ã±a) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(nirujjhati)
        practice | a single | perception | arise | practice | a single | perception | cease
        Practice arising a single perception, and ceasing a single perception.

        18. LIBERATION IS A NATURAL PROCESS

        CetanÄkaraá¹‡Ä«yasutta AN 10.2 PTS 5.3â€“5.4 (Anguttara Nikaya V 2 f):

        1.1 â€œSÄ«lavato, bhikkhave, sÄ«lasampannassa na cetanÄya karaá¹‡Ä«yaá¹:
        ğŸš¹â‘£â¨€(sÄ«lavant) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨‚(bhikkhu) ğŸš¹â‘£â¨€(sÄ«lasampanna) ğŸ”¼(no) ğŸšºâ‘¢â¨€(cetana) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(karaá¹‡Ä«ya)
        for moral | bhikkhave | for accomplished in virtue | no | with intention | ought to be done
        Bhikkhave, for the moral and accomplished in virtue, nothing ought to be done with intention.

        1.2 â€˜avippaá¹­isÄro me uppajjatÅ«â€™ti.
        ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(avippaá¹­isÄra) ğŸ‘†â‘¥â¨€(ahaá¹ƒ) â¹ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(uppajjati) ğŸ”¼(ti)

        â€œMay no regrets arise of me.â€

        This characteristic, Bhikkhave, non-regret, arises for whoever is moral and accomplished in virtue.

        1.4 Avippaá¹­isÄrissa, bhikkhave, na cetanÄya karaá¹‡Ä«yaá¹:
        ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(avippaá¹­isÄrÄ«) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨‚(bhikkhu) ğŸ”¼(no) ğŸšºâ‘¢â¨€(cetana) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(karaá¹‡Ä«ya)

        1.7 Pamuditassa, bhikkhave, na cetanÄya karaá¹‡Ä«yaá¹:

        1.17 â€˜cittaá¹ me samÄdhiyatÅ«â€™ti.

        1.21 DhammatÄ esÄ, bhikkhave, yaá¹ samÄhito yathÄbhÅ«taá¹ jÄnÄti passati.

        characteristic | this | bhikkhave | whoever | is composed | reality as it is | know | see
        This characteristic, Bhikkhave, reality as it is, is seen and known for whoever is composed.

        1.22 YathÄbhÅ«taá¹, bhikkhave, jÄnato passato na cetanÄya karaá¹‡Ä«yaá¹:
        ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(yathÄbhÅ«ta) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨‚(bhikkhu) ğŸš»â‘£â¨€(jÄnanta) ğŸš¹â‘£â¨€(passanta) ğŸ”¼(no) ğŸšºâ‘¢â¨€(cetana) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(karaá¹‡Ä«ya)
        reality as it is | bhikkhave | for knowing | for seeing | no | with intention | ought to be done
        One who sees and know reality as it is, Bhikkhave, has nothing that ought to be done with intention.

        1.23 â€˜nibbindÄmi virajjÄmÄ«â€™ti.
        â¹ğŸ‘†â¨€(nibbindati) â¹ğŸ‘†â¨€(virajjati) ğŸ”¼(ti)
        must be dispassionate | must be detached | quote
        â€œMay I be dispassionate and detached.â€

        1.24 DhammatÄ esÄ, bhikkhave, yaá¹ yathÄbhÅ«taá¹ jÄnaá¹ passaá¹ nibbindati virajjati.
        ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(dhammatÄ) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(eta) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨‚(bhikkhu) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(ya) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(yathÄbhÅ«ta) ğŸš¹â‘£â¨‚(ja) ğŸš¹â‘£â¨‚(passanta) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(nibbindati) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(virajjati)
        characteristic | this | bhikkhave | whoever | reality as it is | knowing | seeing | become dispassionate | become detached
        This characteristic, Bhikkhave, one becomes dispassionate and detached for whoever seeing and knowing reality as it is.

        1.25 Nibbinnassa, bhikkhave, virattassa na cetanÄya karaá¹‡Ä«yaá¹:
        ğŸš¹â‘¥â¨€(nibbinna) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨‚(bhikkhu) ğŸš¹â‘¥â¨€(viratta) ğŸ”¼(no) ğŸšºâ‘¢â¨€(cetana) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(karaá¹‡Ä«ya)
        of dispassionate | bhikkhave | of detached | no | with intention | ought to be done
        One who becomes dispassionate and detached, Bhikkhave, has nothing that ought to be done with intention.

        1.26 â€˜vimuttiÃ±Äá¹‡adassanaá¹ sacchikaromÄ«â€™ti.
        ğŸš»â‘¡â¨€(vimuttiÃ±Äá¹‡adassana) â¹ğŸ‘†â¨€(sacchikaroti) ğŸ”¼(ti)
        understanding and insight into liberation | must personally realises | quote
        â€œMay I personally realise understanding and insight into liberation.â€

        1.27 DhammatÄ esÄ, bhikkhave, yaá¹ nibbinno viratto vimuttiÃ±Äá¹‡adassanaá¹ sacchikaroti.
        ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(dhammatÄ) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(eta) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨‚(bhikkhu) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(ya) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(nibbinna) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(viratta) ğŸš»â‘¡â¨€(vimuttiÃ±Äá¹‡adassana) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(sacchikaroti)
        characteristic | this | bhikkhave | whoever | one who is dispassionate | one who is detached | understanding and insight into liberation | personally realises
        This characteristic, Bhikkhave, one personally realises understanding and insight into liberation for whoever is dispassionate and detached.

        19. THE ORIGIN AND CONTROL OF SUFFERING

        Dukkhasamudayasutta SN 35.106 PTS 4.87 (Samyutta Nikaya IV 86):

        2.2 CakkhuÃ±ca paá¹­icca rÅ«pe ca uppajjati cakkhuviÃ±Ã±Äá¹‡aá¹. Tiá¹‡á¹‡aá¹ saá¹…gati phasso.
        ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(cakkhu) ğŸ”¼(ca) ğŸ”¼(paá¹­icca) ğŸš»â‘¦â¨€(rÅ«pa) ğŸ”¼(ca) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(uppajjati) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(cakkhuviÃ±Ã±Äá¹‡a) ğŸš¹â‘¥â¨‚(ti) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(saá¹…gati) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(phassa)
        faculty of seeing | and | dependent on | on form | and | arises | visual-consciousness | of 3 | combined together| contact
        Visual consciousness (cakkhuviÃ±Ã±Äá¹‡a) arises dependent on rÅ«pa (form) and the faculty of seeing. The three combined together is phassa (contact).

        2.3 PhassapaccayÄ vedanÄ;
        ğŸšºâ‘ â¨‚(phassapaccaya) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨‚(vedanÄ)
        dependent on contact | feelings
        Dependent on phassa (contact), vedanÄ (feelings).

        2.4 vedanÄpaccayÄ taá¹‡hÄ.
        ğŸšºâ‘ â¨‚(vedanÄpaccayÄ) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨‚(taá¹‡hÄ)
        dependent on feelings | craving
        Dependent on vedanÄ (feelings), taá¹‡hÄ (craving).

        2.5 TassÄyeva taá¹‡hÄya asesavirÄganirodhÄ upÄdÄnanirodho;
        ğŸ”¼(tassÄyeva) ğŸšºâ‘¥â¨€(taá¹‡hÄ) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(asesavirÄganirodha) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(upÄdÄnanirodha)
        of that very | of craving | complete fading away and ending | cessation of grasping
        While completely fading away and ending of craving, cessation of grasping.

        2.6 upÄdÄnanirodhÄ bhavanirodho;
        ğŸš¹â‘¤â¨€(upÄdÄnanirodha) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(bhavanirodha)
        from cessation of grasping | cessation of being
        From cessation of grasping, cessation of being.

        2.7 bhavanirodhÄ jÄtinirodho;
        ğŸš¹â‘¤â¨€(bhavanirodha) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(jÄtinirodha)
        from cessation of being | cessation of birth
        From cessation of being, cessation of birth.

        2.8 jÄtinirodhÄ jarÄmaraá¹‡aá¹ sokaparidevadukkhadomanassupÄyÄsÄ nirujjhanti.
        ğŸš¹â‘¤â¨€(jÄtinirodha) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(jarÄmaraá¹‡a) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(sokaparidevadukkhadomanassupÄyÄsÄ) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨‚(nirujjhati)
        From cessation of birth | old age | grief, wailing, pain, suffering and trouble | cease
        From cessation of birth, old age, grief, wailing, pain, suffering and trouble cease.

        2.9 Evametassa kevalassa dukkhakkhandhassa nirodho hoti.
        ğŸ”¼(evametassa) ğŸš¹â‘¥â¨€(kevala) ğŸš¹â‘¥â¨€(dukkhakkhandha) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(nirodha) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(hoti)
        thus of this | of whole lot | of mass of suffering | cessation | is
        Thus of this whole lot, there is cessation of mass of suffering.

        2.10 Ayaá¹ dukkhassa atthaá¹…gamo
        ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(ima) ğŸš¹â‘¥â¨€(dukkha) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(atthaá¹…gama)
        this | suffering | disappearance of
        This is disappearance of dukkha (suffering).

        20. EVERYTHING IS CAUSED

        SelÄsutta SN 5.9 PTS (1st ed) SN i 134 PTS (2nd ed) 1.295 (Samyutta Nikaya I 134):

        5.1 YathÄ aÃ±Ã±ataraá¹ bÄ«jaá¹,
        ğŸ”¼(yathÄ) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(aÃ±Ã±atara) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(bÄ«ja)
        like | a certain | seed
        5.2 khette vuttaá¹ virÅ«hati;
        ğŸš»â‘¦â¨€(khetta) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(vutta) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(virÅ«hati)
        in field | sown | grows
        5.3 PathavÄ«rasaÃ±cÄgamma,
        ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(pathavÄ«rasa) ğŸ”¼(ca) ğŸ”¼(Ägamma)
        soil nutrients | and | meeting with
        5.4 sinehaÃ±ca tadÅ«bhayaá¹.
        ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(sineha) ğŸ”¼(ca) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(tadÅ«bhaya)
        moisture | and | both of those

        6.1 Evaá¹ khandhÄ ca dhÄtuyo,
        ğŸ”¼(evaá¹ƒ) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(khandha) ğŸ”¼(ca) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨‚(dhÄtu)
        thus | masses | and | elements
        6.2 cha ca ÄyatanÄ ime;
        âš§â‘ â¨‚(cha) ğŸ”¼(ca) ğŸš»â‘ â¨‚(Äyatana) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(ima)
        six | and | senses | these
        6.3 Hetuá¹ paá¹­icca sambhÅ«tÄ,
        ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(hetu) ğŸ”¼(paá¹­icca) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(sambhÅ«ta)
        reason for | dependence | arisen
        6.4 hetubhaá¹…gÄ nirujjhareâ€ti.
        ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(hetubhaá¹…ga) ğŸ”µâ–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨‚(nirujjhati)
        disintegration of dependence | ceases

        Like a certain seed,
        Sown in field, grows;
        Meeting with soil nutrients,
        and moisture, both of these.

        Thus, the masses and elements,
        And these six senses;
        Reason for arise of dependence,
        Disintegration of dependence, ceases

        21. MAN FORMS HIS OWN DESTINY

        Paá¹‡á¸itavagga Dhp 76â€“89 PTS (1st ed) 12â€“13 PTS (2nd ed) 22â€“25 Paá¹‡á¸itasÄmaá¹‡eravatthu (Dhammapada, verse 80):

        1 UdakaÃ±hi nayanti nettikÄ,
        ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(udaka) ğŸ”¼(hi) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨‚(nayati) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(nettika)
        water | certainly | guides | irrigator
        2 UsukÄrÄ namayanti tejanaá¹;
        ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(usukÄra) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨‚(namayati) ğŸš»â‘¡â¨€(tejana)
        arrow-maker | straighten | arrow
        3 DÄruá¹ namayanti tacchakÄ,
        ğŸš»â‘¡â¨€(dÄru) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨‚(namayati) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(tacchaka)
        wood | straighten | carpenters
        4 AttÄnaá¹ damayanti paá¹‡á¸itÄ.
        ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(atta) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨‚(damayati) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(paá¹‡á¸ita)
        self | tames | the wise

        Irrigators guide water,
        Arrow makers straighten arrow;
        Carpenters straighten wood,
        The wise tames the self.

        22. KARMA SOMETIMES WORKS SLOWLY

        BÄlavagga Dhp 60â€“75 PTS (1st ed) 10â€“11 PTS (2nd ed) 17â€“20 Ahipetavatthu (Dhammapada, verse 71):

        1 Na hi pÄpaá¹ kataá¹ kammaá¹,
        ğŸ”¼(nahi) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(pÄpa) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(kata) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(kamma)
        by no means | wrong | completed | action
        2 SajjukhÄ«raá¹va muccati;
        ğŸ”¼(sajju) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(khÄ«ra) ğŸ”¼(iva) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(muccati)
        quickly | milk | like | thicken
        3 á¸Œahantaá¹ bÄlamanveti,
        ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(á¸ahanta) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(bÄla) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(anveti)
        smouldering | foolish | follow
        4 Bhasmacchannova pÄvako.
        ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(bhasmacchanna) ğŸ”¼(iva) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(pÄvaka)
        covered with ashes | like | fire

        By no means completed wrong action,
        Thickens quickly like milk;
        Smouldering, heedlessly follows,
        Like fire covered with ashes.

        23. HOW REBIRTH IS INFLUENCED BY ACTIONS

        Saá¹…khÄrasutta AN 3.23 PTS 1.123(Anguttara Nikaya I 122):

        1.3 Idha,, ekacco puggalo sabyÄbajjhaá¹ kÄyasaá¹…khÄraá¹ abhisaá¹…kharoti, sabyÄbajjhaá¹ vacÄ«saá¹…khÄraá¹ abhisaá¹…kharoti, sabyÄbajjhaá¹ manosaá¹…khÄraá¹ abhisaá¹…kharoti.
        ğŸ”¼(idha) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(ekacca) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(puggala) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(sabyÄbajjha) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(kÄyasaá¹…khÄra) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(abhisaá¹…kharoti) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(sabyÄbajjha) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(vacÄ«saá¹…khÄra) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(abhisaá¹…kharoti) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(sabyÄbajjha) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(manosaá¹…khÄra) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(abhisaá¹…kharoti)
        here | a certain | person | harmful | intention which results in bodily action | generates | harmful | intention which results in verbal action | generates | harmful | intention which results in mental action | generates
        Here, a certain person generates harmful intentions resulting in bodily, verbal and mental actions.

        1.4 So sabyÄbajjhaá¹ kÄyasaá¹…khÄraá¹ abhisaá¹…kharitvÄ, sabyÄbajjhaá¹ vacÄ«saá¹…khÄraá¹ abhisaá¹…kharitvÄ, sabyÄbajjhaá¹ manosaá¹…khÄraá¹ abhisaá¹…kharitvÄ sabyÄbajjhaá¹ lokaá¹ upapajjati.
        ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(ta) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(sabyÄbajjha) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(kÄyasaá¹…khÄra) ğŸ”¼(abhisaá¹…kharitvÄ) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(sabyÄbajjha) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(vacÄ«saá¹…khÄra) ğŸ”¼(abhisaá¹…kharitvÄ) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(sabyÄbajjha) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(manosaá¹…khÄra) ğŸ”¼(abhisaá¹…kharitvÄ) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(sabyÄbajjha) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(loka) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(upapajjati)
        he | harmful | intention which results in bodily action | having generated | harmful | intention which results in verbal action | having generated | harmful | intention which results in mental action | having generated | harmful | world | is reborn in
        Having generated harmful intentions resulting in bodily, verbal and mental actions, he is reborn in a harmful world.

        1.5 Tamenaá¹ sabyÄbajjhaá¹ lokaá¹ upapannaá¹ samÄnaá¹ sabyÄbajjhÄ phassÄ phusanti.
        ğŸ”¼(tamenaá¹ƒ) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(sabyÄbajjha) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(loka) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(upapanna) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(samÄna) ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨€(sabyÄbajjha) ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨€(phassa) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨‚(phusati)
        that person | harmful | world | is reborn in | being | with harmful | with contact | afflicted
        That being, who is reborn in a harmful world, is afflicted with harmful contact.

        1.6 So sabyÄbajjhehi phassehi phuá¹­á¹­ho samÄno sabyÄbajjhaá¹ vedanaá¹ vedayati ekantadukkhaá¹, seyyathÄpi sattÄ nerayikÄ.
        ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(ta) ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨‚(sabyÄbajjha) ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨‚(phassa) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(phuá¹­á¹­ha) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(samÄna) ğŸšºâ‘¡â¨€(sabyÄbajjha) ğŸšºâ‘¡â¨€(vedanÄ) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(vedayati) ğŸšºâ‘¡â¨€(ekantadukkha) ğŸ”¼(seyyathÄpi) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(satta) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(nerayika)
        that | with harmful | with contact | afflicted with | being | harmful | feelings | totally painful | just like | being | living in hell
        That being, who is afflicted with harmful contact, experiences totally painful harmful feelings just like beings living in hell.

        24. A STRONG WISH MAY INFLUENCE REBIRTH

        Saá¹…khÄrupapattisutta MN 120 PTS 3.100â€“3.103 (Majjhima Nikaya III 99 f):

        3.1 â€œIdha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu saddhÄya samannÄgato hoti, sÄ«lena samannÄgato hoti, sutena samannÄgato hoti, cÄgena samannÄgato hoti, paÃ±Ã±Äya samannÄgato hoti.
        ğŸ”¼(idha) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨‚(bhikkhu) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(bhikkhu) ğŸšºâ‘¢â¨€(saddha) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(samannÄgata) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(hoti) ğŸš»â‘¢â¨€(sÄ«la) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(samannÄgata) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(hoti) ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨€(suta) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(samannÄgata) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(hoti) ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨€(cÄga) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(samannÄgata) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(hoti) ğŸšºâ‘¢â¨€(paÃ±Ã±a) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(samannÄgata) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(hoti)
        here | bhikkhave | bhikkhu | with faith | endowed (with) | is | with virtue | endowed (with) | is | with learning | endowed (with) | is | with generosity | endowed (with) | is | with wisdom | endowed (with) | is
        Here, Bhikkhave, a bhikkhu is endowed with faith, virtue, learning, generosity and wisdom.

        3.2 Tassa evaá¹ hoti:
        ğŸ”¼(tassa evaá¹ƒ hoti)
        of that | thus | is
        It occurred to him:

        3.3 â€˜aho vatÄhaá¹ kÄyassa bhedÄ paraá¹ maraá¹‡Ä khattiyamahÄsÄlÄnaá¹ sahabyataá¹ upapajjeyyanâ€™ti.
        ğŸ”¼(aho) ğŸ”¼(vatÄhaá¹ƒ) ğŸš¹â‘¥â¨€(kÄya) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(bheda) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(para) ğŸš»â‘ â¨‚(maraá¹‡a) ğŸš¹â‘¥â¨‚(khattiyamahÄsÄla) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(sahabyatÄ) ğŸ”µâ¯ğŸ‘†â¨€(upapajjati) ğŸ”¼(ti)
        oh dear! | oh no! | of body | death | another | following | death | (for) wealthy man of the ruling caste | company of | should reborn
        â€œOh dear, oh no, death (of my) body, following death, I should be reborn in company of wealthy men of the ruling caste.â€

        3.4 So taá¹ cittaá¹ dahati, taá¹ cittaá¹ adhiá¹­á¹­hÄti, taá¹ cittaá¹ bhÄveti.
        ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(ta) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(ta) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(citta) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(dahati) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(ta) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(citta) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(adhiá¹­á¹­hÄti) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(ta) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(citta)
        he | his | mind | takes as | his | mind | focuses | his | mind | cultivates
        He takes his mind, focuses and cultivates it.

        3.5 Tassa te saá¹…khÄrÄ ca vihÄrÄ ca evaá¹ bhÄvitÄ evaá¹ bahulÄ«katÄ tatrupapattiyÄ saá¹vattanti.
        ğŸš¹â‘¥â¨€(ta) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(ta) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(saá¹…khÄra) ğŸ”¼(ca) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(vihÄra)ğŸ”¼(ca) ğŸ”¼(evaá¹ƒ) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(bhÄvita) ğŸ”¼(evaá¹ƒ) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(bahulÄ«kata) ğŸšºâ‘¦â¨€(tatrupapatti) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨‚(saá¹ƒvattati)
        of that | those | volitional thought processes | and | state of mind | and | thus | cultivated | thus | practised often | in rebirth | leads to
        Regarding that, those volitional thought processes and state of mind, thus cultivated and practised often, leads to rebirth.

        3.6 Ayaá¹, bhikkhave, maggo ayaá¹ paá¹­ipadÄ tatrupapattiyÄ saá¹vattati.
        ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(ima) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨‚(bhikkhu) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(magga) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(ima) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(paá¹­ipada) ğŸšºâ‘¦â¨€(tatrupapatti) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨‚(saá¹ƒvattati)
        this | bhikkhave | way | this | path of progress | in rebirth | leads to
        This way, Bhikkhave, this path of progress leads to rebirth.

        25. A SUMMARY OF THE WAY

        Buddhavagga Dhp 179â€“196 PTS (1st ed) 27â€“29 PTS (2nd ed) 51â€“55 Buddhavagga (Dhammapada, verse 183):

        1 SabbapÄpassa akaraá¹‡aá¹,
        ğŸš»â‘¥â¨€(sabbapÄpa) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(akaraá¹‡a)
        of all wrongdoing | non-doing of
        2 kusalassa upasampadÄ;
        ğŸš¹â‘¥â¨€(kusala) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(upasampadÄ)
        of wholesome | taking up
        3 Sacittapariyodapanaá¹,
        ğŸšºâ‘¡â¨€(sacittapariyodapanÄ)
        purifying one’s own mind
        4 etaá¹ buddhÄna sÄsanaá¹.
        ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(eta) ğŸš¹â‘¥â¨‚(buddha) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(sÄsana)
        this | of Buddha | teaching

        Non-doing of all wrongdoing,
        Taking up of wholesome;
        Purifying one’s own mind,
        This is the teaching of the Buddha.

        26. MONK OR NOT?

        Chabbisodhanasutta MN 112 PTS 3.30â€“3.37 (Majjhima Nikaya III 33):

        12.2 â€˜pubbe kho ahaá¹, Ävuso, agÄriyabhÅ«to samÄno aviddasu ahosiá¹.
        ğŸ”¼(pubbe) ğŸ”¼(kho) ğŸ‘†â‘ â¨€(ahaá¹ƒ) ğŸ”¼(Ävuso) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(agÄriyabhÅ«ta) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(samÄna) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(aviddasu) â®ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(ahosi)
        formerly | indeed | I | friend | living as a layman | being | ignorant | was
        Formerly, I was similar to an ignorant being, living as a layman.

        12.3 Tassa me tathÄgato vÄ tathÄgatasÄvako vÄ dhammaá¹ desesi.
        ğŸš¹â‘¥â¨€(ta) ğŸ‘†â‘¡â¨€(ahaá¹ƒ) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(tathÄgata) ğŸ”¼(vÄ) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(tathÄgatasÄvaka) ğŸ”¼(vÄ) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(dhamma) â®ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(desesi)
        of that | me | TathÄgata | or | disciple of the Buddha | or | Dhamma | taught
        Because of that, the TathÄgata and his disciples taught the Dhamma to me.

        12.4 TÄhaá¹ dhammaá¹ sutvÄ tathÄgate saddhaá¹ paá¹­ilabhiá¹.
        ğŸ”¼(tÄhaá¹ƒ) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(dhamma) ğŸ”¼(sutvÄ) ğŸš¹â‘¦â¨€(tathÄgata) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(saddha) â®ğŸ‘†â¨€(paá¹­ilabhi)
        that I | Dhamma | having heard | in TathÄgata | faith | I acquired
        Having heard that Dhamma, I acquired faith in the TathÄgata.

        12.5 So tena saddhÄpaá¹­ilÄbhena samannÄgato iti paá¹­isaÃ±cikkhiá¹:
        ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(ta) ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨€(ta) ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨€(saddhÄpaá¹­ilÄbha) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(samannÄgata) ğŸ”¼(iti) â®ğŸ‘†â¨€(paá¹­isaÃ±cikkhi)
        that | by that | gaining of faith | endowed with | like this | reflected
        I reflected like that, endowed with the the gaining of that faith.

        12.6 â€œsambÄdho gharÄvÄso rajÄpatho, abbhokÄso pabbajjÄ.
        ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(sambÄdha) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(gharÄvÄsa) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(rajÄpatha) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(pabbajjÄ)
        crowded | household life | dirty | open space | renunciation
        Household life is crowded and dirty, renunciation is open space.

        12.7 Nayidaá¹ sukaraá¹ agÄraá¹ ajjhÄvasatÄ ekantaparipuá¹‡á¹‡aá¹ ekantaparisuddhaá¹ saá¹…khalikhitaá¹ brahmacariyaá¹ carituá¹.
        ğŸ”¼(nayidaá¹ƒ) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(sukara) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(agÄra) ğŸš¹â‘¤â¨€(ajjhÄvasanta) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(ekantaparipuá¹‡á¹‡a) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(saá¹…khalikhita) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(brahmacariya) ğŸ”¼(carituá¹ƒ)
        not this | easy to do | domestic living | domestic settled | completely perfect | flawless | spiritual path | to live
        It is not easy from being settled in domestic living to living a completely perfect and flawless spiritual path.

        12.8 YannÅ«nÄhaá¹ kesamassuá¹ ohÄretvÄ kÄsÄyÄni vatthÄni acchÄdetvÄ agÄrasmÄ anagÄriyaá¹ pabbajeyyanâ€ti.
        ğŸ”¼(yannÅ«nÄhaá¹ƒ) ğŸš»â‘¡â¨€(kesamassu) ğŸ”¼(ohÄretvÄ) ğŸš»â‘¡â¨‚(kÄsÄya) ğŸš»â‘¡â¨‚(vattha) ğŸ”¼(acchÄdetvÄ) ğŸš»â‘¤â¨€(agÄra) ğŸš»â‘¡â¨€(anagÄriya) ğŸ”µâ¯ğŸ‘†â¨€(pabbajati) ğŸ”¼(ti)
        what if I were to | hair and beard | having shaved off | ochre | robe | having put on | from household life | to homeless state | renounce | quote
        What if I were to renounce from household life to homeless state, having shaved off hair and heard, and having put on ochre robe.

        13.1 So kho ahaá¹, Ävuso, aparena samayena appaá¹ vÄ bhogakkhandhaá¹ pahÄya mahantaá¹ vÄ bhogakkhandhaá¹ pahÄya, appaá¹ vÄ Ã±Ätiparivaá¹­á¹­aá¹ pahÄya mahantaá¹ vÄ Ã±Ätiparivaá¹­á¹­aá¹ pahÄya kesamassuá¹ ohÄretvÄ kÄsÄyÄni vatthÄni acchÄdetvÄ agÄrasmÄ anagÄriyaá¹ pabbajiá¹.
        ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(ta) ğŸ”¼(kho) ğŸ‘†â‘ â¨€(ahaá¹ƒ) ğŸ”¼(Ävuso) ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨€(apara) ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨€(samaya) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(appa) ğŸ”¼(vÄ) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(bhogakkhandha) ğŸ”¼(pahÄya) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(mahanta) ğŸ”¼(vÄ) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(bhogakkhandha) ğŸ”¼(pahÄya) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(appa) ğŸ”¼(vÄ) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(Ã±Ätiparivaá¹­á¹­a) ğŸ”¼(pahÄya) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(mahanta) ğŸ”¼(vÄ) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(Ã±Ätiparivaá¹­á¹­a) ğŸ”¼(pahÄya) ğŸš»â‘¡â¨€(kesamassu) ğŸ”¼(ohÄretvÄ) ğŸš»â‘¡â¨‚(kÄsÄya) ğŸš»â‘¡â¨‚(vattha) ğŸ”¼(acchÄdetvÄ) ğŸš»â‘¤â¨€(agÄra) ğŸš»â‘¡â¨€(anagÄriya) â®ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(pabbaji)
        that | indeed | I | friend | with next | with time | small | or | pile of wealth | leaving behind | large | or | pile of wealth | leaving behind | small | or | family circle | leaving behind | large | or | family circle | leaving behind | hair and beard | having shaved off | ochre | robe | having put on | from household life | to homeless state | renounced
        Indeed, friend, after some time, having left behind a small or large pile of wealth, and a small or large family circle, I renounced from household life to homeless state, having shaved off hair and heard, and having put on ochre robe.

        27. THE FIRST PART OF THE WAY: RIGHT VIEW

        MahÄsatipaá¹­á¹­hÄnasutta DN 22 PTS 2.290â€“2.315 (Digha Nikaya II 311 f):

        21.4 KatamÄ ca, bhikkhave, sammÄdiá¹­á¹­hi?
        ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(katama) ğŸ”¼(ca) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨‚(bhikkhu) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(sammÄdiá¹­á¹­hi)
        what? | and | bhikkhave | right view
        Bhikkhave, and what is “sammÄdiá¹­á¹­hi” (right view)?

        21.5 Yaá¹ kho, bhikkhave, dukkhe Ã±Äá¹‡aá¹, dukkhasamudaye Ã±Äá¹‡aá¹, dukkhanirodhe Ã±Äá¹‡aá¹, dukkhanirodhagÄminiyÄ paá¹­ipadÄya Ã±Äá¹‡aá¹.
        ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(ya) ğŸ”¼(kho) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨‚(bhikkhu) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨‚(dukkha) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(Ã±Äá¹‡a) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨‚(dukkhasamudaya) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(Ã±Äá¹‡a) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨‚(dukkhanirodha) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(Ã±Äá¹‡a) ğŸšºâ‘£â¨€(dukkhanirodhagÄmÄ«) ğŸšºâ‘¥â¨€(paá¹­ipadÄ) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(Ã±Äá¹‡a)
        whatever | indeed | bhikkhave | suffering | understanding | origin of suffering | understanding | end of suffering | understanding | of leading to the end of suffering | of path of progress | understanding
        Whatever indeed, Bhikkhave, understanding suffering, understanding source of suffering, understanding end of suffering, understanding of the path of progress leading to the end of suffering.

        21.6 Ayaá¹ vuccati, bhikkhave, sammÄdiá¹­á¹­hi.
        ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(ima) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(vuccati) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨‚(bhikkhu) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(sammÄdiá¹­á¹­hi)
        this | is said | bhikkhave | right view
        Bhikkhave, this said to be “sammÄdiá¹­á¹­hi” (right view).

        28. RIGHT PURPOSE

        MahÄsatipaá¹­á¹­hÄnasutta DN 22 PTS 2.290â€“2.315 (Digha Nikaya II 312):

        21.7 Katamo ca, bhikkhave, sammÄsaá¹…kappo?
