        29. RIGHT SPEECH

        MahÄsatipaá¹­á¹­hÄnasutta DN 22 PTS 2.290â€“2.315 (Digha Nikaya II 312):

        21.10 KatamÄ ca, bhikkhave, sammÄvÄcÄ?
        ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(katama) ğŸ”¼(ca) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨‚(bhikkhu) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(sammÄvÄca)
        what? | and | bhikkhave | right speech
        Bhikkhave, and what is “sammÄvÄca” (right speech)?

        21.11 MusÄvÄdÄ veramaá¹‡Ä« pisuá¹‡Äya vÄcÄya veramaá¹‡Ä« pharusÄya vÄcÄya veramaá¹‡Ä« samphappalÄpÄ veramaá¹‡Ä«.
        ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(musÄvÄda) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(veramaá¹‡Ä«) ğŸšºâ‘¤â¨€(pisuá¹‡a) ğŸšºâ‘¤â¨€(vÄca) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(veramaá¹‡Ä«) ğŸšºâ‘¤â¨€(pharusa) ğŸšºâ‘¤â¨€(vÄca) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(veramaá¹‡Ä«) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(samphappalÄpa) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(veramaá¹‡Ä«)
        false speech | abstinence from | from slanderous | from speech | abstinence from | from harsh | from speech | abstinence from | gossip | abstinence from
        Abstinence from false speech, abstinence from slanderous speech, abstinence from harsh speech, abstinence from gossip.

        21.12 Ayaá¹ vuccati, bhikkhave, sammÄvÄcÄ.
        ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(ima) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(vuccati) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨‚(bhikkhu) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(sammÄvÄca)
        this | is said | bhikkhave | right speech
        Bhikkhave, this said to be “sammÄvÄca” (right speech).

        30. A MORE DETAILED DEFINITION OF RIGHT SPEECH

        UpÄlisutta AN 10.99 PTS 5.202â€“5.209 (Anguttara Nikaya V 205):

        14.1 MusÄvÄdaá¹ pahÄya musÄvÄdÄ paá¹­ivirato hoti saccavÄdÄ« saccasandho theto paccayiko avisaá¹vÄdako lokassa.
        ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(musÄvÄda) ğŸ”¼(pahÄya) ğŸš¹â‘¤â¨€(musÄvÄda) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(paá¹­ivirata) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(hoti) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(saccavÄdÄ«) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(saccasandha) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(theta) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(paccayika) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(avisaá¹ƒvÄdaka) ğŸš¹â‘£â¨€(loka)
        false speech | giving up | from false speech | abstaining from | is | truthful | true to one’s word | honest | reliable | keeping promises | for people of the world
        Giving up false speech, abstaining from false speech, being truthful, true to one’s word, honest, reliable, keeping promises for everyone in the world.

        15.1 Pisuá¹‡aá¹ vÄcaá¹ pahÄya pisuá¹‡Äya vÄcÄya paá¹­ivirato hoti, ito sutvÄ na amutra akkhÄtÄ imesaá¹ bhedÄya, amutra vÄ sutvÄ na imesaá¹ akkhÄtÄ amÅ«saá¹ bhedÄya. Iti bhinnÄnaá¹ vÄ sandhÄtÄ sahitÄnaá¹ vÄ anuppadÄtÄ, samaggÄrÄmo samaggarato samagganandÄ«; samaggakaraá¹‡iá¹ vÄcaá¹ bhÄsitÄ hoti.
        ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(pisuá¹‡a) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(vÄca) ğŸ”¼(pahÄya) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(pisuá¹‡a) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(vÄca) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(paá¹­ivirata) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(hoti) ğŸ”¼(ito) ğŸ”¼(sutvÄ) ğŸ”¼(na) ğŸ”¼(amutra) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(akkhÄta) ğŸš¹â‘£â¨‚(ima) ğŸš¹â‘£â¨€(bheda) ğŸ”¼(amutra) ğŸ”¼(vÄ) ğŸ”¼(sutvÄ) ğŸ”¼(na) ğŸš¹â‘£â¨‚(ima) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(akkhÄta) ğŸš¹â‘£â¨‚(amu) ğŸš¹â‘£â¨€(bheda) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(hoti)
        slanderous | speech | giving up | slanderous | speech | abstaining from | is | here | having listened | no | in such-and-such a place | told | for this | for disturbing/upsetting | in such-and-such a place | or | heaving listened | no | for this | told | for so-and-so | for disturbing.
        Giving up slanderous speech, abstaining from slanderous speech. Having listened here, does not tell in such-and-such place for the purposes of disturbance, or having listened in such and such place, does not tell here for the purposes of disturbance.
        ğŸ”¼(iti) ğŸš¹â‘¥â¨‚(bhinna) ğŸ”¼(vÄ) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(sandhÄtar) ğŸš¹â‘¥â¨‚(sahita) ğŸ”¼(vÄ) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(anuppadÄtar) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(samaggÄrÄma) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(samaggarata) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(samagganandÄ«) ğŸšºâ‘¡â¨€(samaggakaraá¹‡a) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(vÄca) ğŸš»â‘ â¨‚(bhÄsita)
        like this | of broken | conciliator | of friendly terms | or provider of | enjoying concord | liking harmony | delights in unity | peace-making | speech | talking
        Conciliator of the broken, provider of friendly terms, enjoying concord, liking harmony, delighting in unity, talking peace-making speech.

        16.1 Pharusaá¹ vÄcaá¹ pahÄya pharusÄya vÄcÄya paá¹­ivirato hoti. YÄ sÄ vÄcÄ nelÄ kaá¹‡á¹‡asukhÄ pemanÄ«yÄ hadayaá¹…gamÄ porÄ« bahujanakantÄ bahujanamanÄpÄ, tathÄrÅ«piá¹ vÄcaá¹ bhÄsitÄ hoti.
        ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(pharusa) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(vÄca) ğŸ”¼(pahÄya) ğŸšºâ‘¤â¨€(pharusa) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(vÄca) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(paá¹­ivirata) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(hoti)
        harsh speech | giving up | from harsh speech | abstaining from | is Giving up harsh speech, abstaining from harsh speech.
        ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(ya) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(ta) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(vÄca) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(nela) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(kaá¹‡á¹‡asukha) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(pemanÄ«ya) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(hadayaá¹…gama) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(porÄ«) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(bahujanakanta) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(bahujanamanÄpa) ğŸšºâ‘¡â¨€(tathÄrÅ«pa) ğŸšºâ‘¡â¨€(vÄca) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(bhÄsita) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(hoti)
        whatever | that | speech | gentle | pleasant to hear | friendly | heart warming | polite | loved by the people | charming to the masses | appropriate | speech | talking | is
        Whatever that speech is, it is gentle, pleasant to hear, friendly, heart-warming, polite, loved by the people, charming to the masses, talking appropriate speech.

        17.1 SamphappalÄpaá¹ pahÄya samphappalÄpÄ paá¹­ivirato hoti kÄlavÄdÄ« bhÅ«tavÄdÄ« atthavÄdÄ« dhammavÄdÄ« vinayavÄdÄ«, nidhÄnavatiá¹ vÄcaá¹ bhÄsitÄ hoti kÄlena sÄpadesaá¹ pariyantavatiá¹ atthasaá¹hitaá¹.
        ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(samphappalÄpa) ğŸ”¼(pahÄya) ğŸš¹â‘¤â¨€(samphappalÄpa) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(paá¹­ivirata) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(hoti) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(kÄlavÄdÄ«) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(bhÅ«tavÄdÄ«) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(atthavÄdÄ«) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(dhammavÄdÄ«) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(vinayavÄdÄ«) ğŸšºâ‘¡â¨€(nidhÄnavant) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(vÄca) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(bhÄsita) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(hoti) ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨€(kÄla) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(sÄpadesa) ğŸšºâ‘¡â¨€(pariyantavant) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(atthasaá¹ƒhita)
        gossip | giving up | from gossip | abstaining from | is | speaking at the proper time | speaking what is true | speaking what is meaningful | speaking about the Dhamma | speaking about the discipline | worth remembering | speech | talking | is | timely | reasonable | purposeful | beneficial
        Giving up gossip, abstaining from gossip, speaking at the proper time, speaking what is true, speaking what is meaningful, speaking about the Dhamma, speaking about the discipline, talking speech worth remembering, timely, reasonable, purposeful, beneficial.

        31. RIGHT ACTION

        MahÄsatipaá¹­á¹­hÄnasutta DN 22 PTS 2.290â€“2.315 (Digha Nikaya II 312):

        21.13 Katamo ca, bhikkhave, sammÄkammanto?
        ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(katama) ğŸ”¼(ca) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨‚(bhikkhu) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(sammÄkammanta)
        what? | and | bhikkhave | right conduct
        Bhikkhave, and what is “sammÄkammanta” (right conduct)?

        21.14 PÄá¹‡ÄtipÄtÄ veramaá¹‡Ä« adinnÄdÄnÄ veramaá¹‡Ä« kÄmesumicchÄcÄrÄ veramaá¹‡Ä«.
        ğŸš¹â‘¤â¨€(pÄá¹‡ÄtipÄta) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(veramaá¹‡Ä«) ğŸš»â‘¤â¨€(adinnÄdÄna) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(veramaá¹‡Ä«) ğŸš¹â‘¤â¨€(kÄmesumicchÄcÄra) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(veramaá¹‡Ä«)
        from killing living beings | abstinence from | from theft | abstinence from | from sexual misconduct | abstinence from
        Abstinence from killing living beings, abstinence from theft, abstinence from sexual misconduct.

        21.15 Ayaá¹ vuccati, bhikkhave, sammÄkammanto.
        ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(ima) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(vuccati) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨‚(bhikkhu) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(sammÄkammanta)
        this | is said | bhikkhave | right conduct
        Bhikkhave, this said to be “sammÄkammanta” (right conduct).

        32. HOW THE PERFECT ONES LIVE

        Uposathasutta AN 3.70 PTS 1.206â€“1.215 (Anguttara Nikaya I 211 f):

        21.1 YÄvajÄ«vaá¹ arahanto abrahmacariyaá¹ pahÄya brahmacÄrÄ« ÄrÄcÄrÄ« viratÄ methunÄ gÄmadhammÄ;
        ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(yÄvajÄ«va) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(arahant) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(abrahmacariya) ğŸ”¼(pahÄya) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(brahmacÄri) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(ÄrÄcÄrÄ«) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(virata) ğŸš¹â‘¤â¨€(methuna) ğŸš¹â‘¤â¨€(gÄmadhamma)
        life-long | awakened beings | incelibacy | giving up | celibate spiritual practitioner | keeping far away from | abstained from | from sexual intercourse | from vulgar practice
        Life long arahants (awakened beings) give up incelibacy, practice celibacy, keep far away from sexual intercourse, abstain from vulgar practice.

        23.1 YÄvajÄ«vaá¹ arahanto surÄmerayamajjapamÄdaá¹­á¹­hÄnaá¹ pahÄya surÄmerayamajjapamÄdaá¹­á¹­hÄnÄ paá¹­iviratÄ;
        ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(yÄvajÄ«va) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(arahant) ğŸš»â‘¡â¨€(surÄmerayamajjapamÄdaá¹­á¹­hÄna) ğŸ”¼(pahÄya) ğŸš»â‘¤â¨€(surÄmerayamajjapamÄdaá¹­á¹­hÄna) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(paá¹­ivirata)
        life-long | awakened beings | wine, spirits, drugs and states of intoxication | giving up | wine, spirits, drugs and states of intoxication | abstained from

        Life long arahants (awakened beings) give up and abstains from wine, spirits, drugs and states of intoxication.
        24.1 YÄvajÄ«vaá¹ arahanto ekabhattikÄ rattÅ«paratÄ viratÄ vikÄlabhojanÄ; ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(yÄvajÄ«va) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(arahant) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(ekabhattika) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(rattÅ«parata) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(virata) ğŸš»â‘ â¨‚(vikÄlabhojana)
        life-long | awakened beings | who eats one meal a day | abstaining from eating at night | stopped | eating between midday and dawn
        Life long arahants (awakened beings) eat one meal a day, abstain from eating at night, and between midday and dawn.

        25.1 YÄvajÄ«vaá¹ arahanto naccagÄ«tavÄditavisÅ«kadassanamÄlÄgandhavilepanadhÄraá¹‡amaá¹‡á¸anavibhÅ«sanaá¹­á¹­hÄnÄ paá¹­iviratÄ;
        ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(yÄvajÄ«va) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚((arahant) ğŸš» â‘¤â¨‚(naccagÄ«tavÄditavisÅ«kadassanamÄlÄgandhavilepanadhÄraá¹‡amaá¹‡á¸anavibhÅ«sanaá¹­á¹­hÄna) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(paá¹­ivirata)
        life-long | awakened beings | dancing, singing, instrumental music, watching shows, using garlands, perfumes, oils, adornments and decorations | abstained from
        Life long arahants (awakened beings) abstain from dancing, singing, instrumental music, watching shows, using garlands, perfumes, oils, adornments and decorations.

        26.1 YÄvajÄ«vaá¹ arahanto uccÄsayanamahÄsayanaá¹ pahÄya uccÄsayanamahÄsayanÄ paá¹­iviratÄ nÄ«caseyyaá¹ kappenti maÃ±cake vÄ tiá¹‡asanthÄrake vÄ;
        ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(yÄvajÄ«va) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚((arahant) ğŸš»â‘¡â¨€(uccÄsayanamahÄsayana) ğŸ”¼(pahÄya) ğŸš»â‘¤â¨€(uccÄsayanamahÄsayana) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(paá¹­ivirata) ğŸšºâ‘¡â¨€(nÄ«caseyyÄ) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨‚(kappeti) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨‚(maÃ±caka) ğŸ”¼(vÄ) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨‚(tiá¹‡asanthÄraka) ğŸ”¼(vÄ)
        life-long | awakened beings | large and luxurious beds | giving up | from large and luxurious beds | abstained from | low bed | prepare | small bed | or | spread of grass | or
        Life long arahants (awakened beings) give up and abstain from large and luxurious beds, prepare low or small beds, or spread of grass.

        33. RIGHT LIVELIHOOD

        MahÄsatipaá¹­á¹­hÄnasutta DN 22 PTS 2.290â€“2.315 (Digha Nikaya II 312):

        21.16 Katamo ca, bhikkhave, sammÄÄjÄ«vo?
        ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(katama) ğŸ”¼(ca) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨‚(bhikkhu) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(sammÄÄjÄ«va)
        what? | and | bhikkhave | right livelihood
        Bhikkhave, and what is “sammÄÄjÄ«va” (right livelihood)?

        21.17 Idha, bhikkhave, ariyasÄvako micchÄÄjÄ«vaá¹ pahÄya sammÄÄjÄ«vena jÄ«vitaá¹ kappeti.
        ğŸ”¼(idha) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨‚(bhikkhu) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(ariyasÄvaka) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(micchÄÄjÄ«va) ğŸ”¼(pahÄya) ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨€(sammÄÄjÄ«va) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(jÄ«vita) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(kappeti)
        here | bhikkhave | pure disciples | wrong livelihood | giving up | with right livelihood | way of life | prepares
        Here, Bhikkhave, pure disciples give up wrong livelihood, prepares for a way of life with right livelihood.

        21.18 Ayaá¹ vuccati, bhikkhave, sammÄÄjÄ«vo.
        ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(ima) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(vuccati) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨‚(bhikkhu) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(sammÄÄjÄ«va)
        this | is said | bhikkhave | right livelihood
        Bhikkhave, this said to be “sammÄÄjÄ«va” (right livelihood).

        34. WRONG LIVELIHOOD

        MahÄcattÄrÄ«sakasutta MN 117 PTS 3.72â€“3.78 (Majjhima Nikaya III 75):

        29.1 Katamo ca, bhikkhave, micchÄÄjÄ«vo?
        ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(katama) ğŸ”¼(ca) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨‚(bhikkhu) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(micchÄÄjÄ«va)
        what? | and | bhikkhave | wrong livelihood
        Bhikkhave, and what is “micchÄÄjÄ«va” (right livelihood)?

        29.2 KuhanÄ, lapanÄ, nemittikatÄ, nippesikatÄ, lÄbhena lÄbhaá¹ nijigÄ«sanatÄâ€”
        ğŸš»â‘ â¨‚(kuhana) ğŸš»â‘ â¨‚(lapana) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(nemittikatÄ) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(nippesikatÄ) ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨€(lÄbha) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(lÄbha) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(nijigÄ«sanatÄ)
        cheating | cajoling | indirect begging | putting others down | with profit | acquisition | desiring
        Cheating, cajoling, indirect begging, putting others down, desiring acquisition with profit.

        29.3 ayaá¹, bhikkhave, micchÄÄjÄ«vo.
        ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(ima) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨‚(bhikkhu) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(micchÄÄjÄ«va)
        this | bhikkhave | wrong livelihood
        Bhikkhave, this is “micchÄÄjÄ«va” (wrong livelihood).

        35. RIGHT EFFORT

        MahÄsatipaá¹­á¹­hÄnasutta DN 22 PTS 2.290â€“2.315 (Digha Nikaya II 312):

        21.19 Katamo ca, bhikkhave, sammÄvÄyÄmo?
        ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(katama) ğŸ”¼(ca) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨‚(bhikkhu) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(sammÄvÄyÄma)
        what? | and | bhikkhave | right effort
        Bhikkhave, and what is “sammÄvÄyÄma” (right effort)?

        21.20 Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu anuppannÄnaá¹ pÄpakÄnaá¹ akusalÄnaá¹ dhammÄnaá¹ anuppÄdÄya chandaá¹ janeti vÄyamati vÄ«riyaá¹ Ärabhati cittaá¹ paggaá¹‡hÄti padahati;
        ğŸ”¼(idha) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨‚(bhikkhu) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(bhikkhu) ğŸš¹â‘£â¨‚(anuppanna) ğŸš¹â‘¥â¨‚(pÄpaka) ğŸš¹â‘¥â¨‚(akusala) ğŸš¹â‘¥â¨‚(dhamma) ğŸš¹â‘£â¨€(anuppÄda) ğŸš¹ â‘¡â¨€(chanda) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(janeti) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(vÄyamati) ğŸš»â‘¡â¨€(vÄ«riya) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(Ärabhati) ğŸš»â‘¡â¨€(citta) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(paggaá¹‡hÄti) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(padahati)
        here | bhikkhave | bhikkhu | for non-arising | of evil | of unwholesome | of characteristics | for non-arising | desire | generates | tries to make an effort to | effort | start | mind | strives on | exerts oneself
        Here, Bhikkhave, a monk, for the non-arising of evil and unwholesome characteristics, generates a desire for non-arising, tries to make an effort, start, strives on the mind, and exerts himself.

        21.21 uppannÄnaá¹ pÄpakÄnaá¹ akusalÄnaá¹ dhammÄnaá¹ pahÄnÄya chandaá¹ janeti vÄyamati vÄ«riyaá¹ Ärabhati cittaá¹ paggaá¹‡hÄti padahati;
        ğŸš¹â‘£â¨‚(uppanna) ğŸš¹â‘¥â¨‚(pÄpaka) ğŸš¹â‘¥â¨‚(akusala) ğŸš¹â‘¥â¨‚(dhamma) ğŸš»â‘£â¨€(pahÄna) ğŸš¹ â‘¡â¨€(chanda) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(janeti) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(vÄyamati) ğŸš»â‘¡â¨€(vÄ«riya) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(Ärabhati) ğŸš»â‘¡â¨€(citta) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(paggaá¹‡hÄti) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(padahati)
        for arising | of evil | of unwholesome | of characteristics | for giving up of | desire | generates | tries to make an effort to | effort | start | mind | strives on | exerts oneself
        He generates a desire for the giving up of the arising of evil and unwholesome characteristics, tries to make an effort, start, strives on the mind, and exerts himself.

        21.22 anuppannÄnaá¹ kusalÄnaá¹ dhammÄnaá¹ uppÄdÄya chandaá¹ janeti vÄyamati vÄ«riyaá¹ Ärabhati cittaá¹ paggaá¹‡hÄti padahati;
        ğŸš¹â‘£â¨‚(anuppanna) ğŸš¹â‘¥â¨‚(kusala) ğŸš¹â‘¥â¨‚(dhamma) ğŸš¹â‘£â¨€(uppÄda) ğŸš¹ â‘¡â¨€(chanda) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(janeti) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(vÄyamati) ğŸš»â‘¡â¨€(vÄ«riya) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(Ärabhati) ğŸš»â‘¡â¨€(citta) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(paggaá¹‡hÄti) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(padahati)
        for non-arising | of unwholesome | of characteristics | for arising of | desire | generates | tries to make an effort to | effort | start | mind | strives on | exerts oneself
        for the non-arising of wholesome characteristics, he generates a desire for arising, tries to make an effort, start, strives on the mind, and exerts himself.

        21.23 uppannÄnaá¹ kusalÄnaá¹ dhammÄnaá¹ á¹­hitiyÄ asammosÄya bhiyyobhÄvÄya vepullÄya bhÄvanÄya pÄripÅ«riyÄ chandaá¹ janeti vÄyamati vÄ«riyaá¹ Ärabhati cittaá¹ paggaá¹‡hÄti padahati.
        ğŸš¹â‘£â¨‚(uppanna) ğŸš¹â‘¥â¨‚(kusala) ğŸš¹â‘¥â¨‚(dhamma) ğŸšºâ‘£â¨€(á¹­hiti) ğŸš¹â‘£â¨€(asammosa) ğŸš¹â‘£â¨€(bhiyyobhÄva) ğŸš»â‘£â¨€(vepulla) ğŸšºâ‘£â¨€(bhÄvanÄ) ğŸšºâ‘£â¨€(pÄripÅ«ri)ğŸš¹ â‘¡â¨€(chanda) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(janeti) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(vÄyamati) ğŸš»â‘¡â¨€(vÄ«riya) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(Ärabhati) ğŸš»â‘¡â¨€(citta) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(paggaá¹‡hÄti) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(padahati)
        for arising | of wholesome | of characteristics | for persistence of | for non-confusion | for increase of | for maturity | for developing | for fulfillment |desire | generates | tries to make an effort to | effort | start | mind | strives on | exerts oneself
        He generates a desire for the persistence of, non-confusion of, increase of, maturity of, developing of, fulfillment of the arising of wholesome characteristics, tries to make an effort, start, strives on the mind, and exerts himself.

        21.24 Ayaá¹ vuccati, bhikkhave, sammÄvÄyÄmo.
        ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(ima) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(vuccati) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨‚(bhikkhu) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(sammÄvÄyÄma)
        this | is said | bhikkhave | right effort
        Bhikkhave, this is said to be “sammÄvÄyÄma” (right effort).

        36. RIGHT MINDFULNESS

        MahÄsatipaá¹­á¹­hÄnasutta DN 22 PTS 2.290â€“2.315 (Digha Nikaya II 292):

        3.1 (Puna caparaá¹), bhikkhave, bhikkhu gacchanto vÄ â€˜gacchÄmÄ«â€™ti pajÄnÄti, á¹­hito vÄ â€˜á¹­hitomhÄ«â€™ti pajÄnÄti, nisinno vÄ â€˜nisinnomhÄ«â€™ti pajÄnÄti, sayÄno vÄ â€˜sayÄnomhÄ«â€™ti pajÄnÄti,
        ğŸ”¼(puna) ğŸ”¼(caparaá¹ƒ) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨‚(bhikkhu) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(bhikkhu) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(gacchanta) ğŸ”¼(vÄ) â–¶ï¸ğŸ‘†â¨€(gacchati) ğŸ”¼(ti) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(pajÄnÄti) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(á¹­hita) ğŸ”¼(vÄ) ğŸ”¼(á¹­hitomhi) ğŸ”¼(ti) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(pajÄnÄti) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(nisinna) ğŸ”¼(vÄ) ğŸ”¼(nisinnomhi) ğŸ”¼(ti) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(pajÄnÄti) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(sayÄna) ğŸ”¼(vÄ) ğŸ”¼(sayÄnomhi) ğŸ”¼(ti) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(pajÄnÄti)
        again | and what is more | bhikkhave | bhikkhu | walking | or | I walk | quote | knows clearly | standing | or | I am standing | quote | knows clearly | sitting | or | I am sitting | quote | knows clearly | lying down | or | I am lying down | quote | knows clearly
        (And furthermore) a bhikkhu when walking knows clearly â€œI am walkingâ€, when standing knows clearly â€œI am standingâ€, when sitting knows clearly â€œI am seatingâ€, when lying down knows clearly â€œI am lying downâ€.

        3.2 yathÄ yathÄ vÄ panassa kÄyo paá¹‡ihito hoti tathÄ tathÄ naá¹ pajÄnÄti.
        ğŸ”¼(yathÄ yathÄ) ğŸ”¼(vÄ) ğŸ”¼(panassa) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(kÄya) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(paá¹‡ihita) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(hoti) ğŸ”¼(tathÄ tathÄ) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(ta) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(pajÄnÄti)
        in whatever way | or | and for him | body | orientated | is | in that way | that | knows clearly
        In whatever way his body is orientated, in that way he knows clearly.

        3.3 Iti ajjhattaá¹ vÄ kÄye kÄyÄnupassÄ« viharati, bahiddhÄ vÄ kÄye kÄyÄnupassÄ« viharati, ajjhattabahiddhÄ vÄ kÄye kÄyÄnupassÄ« viharati.
        ğŸ”¼(iti) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(ajjhatta) ğŸ”¼(vÄ) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨‚(kÄya) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨‚(kÄyÄnupassÄ«) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(viharati) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(bahiddha) ğŸ”¼(vÄ) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨‚(kÄya) ğŸš¹ â‘¡â¨‚(kÄyÄnupassÄ«) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(viharati) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(ajjhattabahiddha) ğŸ”¼(vÄ) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨‚(kÄya) ğŸš¹ â‘¡â¨‚(kÄyÄnupassÄ«) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(viharati)
        like this | internally | or | bodies | observing the bodies | mindful | externally | or | bodies | observing the bodies | mindful | internal and external | or | bodies | observing the bodies | mindful
        In this way he is mindful of observing the body internally, externally, internally and externally (together).

        3.4 SamudayadhammÄnupassÄ« vÄ kÄyasmiá¹ viharati, vayadhammÄnupassÄ« vÄ kÄyasmiá¹ viharati, samudayavayadhammÄnupassÄ« vÄ kÄyasmiá¹ viharati.
        ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(samudayadhammÄnupassÄ«) ğŸ”¼(vÄ) ğŸš¹â‘¦â¨€(kÄya) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(viharati) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(vayadhammÄnupassÄ«) ğŸ”¼(vÄ) ğŸš¹â‘¦â¨€(kÄya) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(viharati) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(samudayavayadhammÄnupassÄ«) ğŸ”¼(vÄ) ğŸš¹â‘¦â¨€(kÄya) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(viharati)
        contemplating the nature of arising | or | in physical processes | mindful | contemplating the nature of disappearance | or | in physical processes | mindful | contemplating the nature of arising and disappearance | or | in physical processes | mindful
        He is mindful of contemplating the nature of arising, disappearance, arising and disappearing (together) of physical processes.

        3.5 â€˜Atthi kÄyoâ€™ti vÄ panassa sati paccupaá¹­á¹­hitÄ hoti yÄvadeva Ã±Äá¹‡amattÄya paá¹­issatimattÄya anissito ca viharati, na ca kiÃ±ci loke upÄdiyati.
        â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(atthi) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(kÄya) ğŸ”¼(ti) ğŸ”¼(panassa) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(sati) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(paccupaá¹­á¹­hita) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(hoti) ğŸ”¼(yÄvadeva) ğŸšºâ‘¢â¨€(Ã±Äá¹‡amattÄ) ğŸšºâ‘¢â¨€(paá¹­issatimattÄ) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(anissita) ğŸ”¼(ca) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(viharati) ğŸ”¼(na ca) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(kaci) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨‚(loka) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(upÄdiyati)
        there exists | physical body | quote | and for him | keeping in mind | presence established | as far as | by measure of understanding | by measure of continuous awareness | independent of | and | mindful | not | and | anything | world | cling
        And for him he keeps in mind and establishes â€œthere is a bodyâ€, and he is independent and mindful through understanding and continuous awareness, and he does not cling to anything in the world.

        4.1 (Puna caparaá¹, bhikkhave, bhikkhu abhikkante paá¹­ikkante sampajÄnakÄrÄ« hoti, Älokite vilokite sampajÄnakÄrÄ« hoti, samiÃ±jite pasÄrite sampajÄnakÄrÄ« hoti, saá¹…ghÄá¹­ipattacÄ«varadhÄraá¹‡e sampajÄnakÄrÄ« hoti, asite pÄ«te khÄyite sÄyite sampajÄnakÄrÄ« hoti, uccÄrapassÄvakamme sampajÄnakÄrÄ« hoti), gate á¹­hite nisinne sutte jÄgarite bhÄsite tuá¹‡hÄ«bhÄve sampajÄnakÄrÄ« hoti.
        ğŸ”¼(puna) ğŸ”¼(caparaá¹ƒ) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨‚(bhikkhu) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(bhikkhu) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨‚(abhikkanta) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨‚(paá¹­ikkanta) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(sampajÄnakÄrÄ«) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(hoti) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨‚(Älokita) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨‚(vilokita) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(sampajÄnakÄrÄ«) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(hoti) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨‚(samiÃ±jita) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨‚(pasÄrita) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(sampajÄnakÄrÄ«) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(hoti) ğŸš»â‘¡â¨‚(saá¹…ghÄá¹­ipattacÄ«varadhÄraá¹‡a) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(sampajÄnakÄrÄ«) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(hoti) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨‚(asita) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨‚(pÄ«ta) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨‚(khÄyita) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨‚(sÄyita) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(sampajÄnakÄrÄ«) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(hoti) ğŸš»â‘¡â¨‚(uccÄrapassÄvakamma) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(sampajÄnakÄrÄ«) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(hoti) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨‚(gata) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨‚(á¹­hita) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨‚(nisinna) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨‚(sutta) ğŸš»â‘¡â¨‚(jÄgarita) ğŸš»â‘¡â¨‚(bhÄsita) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨‚(tuá¹‡hÄ«bhÄva) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(sampajÄnakÄrÄ«) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(hoti)
        again | and what is more | bhikkhave | bhikkhu | going forward | coming back | attentive to | is | looking ahead | looking around | attentive to | is | flexing | stretching | attentive to | is | carrying the outer robe, bowl and robe | attentive to | is | eating | drinking | chewing | tasting | attentive to | is | going to the toilet | attentive to | is | walking | standing | sitting | sleeping | being awake | talking | keeping quiet | attentive to | is
        And what is more, bhikkhave, the bhikkhu is attentive to going forward, coming back, looking ahead, looking around, flexing, stretching, carrying the outer robe, bowl and robe, eating, drinking, chewing, tasting, going to the toilet, walking, standing, sitting, sleeping, being awake, talking, keeping quiet.

        37. IRRADIATION OF FRIENDLINESS, COMPASSION, TENDERNESS, AND EQUANIMITY

        Saá¹…gÄ«tisutta DN 33 PTS 3.207â€“3.271 (Digha Nikaya III 223 f):

        1.11.52 IdhÄvuso, bhikkhu mettÄsahagatena cetasÄ ekaá¹ disaá¹ pharitvÄ viharati. TathÄ dutiyaá¹. TathÄ tatiyaá¹. TathÄ catutthaá¹. Iti uddhamadho tiriyaá¹ sabbadhi sabbattatÄya sabbÄvantaá¹ lokaá¹ mettÄsahagatena cetasÄ vipulena mahaggatena appamÄá¹‡ena averena abyÄpajjena pharitvÄ viharati.
        ğŸ”¼(idhÄvuso) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(bhikkhu) ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨€(mettÄsahagata) ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨€(cetas) ğŸšºâ‘¡â¨€(eka) ğŸšºâ‘¡â¨€(disÄ) ğŸ”¼(pharitvÄ) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(viharati)
        here friend | bhikkhu | filled with goodwill/friendliness | with intent | one | direction | having filled | mindful
        ğŸ”¼(tathÄ) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(dutiya)
        similarly for the second direction
        ğŸ”¼(tathÄ) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(tatiya)
        similarly for the third direction
        ğŸ”¼(tathÄ) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(catuttha)
        similarly for the fourth direction
        ğŸ”¼(iti) ğŸ”¼(uddhamadho) ğŸ”¼(tiriyaá¹ƒ) ğŸ”¼(sabbadhi) ğŸ”¼(sabbattatÄya) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(loka) ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨€(mettÄsahagata) ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨€(cetas) ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨€(vipula) ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨€(mahaggata) ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨€(appamÄá¹‡a) ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨€(avera) ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨€(abyÄpajja) ğŸ”¼(pharitvÄ) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(viharati)
        like this | above and below | horizontally | everywhere | to all beings | universe | filled with goodwill/friendliness | with intent | with expansive | with grand | with infinite | with peaceful | without ill will | having filled | mindful
        Here, friend, a bhikkhu is intent and mindful of filling an entire compass direction with goodwill/friendliness. Similarly in a second, third, fourth compass directions. Thus he is intent and mindful of filling above and below, horizontally, everywhere, to all beings in the universe, with expansive, grand, infinite, peaceful, without ill will, goodwill/friendliness.

        1.11.53 Karuá¹‡Äsahagatena cetasÄ ekaá¹ disaá¹ pharitvÄ viharati. TathÄ dutiyaá¹. TathÄ tatiyaá¹. TathÄ catutthaá¹. Iti uddhamadho tiriyaá¹ sabbadhi sabbattatÄya sabbÄvantaá¹ lokaá¹ karuá¹‡Äsahagatena cetasÄ vipulena mahaggatena appamÄá¹‡ena averena abyÄpajjena pharitvÄ viharati.
        ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨€(karuá¹‡Äsahagata) ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨€(cetas) ğŸšºâ‘¡â¨€(eka) ğŸšºâ‘¡â¨€(disÄ) ğŸ”¼(pharitvÄ) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(viharati)
        here friend | bhikkhu | filled with compassion/pity | with intent | one | direction | having filled | mindful
        ğŸ”¼(tathÄ) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(dutiya)
        similarly for the second direction
        ğŸ”¼(tathÄ) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(tatiya)
        similarly for the third direction
        ğŸ”¼(tathÄ) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(catuttha)
        similarly for the fourth direction
        ğŸ”¼(iti) ğŸ”¼(uddhamadho) ğŸ”¼(tiriyaá¹ƒ) ğŸ”¼(sabbadhi) ğŸ”¼(sabbattatÄya) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(loka) ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨€(karuá¹‡Äsahagata) ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨€(cetas) ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨€(vipula) ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨€(mahaggata) ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨€(appamÄá¹‡a) ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨€(avera) ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨€(abyÄpajja) ğŸ”¼(pharitvÄ) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(viharati)
        like this | above and below | horizontally | everywhere | to all beings | universe | filled with compassion/pity | with intent | with expansive | with grand | with infinite | with peaceful | without ill will | having filled | mindful
        Here, friend, a bhikkhu is intent and mindful of filling an entire compass direction with compassion/pity. Similarly in a second, third, fourth compass directions. Thus he is intent and mindful of filling above and below, horizontally, everywhere, to all beings in the universe, with expansive, grand, infinite, peaceful, without ill will, compassion/pity.

        1.11.54 muditÄsahagatena cetasÄ ekaá¹ disaá¹ pharitvÄ viharati. TathÄ dutiyaá¹. TathÄ tatiyaá¹. TathÄ catutthaá¹. Iti uddhamadho tiriyaá¹ sabbadhi sabbattatÄya sabbÄvantaá¹ lokaá¹ muditÄsahagatena cetasÄ vipulena mahaggatena appamÄá¹‡ena averena abyÄpajjena pharitvÄ viharati.
        ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨€(muditÄsahagata) ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨€(cetas) ğŸšºâ‘¡â¨€(eka) ğŸšºâ‘¡â¨€(disÄ) ğŸ”¼(pharitvÄ) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(viharati)
        here friend | bhikkhu | filled with emphatic happiness | with intent | one | direction | having filled | mindful
        ğŸ”¼(tathÄ) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(dutiya)
        similarly for the second direction
        ğŸ”¼(tathÄ) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(tatiya)
        similarly for the third direction
        ğŸ”¼(tathÄ) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(catuttha)
        similarly for the fourth direction
        ğŸ”¼(iti) ğŸ”¼(uddhamadho) ğŸ”¼(tiriyaá¹ƒ) ğŸ”¼(sabbadhi) ğŸ”¼(sabbattatÄya) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(loka) ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨€(muditÄsahagata) ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨€(cetas) ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨€(vipula) ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨€(mahaggata) ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨€(appamÄá¹‡a) ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨€(avera) ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨€(abyÄpajja) ğŸ”¼(pharitvÄ) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(viharati)
        like this | above and below | horizontally | everywhere | to all beings | universe | filled with emphatic happiness | with intent | with expansive | with grand | with infinite | with peaceful | without ill will | having filled | mindful
        Here, friend, a bhikkhu is intent and mindful of filling an entire compass direction with emphatic happiness. Similarly in a second, third, fourth compass directions. Thus he is intent and mindful of filling above and below, horizontally, everywhere, to all beings in the universe, with expansive, grand, infinite, peaceful, without ill will, emphatic happiness.

        1.11.55 upekkhÄsahagatena cetasÄ ekaá¹ disaá¹ pharitvÄ viharati. TathÄ dutiyaá¹. TathÄ tatiyaá¹. TathÄ catutthaá¹. Iti uddhamadho tiriyaá¹ sabbadhi sabbattatÄya sabbÄvantaá¹ lokaá¹ upekkhÄsahagatena cetasÄ vipulena mahaggatena appamÄá¹‡ena averena abyÄpajjena pharitvÄ viharati.
        ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨€(upekkhÄsahagata) ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨€(cetas) ğŸšºâ‘¡â¨€(eka) ğŸšºâ‘¡â¨€(disÄ) ğŸ”¼(pharitvÄ) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(viharati)
        here friend | bhikkhu | filled with balance/equanimity | with intent | one | direction | having filled | mindful
        ğŸ”¼(tathÄ) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(dutiya)
        similarly for the second direction
        ğŸ”¼(tathÄ) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(tatiya)
        similarly for the third direction
        ğŸ”¼(tathÄ) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(catuttha)
        similarly for the fourth direction
        ğŸ”¼(iti) ğŸ”¼(uddhamadho) ğŸ”¼(tiriyaá¹ƒ) ğŸ”¼(sabbadhi) ğŸ”¼(sabbattatÄya) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(loka) ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨€(upekkhÄsahagata)) ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨€(cetas) ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨€(vipula) ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨€(mahaggata) ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨€(appamÄá¹‡a) ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨€(avera) ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨€(abyÄpajja) ğŸ”¼(pharitvÄ) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(viharati)
        like this | above and below | horizontally | everywhere | to all beings | universe | filled with balance/equanimity | with intent | with expansive | with grand | with infinite | with peaceful | without ill will | having filled | mindful
        Here, friend, a bhikkhu is intent and mindful of filling an entire compass direction with balance/equanimity. Similarly in a second, third, fourth compass directions. Thus he is intent and mindful of filling above and below, horizontally, everywhere, to all beings in the universe, with expansive, grand, infinite, peaceful, without ill will, balance/equanimity.

        38. THE FIRST OF THE NINE LEVELS OF CONCENTRATION

        Poá¹­á¹­hapÄdasutta DN 9 PTS 1.178â€“1.203 (Digha Nikaya I 182):

        10.1 So vivicceva kÄmehi, vivicca akusalehi dhammehi, savitakkaá¹ savicÄraá¹ vivekajaá¹ pÄ«tisukhaá¹ paá¹­hamaá¹ jhÄnaá¹ upasampajja viharati.
        ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(ta) ğŸ”¼(vivicceva) ğŸš¹â‘¤â¨‚(kÄma) ğŸ”¼(vivicca) ğŸš¹â‘¤â¨‚(akusala) ğŸš¹â‘¤â¨‚(dhamma) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(savitakka) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(savicÄra) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(vivekaja) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(pÄ«tisukha) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(paá¹­hama) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(jhÄna) ğŸ”¼(upasampajja) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(viharati)
        that | just secluding oneself from | sensual pleasures | detaching from | unskillful | behaviour | accompanied by reflection | with consideration | secluded from defilements | with felicity and satisfaction | first | jhÄna | entering | remains in
        Secluding oneself from sensual pleasures, detaching from unskillful behaviour, one enters and remains in the first jhÄna, accompanied by reflection and consideration, secluded from defilements, with felicity and satisfaction.

        10.2 Tassa yÄ purimÄ kÄmasaÃ±Ã±Ä, sÄ nirujjhati.
        ğŸš¹â‘¥â¨€(ta) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(ya) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(purima) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(kÄmasaÃ±Ã±Ä) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(ta) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(nirujjhati)
        of that | whatever | past | perceptions of sensual pleasure | that | ceases
        Of that, whatever past perceptions of sensual pleasure cease.

        10.3 VivekajapÄ«tisukhasukhumasaccasaÃ±Ã±Ä tasmiá¹ samaye hoti, vivekajapÄ«tisukhasukhumasaccasaÃ±Ã±Ä«yeva tasmiá¹ samaye hoti.
        ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(vivekajapÄ«tisukhasukhumasaccasaÃ±Ã±Ä) ğŸš¹â‘¦â¨€(ta) ğŸš¹â‘¦â¨€(samaya) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(hoti) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(vivekajapÄ«tisukhasukhumasaccasaÃ±Ã±Ä«) ğŸ”¼(eva) ğŸš¹â‘¦â¨€(ta) ğŸš¹â‘¦â¨€(samaya) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(hoti)
        refined and true perception of felicity and satisfaction born from seclusion | in that | in occasion | is | with a refined and true perception of felicity and satisfaction born from seclusion | only | in that | in occasion | is
        In that occasion, there is refined and true perception of felicity and satisfaction born from seclusion, and in that occasion there is only a refined and true perception of felicity and satisfaction born from seclusion.

        39. THE SECOND LEVEL OF CONCENTRATION

        Poá¹­á¹­hapÄdasutta DN 9 PTS 1.178â€“1.203 (Digha Nikaya I 182):

        11.1 â€œPuna caparaá¹, poá¹­á¹­hapÄda, bhikkhu vitakkavicÄrÄnaá¹ vÅ«pasamÄ ajjhattaá¹ sampasÄdanaá¹ cetaso ekodibhÄvaá¹ avitakkaá¹ avicÄraá¹ samÄdhijaá¹ pÄ«tisukhaá¹ dutiyaá¹ jhÄnaá¹ upasampajja viharati.
        ğŸ”¼(puna) ğŸ”¼(caparaá¹ƒ) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨€(poá¹­á¹­hapÄda) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(bhikkhu) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(vitakkavicÄrÄ) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(vÅ«pasama) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(ajjhatta) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(sampasÄdana) ğŸš¹â‘¥â¨€(cetas) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(ekodibhÄva) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(avitakka) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(avicÄra) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(samÄdhija) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(pÄ«tisukha) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(dutiya) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(jhÄna) ğŸ”¼(upasampajja) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(viharati)
        again | and what is more | Poá¹­á¹­hapÄda | bhikkhu | thinking and investigating | subsiding of | inner | calming | of intention | focused | free from thought | free from discursive thought | born from stable mind | with felicity and satisfaction | first | jhÄna | entering | remains in
        And furthermore, Poá¹­á¹­hapÄda, a bhikkhu, with the conclusion of reflection and consideration, enters and remains in the second jhÄna, accompanied by an inner calming of intention, focused and free of thought or inner dialogue, born from stable mind, with felicity and satisfaction.

        11.2 Tassa yÄ purimÄ vivekajapÄ«tisukhasukhumasaccasaÃ±Ã±Ä, sÄ nirujjhati.
        ğŸš¹â‘¥â¨€(ta) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(ya) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(purima) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(vivekajapÄ«tisukhasukhumasaccasaÃ±Ã±Ä) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(ta) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(nirujjhati)
        of that | whatever | past | refined and true perception of felicity and satisfaction born from seclusion | that | ceases
        Of that, whatever past refined and true perception of felicity and satisfaction born from seclusion cease.

        11.3 SamÄdhijapÄ«tisukhasukhumasaccasaÃ±Ã±Ä tasmiá¹ samaye hoti, samÄdhijapÄ«tisukhasukhumasaccasaÃ±Ã±Ä«yeva tasmiá¹ samaye hoti.
        ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(samÄdhijapÄ«tisukhasukhumasaccasaÃ±Ã±Ä) ğŸš¹â‘¦â¨€(ta) ğŸš¹â‘¦â¨€(samaya) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(hoti) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(samÄdhijapÄ«tisukhasukhumasaccasaÃ±Ã±Ä«) ğŸ”¼(eva) ğŸš¹â‘¦â¨€(ta) ğŸš¹â‘¦â¨€(samaya) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(hoti)
        refined and true perception of the delight and ease born from mental composure | in that | in occasion | is | refined and true perception of the delight and ease born from mental composure | only | in that | in occasion | is
        In that occasion, there is refined and true perception of the felicity and satisfaction born from mental composure, and in that occasion there is only a refined and true perception of the felicity and satisfaction born from mental composure.

        40. THE THIRD LEVEL OF CONCENTRATION

        Poá¹­á¹­hapÄdasutta DN 9 PTS 1.178â€“1.203 (Digha Nikaya I 183):

        12.1 â€œPuna caparaá¹, poá¹­á¹­hapÄda, bhikkhu pÄ«tiyÄ ca virÄgÄ upekkhako ca viharati sato ca sampajÄno, sukhaÃ±ca kÄyena paá¹­isaá¹vedeti, yaá¹ taá¹ ariyÄ Äcikkhanti: â€˜upekkhako satimÄ sukhavihÄrÄ«â€™ti, tatiyaá¹ jhÄnaá¹ upasampajja viharati.
        ğŸ”¼(puna) ğŸ”¼(caparaá¹ƒ) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨€(poá¹­á¹­hapÄda) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(bhikkhu) ğŸšºâ‘¢â¨€(pÄ«ti) ğŸ”¼(ca) ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨€(virÄga) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(upekkhaka) ğŸ”¼(ca) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(viharati) ğŸš¹â‘¤â¨€(sa) ğŸ”¼(ca) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(sampajÄna) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(sukha) ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨€(kÄya) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(paá¹­isaá¹ƒvedeti) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(ya) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(ta) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(ariya) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨‚(Äcikkhati) : ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(upekkhaka) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(satimant) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(sukhavihÄrÄ«) ğŸ”¼(ti) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(tatiya) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(jhÄna) ğŸ”¼(upasampajja) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(viharati)
        again | and what is more | Poá¹­á¹­hapÄda | bhikkhu | with felicity | and | with detachment | mentally balanced, equanimous | and | continues in | being present | and | purposeful/fully aware | pleasant | and | with body | experiences | whatever | those | pure | describes : mentally balanced, equanimous | attentive | living at ease | quote | third | jhÄna | entering | remains in
        And furthermore, Poá¹­á¹­hapÄda, a bhikkhu, with the detachment from felicity, enters and remains in the third jhÄna, remains mentally balanced, is fully aware and being present, experiences body comfort, as the pure ones describe: â€œequanimous, attentive, living at ease.â€

        12.2 Tassa yÄ purimÄ samÄdhijapÄ«tisukhasukhumasaccasaÃ±Ã±Ä, sÄ nirujjhati.
        ğŸš¹â‘¥â¨€(ta) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(ya) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(purima) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(samÄdhijapÄ«tisukhasukhumasaccasaÃ±Ã±Ä) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(ta) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(nirujjhati)
        of that | whatever | past | refined and true perception of the felicity and satisfaction born from mental composure | that | ceases
        Of that, whatever past refined and true perception of the felicity and satisfaction born from mental composure cease.

        12.3 UpekkhÄsukhasukhumasaccasaÃ±Ã±Ä tasmiá¹ samaye hoti, upekkhÄsukhasukhumasaccasaÃ±Ã±Ä«yeva tasmiá¹ samaye hoti.
        ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(upekkhÄsukhasukhumasaccasaÃ±Ã±Ä) ğŸš¹â‘¦â¨€(ta) ğŸš¹â‘¦â¨€(samaya) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(hoti) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(upekkhÄsukhasukhumasaccasaÃ±Ã±Ä«) ğŸ”¼(eva) ğŸš¹â‘¦â¨€(ta) ğŸš¹â‘¦â¨€(samaya) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(hoti)
        refined and true perception of equanimity | in that | in occasion | is | refined and true perception of equanimity | only | in that | in occasion | is
        In that occasion, there is refined and true perception of equanimity, and in that occasion there is only a refined and true perception of equanimity.

        41. THE FOURTH LEVEL OF CONCENTRATION

        Poá¹­á¹­hapÄdasutta DN 9 PTS 1.178â€“1.203 (Digha Nikaya I 183):

        13.1 â€œPuna caparaá¹, poá¹­á¹­hapÄda, bhikkhu sukhassa ca pahÄnÄ dukkhassa ca pahÄnÄ pubbeva somanassadomanassÄnaá¹ atthaá¹…gamÄ adukkhamasukhaá¹ upekkhÄsatipÄrisuddhiá¹ catutthaá¹ jhÄnaá¹ upasampajja viharati.
        ğŸ”¼(puna) ğŸ”¼(caparaá¹ƒ) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨€(poá¹­á¹­hapÄda) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(bhikkhu) ğŸš¹â‘¥â¨€(sukha) ğŸ”¼(ca) ğŸš»â‘ â¨‚(pahÄna) ğŸš¹â‘¥â¨€(dukkha) ğŸ”¼(ca) ğŸš»â‘ â¨‚(pahÄna) ğŸ”¼(pubbeva) ğŸš»â‘¥â¨‚(somanassadomanassa) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(atthaá¹…gama) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(adukkhamasukha) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(upekkhÄsatipÄrisuddhi) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(catuttha) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(jhÄna) ğŸ”¼(upasampajja) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(viharati)
        again | and what is more | Poá¹­á¹­hapÄda | bhikkhu | of pleasant | and | giving up of | unpleasant | and giving up of | just before | of (mental) pleasure and displeasure; satisfaction and dissatisfaction | disappearance of | neutral | which possesses purification of awareness by equanimity | fourth | jhÄna | entering | remains in
        And furthermore, Poá¹­á¹­hapÄda, a bhikkhu, just before the giving up of the pleasant and the unpleasant and the disappearance of mental pleasure and displeasure, satisfaction and dissatisfaction, enters and remains in the fourth jhÄna, in a neutral state, and possessing purification of awareness by equanimity.

        13.2 Tassa yÄ purimÄ upekkhÄsukhasukhumasaccasaÃ±Ã±Ä, sÄ nirujjhati.
        ğŸš¹â‘¥â¨€(ta) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(ya) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(purima) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(upekkhÄsukhasukhumasaccasaÃ±Ã±Ä) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(ta) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(nirujjhati)
        of that | whatever | past | refined and true perception of equanimity | that | ceases
        Of that, whatever past refined and true perception of equanimity cease.

        13.3 AdukkhamasukhasukhumasaccasaÃ±Ã±Ä tasmiá¹ samaye hoti, adukkhamasukhasukhumasaccasaÃ±Ã±Ä«yeva tasmiá¹ samaye hoti.
        ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(adukkhamasukhasukhumasaccasaÃ±Ã±Ä) ğŸš¹â‘¦â¨€(ta) ğŸš¹â‘¦â¨€(samaya) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(hoti) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(adukkhamasukhasukhumasaccasaÃ±Ã±Ä«) ğŸ”¼(eva) ğŸš¹â‘¦â¨€(ta) ğŸš¹â‘¦â¨€(samaya) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(hoti)
        refined and true perception of neither unpleasant nor pleasant sensation | in that | in occasion | is | refined and true perception of neither unpleasant nor pleasant sensation | only | in that | in occasion | is
        In that occasion, there is refined and true perception of neither unpleasant nor pleasant sensation, and in that occasion there is only a refined and true perception of neither unpleasant nor pleasant sensation.

        42. THE FIFTH, SIXTH AND SEVENTH LEVELS OF CONCENTRATION

        Poá¹­á¹­hapÄdasutta DN 9 PTS 1.178â€“1.203 (Digha Nikaya I 183):

        14.1 â€œPuna caparaá¹, poá¹­á¹­hapÄda, bhikkhu sabbaso rÅ«pasaÃ±Ã±Änaá¹ samatikkamÄ paá¹­ighasaÃ±Ã±Änaá¹ atthaá¹…gamÄ nÄnattasaÃ±Ã±Änaá¹ amanasikÄrÄ â€˜ananto ÄkÄsoâ€™ti ÄkÄsÄnaÃ±cÄyatanaá¹ upasampajja viharati.
        ğŸ”¼(puna) ğŸ”¼(caparaá¹ƒ) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨€(poá¹­á¹­hapÄda) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(bhikkhu) ğŸ”¼(sabbaso) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(rÅ«pasaÃ±Ã±Ä) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(samatikkama) ğŸšºâ‘¥â¨‚(paá¹­ighasaÃ±Ã±Ä) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(atthaá¹…gama) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(nÄnattasaÃ±Ã±Ä) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(amanasikÄra) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(ananta) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(ÄkÄsa) ğŸ”¼(ti) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(ÄkÄsÄnaÃ±cÄyatana) ğŸ”¼(upasampajja) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(viharati)
        again | and what is more | Poá¹­á¹­hapÄda | bhikkhu | altogether | perception of form | going beyond | of recognition of sense impression | disappearance of | recognition of multiplicity/diversity | ignoring | infinite | space | quote | base of infinity of space | entering | remains in
        And furthermore, Poá¹­á¹­hapÄda, a bhikkhu, going beyond perception of form altogether, with the disappearance of perception of sense impressions, ignoring the recognition of multiple/diverse things, enters and remains in the base of the infinity of space, ie. â€œinfinite spaceâ€.

        15.1 â€œPuna caparaá¹, poá¹­á¹­hapÄda, bhikkhu sabbaso ÄkÄsÄnaÃ±cÄyatanaá¹ samatikkamma â€˜anantaá¹ viÃ±Ã±Äá¹‡anâ€™ti viÃ±Ã±Äá¹‡aÃ±cÄyatanaá¹ upasampajja viharati.
        ğŸ”¼(puna) ğŸ”¼(caparaá¹ƒ) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨€(poá¹­á¹­hapÄda) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(bhikkhu) ğŸ”¼(sabbaso) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(ÄkÄsÄnaÃ±cÄyatana) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(samatikkama) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(ananta) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(viÃ±Ã±Äá¹‡a) ğŸ”¼(ti) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(viÃ±Ã±Äá¹‡aÃ±cÄyatana) ğŸ”¼(upasampajja) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(viharati)
        again | and what is more | Poá¹­á¹­hapÄda | bhikkhu | altogether | base of infinity of space | going beyond | infinite | consciousness | quote | base of infinity consciousness | entering | remains in
        And furthermore, Poá¹­á¹­hapÄda, a bhikkhu, going beyond the base of infinite space altogether, enters and remains in the base of the infinite consciousness, ie. â€œinfinite consciousnessâ€.

        16.1 â€œPuna caparaá¹, poá¹­á¹­hapÄda, bhikkhu sabbaso viÃ±Ã±Äá¹‡aÃ±cÄyatanaá¹ samatikkamma â€˜natthi kiÃ±cÄ«â€™ti ÄkiÃ±caÃ±Ã±Äyatanaá¹ upasampajja viharati.
        ğŸ”¼(puna) ğŸ”¼(caparaá¹ƒ) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨€(poá¹­á¹­hapÄda) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(bhikkhu) ğŸ”¼(sabbaso) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(viÃ±Ã±Äá¹‡aÃ±cÄyatana) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(samatikkama) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(natthi) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(kaci) ğŸ”¼(ti) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(ÄkiÃ±caÃ±Ã±Äyatana) ğŸ”¼(upasampajja) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(viharati)
        again | and what is more | Poá¹­á¹­hapÄda | bhikkhu | altogether | base of infinity of space | going beyond | there is not | anything | quote | base of nothingness | entering | remains in
        And furthermore, Poá¹­á¹­hapÄda, a bhikkhu, going beyond the base of infinite consciousness altogether, enters and remains in the base of nothingness, ie. â€œthere is nothingâ€.

        43. THE EIGHTH AND NINTH LEVELS OF CONCENTRATION

        Tapussasutta AN 9.41 PTS 4.439â€“4.448 (Anguttara Nikaya IV 448):

        15.11 So kho ahaá¹, Änanda, aparena samayena (nevasaÃ±Ã±ÄnÄsaÃ±Ã±Äyatane ÄdÄ«navaá¹ disvÄ taá¹ bahulamakÄsiá¹, saÃ±Ã±Ävedayitanirodhe Änisaá¹saá¹ adhigamma tamÄseviá¹).
        ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(ta) ğŸ”¼(kho) ğŸ‘†â‘ â¨€(ahaá¹ƒ) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨€(Änanda) ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨€(apara) ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨€(samaya) ğŸš»â‘¡â¨‚(nevasaÃ±Ã±ÄnÄsaÃ±Ã±Äyatana) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(ÄdÄ«nava) ğŸ”¼(disvÄ) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(ta) â®ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(bahulamakÄsi) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨‚(saÃ±Ã±Ävedayitanirodha) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(Änisaá¹ƒsa) ğŸ”¼(adhigamma) â®ğŸ‘†â¨€(tamÄsevi)
        that | indeed | I | Ä€nanda | with another | with occasion | base of neither perception nor non-perception | inadequacy of | having seen | that | one | practised often | ending of recognition and feeling | expecting | attaining | applied oneself to that
        Indeed I, Ä€nanda, at that other time, having seen the inadequacy of the base of neither perception nor non-perception that is practiced oftenm applied myself to expecting and attaining the ending of recognition and feeling.

        15.13 (So kho ahaá¹, Änanda), sabbaso nevasaÃ±Ã±ÄnÄsaÃ±Ã±Äyatanaá¹ samatikkamma saÃ±Ã±Ävedayitanirodhaá¹ upasampajja viharÄmi, paÃ±Ã±Äya ca me disvÄ ÄsavÄ parikkhayaá¹ agamaá¹su.
        ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(ta) ğŸ”¼(kho) ğŸ‘†â‘ â¨€(ahaá¹ƒ) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨€(Änanda) ğŸ”¼(sabbaso) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(nevasaÃ±Ã±ÄnÄsaÃ±Ã±Äyatana) ğŸ”¼(samatikkamma) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(saÃ±Ã±Ävedayitanirodha) ğŸ”¼(upasampajja) â–¶ï¸ğŸ‘†â¨€(viharati) ğŸšºâ‘¢â¨€(paÃ±Ã±a) ğŸ‘†â‘¢â¨€(ahaá¹ƒ) ğŸ”¼(disvÄ) ğŸš¹â‘¤â¨€(Äsava) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(parikkhaya) â®ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨‚(agamÄsi)
        that | indeed | I | Ä€nanda | altogether | base of neither perception nor non-perception | going beyond | ending of recognition and feeling | entering | I remain in | by knowledge | by me | having seen | from effluent | exhaustion of | arrived at
        Indeed I, Ä€nanda, going beyond the base of neither perception nor non-perception altogether, enters and remains in the ending of recognition and feeling, having seen by my knowledge, and arrived at the exhaustion of the effluents.

        16.2 Yato ca kho ahaá¹, Änanda, imÄ nava anupubbavihÄrasamÄpattiyo evaá¹ anulomapaá¹­ilomaá¹ samÄpajjimpi vuá¹­á¹­hahimpi, athÄhaá¹, Änanda, sadevake loke samÄrake sabrahmake sassamaá¹‡abrÄhmaá¹‡iyÄ pajÄya sadevamanussÄya â€˜anuttaraá¹ sammÄsambodhiá¹ abhisambuddhoâ€™ti paccaÃ±Ã±Äsiá¹.
        ğŸš¹â‘¤â¨€(ya) ğŸ”¼(ca kho) ğŸ‘†â‘ â¨€(ahaá¹ƒ) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨€(Änanda) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨‚(ima) âš§â‘ â¨‚(nava) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨‚(anupubbavihÄrasamÄpatti) ğŸ”¼(evaá¹ƒ) ğŸ”¼(anulomapaá¹­ilomaá¹ƒ) â®ğŸ‘†â¨€(samÄpajji) ğŸ”¼(pi) â®ğŸ‘†â¨€(vuá¹­á¹­hahi) ğŸ”¼(pi) ğŸ”¼(athÄhaá¹ƒ) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨€(Änanda) ğŸš¹â‘¦â¨€(sadevaka) ğŸš¹â‘¦â¨€(loka) ğŸš¹â‘¦â¨€(samÄraka) ğŸš¹â‘¦â¨€(sabrahmaka) ğŸšºâ‘¦â¨€(sassamaá¹‡abrÄhmaá¹‡a) ğŸšºâ‘¦â¨€(pajÄ) ğŸšºâ‘¦â¨€(sadevamanussa) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(anuttara) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(sammÄsambodhi) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(abhisambuddha) ğŸ”¼(ti) â®ğŸ‘†â¨€(paccaÃ±Ã±Äsi)
        from whatever | and | indeed | I | Ä€nanda | these | nine | attainment of the successive stages in meditation | thus | forwards and backwards | entered | too | emerged from | too | then I | Ä€nanda | in with deities | in universe | with MÄra | with Brahmas | with religious practitioners | with people | with kings and commoners | highest | perfect awakening | perfect enligtenment | quote | I claimed
        And from whatever indeed, Ä€nanda, I entered and emerged from these nine attainments of the successive stages in meditation forwards and backwards, then I claimed to the deities in the world, MÄra, Brahmas, religious practitioners, general population, kings and commoners: â€œThis is the highest, perfect awakening, and perfect enligtenment!â€

        16.3 Ã‘Äá¹‡aÃ±ca pana me dassanaá¹ udapÄdi:
        ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(Ã±Äá¹‡a) ğŸ”¼(ca pana) ğŸ‘†â‘¥â¨€(ahaá¹ƒ)ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(dassana) â®ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(udapÄdi)
        Having insight | and | moreover | for me realisation | arose
        Having insight, the realisation arose for me:

        16.4 â€˜akuppÄ me cetovimutti, ayamantimÄ jÄti, natthi dÄni punabbhavoâ€™â€ti.
        ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(akuppa) ğŸ‘†â‘¥â¨€(ahaá¹ƒ)ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(cetovimutti) ğŸ”¼(ayamantimÄ) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(jÄti) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(natthi) ğŸ”¼(dÄni) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(punabbhava) ğŸ”¼(ti)
        Unshakeable | of me | mental liberation | this is the final | birth | there is no | now | rebirth | quote
        â€œUnshakeable is the mental liberation of me, this is the final birth, now there is no rebirth.â€

        44. THE STATE OF EMPTINESS

        Piá¹‡á¸apÄtapÄrisuddhisutta MN 151 PTS 3.294â€“3.297 (Majjhima Nikaya III 293 f):

        1.3 (Atha kho ÄyasmÄ sÄriputto sÄyanhasamayaá¹ paá¹­isallÄnÄ vuá¹­á¹­hito yena bhagavÄ tenupasaá¹…kami; upasaá¹…kamitvÄ bhagavantaá¹ abhivÄdetvÄ ekamantaá¹ nisÄ«di.) Ekamantaá¹ nisinnaá¹ kho Äyasmantaá¹ sÄriputtaá¹ bhagavÄ etadavoca:
        ğŸ”¼(atha kho) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(Äyasmant) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(sÄriputta) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(sÄyanhasamaya) ğŸš»â‘¤â¨€(paá¹­isallÄna) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(vuá¹­á¹­hita) ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨€(ya) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(bhagavant) â®ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(tenupasaá¹…kami) ğŸ”¼(upasaá¹…kamitvÄ) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(bhagavant) ğŸ”¼(abhivÄdetvÄ) ğŸ”¼(ekamantaá¹ƒ) â®ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(nisÄ«di)
        after that | Venerable | SÄriputta | in the late afternoon | from seclusion | come out of | by where | Bhagavant | by there approached | having approached | Bhagavant | having bowed down to | to one side | sat down
        ğŸ”¼(ekamantaá¹ƒ) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(nisinna) ğŸ”¼(kho) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(Äyasmant) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(sÄriputta) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(bhagavant) ğŸ”µâ®ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(etadavoca)
        to one side | sitting | indeed | Venerable | SÄriputta | Bhagavant | said this :
        (After that, Venerable SÄriputta came out of seclusion in the late afternoon and approached the Bhagavant. Having approached, he bowed to the Bhagavant and sat down to one side.) The Bhagavant said this to Venerable SÄriputta sitting on one side:

        2.1 â€œVippasannÄni kho te, sÄriputta, indriyÄni, parisuddho chavivaá¹‡á¹‡o pariyodÄto.
        ğŸš»â‘ â¨‚(vippasanna) ğŸ”¼(kho) ğŸ¤˜â‘¡â¨€(tvaá¹ƒ) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨€(sÄriputta) ğŸš»â‘ â¨‚(indriya) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(parisuddha) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(chavivaá¹‡á¹‡a) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(pariyodÄta)
        tranquil | indeed | you | SÄriputta | appearance | pure | complexion | bright
        â€œYou are tranquil indeed, SÄriputta, and your appearance is pure and complexion bright.â€

        2.2 Katamena kho tvaá¹, sÄriputta, vihÄrena etarahi bahulaá¹ viharasÄ«â€ti?

        2.3 â€œSuÃ±Ã±atÄvihÄrena kho ahaá¹, bhante, etarahi bahulaá¹ viharÄmÄ«â€ti.
        ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨€(suÃ±Ã±atÄvihÄra) ğŸ”¼(kho) ğŸ‘†â‘ â¨€(ahaá¹ƒ) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨€(bhavant) ğŸ”¼(etarahi) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(bahula) â–¶ï¸ğŸ‘†â¨€(viharati)) ğŸ”¼(ti)

        2.6 MahÄpurisavihÄro eso, sÄriputta, yadidaá¹â€” ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(mahÄpurisavihÄra) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(eta) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨€(sÄriputta) ğŸ”¼(yadidaá¹ƒ) internal dwelling of an illustrious being | this | SÄriputta | that is SÄriputta, this is the internal dwelling of an illustrious being:

        45. HOW TO MEET PERSECUTION AND DEATH

        MahÄhatthipadopamasutta MN 28 PTS 1.185â€“1.191 (Majjhima Nikaya I 186):

        9.1 TaÃ±ce, Ävuso, bhikkhuá¹ pare aniá¹­á¹­hehi akantehi amanÄpehi samudÄcarantiâ€”
        ğŸ”¼(taÃ±ce) ğŸ”¼(Ävuso) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(bhikkhu) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(para) ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨‚(aniá¹­á¹­ha) ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨‚(akanta) ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨‚(amanÄpa) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨‚(samudÄcarati)
        if that | friend | bhikkhu | others | with unpleasant | disagreeable | dislikeable | behave
        Friend, if others behave with unpleasantness, disagreeableness, dislikeableness to that bhikkhu -

        9.2 pÄá¹‡isamphassenapi leá¸á¸usamphassenapi daá¹‡á¸asamphassenapi satthasamphassenapi.
        ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨€(pÄá¹‡isamphassa) ğŸ”¼(api) ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨€(leá¸á¸usamphassa) ğŸ”¼(api) ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨€(daá¹‡á¸asamphassa) ğŸ”¼(api) ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨€(satthasamphassa) ğŸ”¼(api)
        with slap | even | with throwing stones | even | with beating with a stick | even | with stabbing with a weapon | even
        even hitting him with hands, stones, sticks, weapons.

        9.3 So evaá¹ pajÄnÄti:
        ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(ta) ğŸ”¼(evaá¹ƒ) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(pajÄnÄti)
        he | thus | knows:
        Thus he knows:

        9.4 â€˜tathÄbhÅ«to kho ayaá¹ kÄyo yathÄbhÅ«tasmiá¹ kÄye pÄá¹‡isamphassÄpi kamanti, leá¸á¸usamphassÄpi kamanti, daá¹‡á¸asamphassÄpi kamanti, satthasamphassÄpi kamanti.
        ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(tathÄbhÅ«ta) ğŸ”¼(kho) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(ima) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(kÄya) ğŸš¹â‘¦â¨€(yathÄbhÅ«ta) ğŸš¹â‘¦â¨€(kÄya) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(pÄá¹‡isamphassa) ğŸ”¼(api) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨‚(kamati) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(leá¸á¸usamphassa) ğŸ”¼(api) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨‚(kamati) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(daá¹‡á¸asamphassa) ğŸ”¼(api) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨‚(kamati) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(satthasamphassa)
        of such nature | indeed | this | body | in reality | in body | slap | even | occurs | throwing stones | even | occurs | beating with a stick | even | occurs | stabbing with a weapon | even | occurs
        This body is of such nature that it is possible to physically hit it with hands, stones, sticks, weapons.

        9.5 Vuttaá¹ kho panetaá¹ bhagavatÄ kakacÅ«pamovÄde:
        ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(vutta) ğŸ”¼(kho) ğŸ”¼(panetaá¹ƒ) ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨€(bhagavant)ğŸš¹â‘¦â¨€(kakacÅ«pamovÄda)
        said | indeed | but this | by Bhagavant | exhortation with the simile of the saw
        But this is indeed said by the Bhagavant in the exhortation with the simile of the saw:

        9.6 â€œubhatodaá¹‡á¸akena cepi, bhikkhave, kakacena corÄ ocarakÄ aá¹…gamaá¹…gÄni okanteyyuá¹, tatrÄpi yo mano padÅ«seyya na me so tena sÄsanakaroâ€ti.
        ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨€(ubhatodaá¹‡á¸aka) ğŸ”¼(cepi) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨‚(bhikkhu) ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨€(kakaca) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(cora) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(ocaraka) ğŸš»â‘¡â¨‚(aá¹…gamaá¹…gÄni) â¯ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨‚(okantati) ğŸ”¼(tatrÄpi) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(ya) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(manas) â¯ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(padÅ«seti) ğŸ‘†â‘¥â¨€(ahaá¹ƒ) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(ta) ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨€(ta) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(sÄsanakara) ğŸ”¼(ti)
        with double-handled | even if | Bhikkhave | with saw | robbers | lowlife | all the limbs | cut off | even in that situation | whoever | mind | will corrupt | no | of me | that | by that | practising the teaching | quote
        â€œBhikkhave, even if lowlife robbers cut off all the limbs with a doubled handled saw, even in that case whoever will corrupt his mind is not practising the teaching of mine.â€

        9.7 Ä€raddhaá¹ kho pana me vÄ«riyaá¹ bhavissati asallÄ«naá¹, upaá¹­á¹­hitÄ sati asammuá¹­á¹­hÄ, passaddho kÄyo asÄraddho, samÄhitaá¹ cittaá¹ ekaggaá¹.
        ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(Äraddha) ğŸ”¼(kho pana) ğŸ‘†â‘¢â¨€(ahaá¹ƒ) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(vÄ«riya) â­ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(bhavati) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(asallÄ«na) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(upaá¹­á¹­hita) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(sati) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(asammuá¹­á¹­ha) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(passaddha) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(kÄya) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(asÄraddha) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(samÄhita) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(citta) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(ekagga)
        applied | and now | with me | determination | will become | active | presence | awareness | unmuddled | tranquility | body | unagitated | composed | mind | focused
        And now applied with me there will be active determination, presence and awareness, unmuddled, tranquility, unagitated body, composed and focused mind.

        9.8 KÄmaá¹ dÄni imasmiá¹ kÄye pÄá¹‡isamphassÄpi kamantu, leá¸á¸usamphassÄpi kamantu, daá¹‡á¸asamphassÄpi kamantu, satthasamphassÄpi kamantu, karÄ«yati hidaá¹ buddhÄnaá¹ sÄsananâ€™ti.
        ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(kÄma) ğŸ”¼(dÄni) ğŸš¹â‘¦â¨€(ima) ğŸš¹â‘¦â¨€(kÄya) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(pÄá¹‡isamphassa) ğŸ”¼(api) â¹ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨‚(kamati) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(leá¸á¸usamphassa) ğŸ”¼(api) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨‚(kamati) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(daá¹‡á¸asamphassa) ğŸ”¼(api) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨‚(kamati) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(satthasamphassa) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(karÄ«yati) ğŸ”¼(hidaá¹ƒ) ğŸš¹â‘¥â¨‚(buddha) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(sÄsana) ğŸ”¼(ti)
        certainly | now | in this | in body | slap | even | must occur | throwing stones | even | must occur | beating with a stick | even | must occur | stabbing with a weapon | even | must occur | is practised | surely in this case | of Buddha | teaching | quote
        â€œAnd now certainly, even when hit by hands, stones, sticks, weapons in the body, surely in this case the teaching of the Buddha is practised.â€

        45. A NUN TELLS HER STORY

        SÄ«hÄtherÄ«gÄthÄ Thig 5.3 PTS 132 Verse 77â€“81 (Therigatha, verses 78-81):

        2.1 Pariyuá¹­á¹­hitÄ klesehi,
        ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(pariyuá¹­á¹­hita) ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨‚(klesa)
        consumed by | defilements
        2.2 subhasaÃ±Ã±ÄnuvattinÄ«;
        ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(subhasaÃ±Ã±ÄnuvattÄ«)
        pursuing beautiful perceptions
        2.3 Samaá¹ cittassa na labhiá¹,
        ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(sama) ğŸš»â‘¥â¨€(citta) ğŸ”¼(na) â®ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(labhi)
        balance | of mind/heart | no | obtained
        Didnâ€™t obtain balance of mind/heart
        2.4 rÄgacittavasÄnugÄ.
        ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(rÄgacittavasÄnuga)
        slave of the impassioned heart
        3.1 KisÄ paá¹‡á¸u vivaá¹‡á¹‡Ä ca,
        ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(kisa) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(paá¹‡á¸u) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(vivaá¹‡á¹‡a) ğŸ”¼(ca)
        thin | pale | sickly | and
        3.2 satta vassÄni cÄrihaá¹;
        âš§â‘ â¨‚(satta) ğŸš»â‘ â¨‚(vassa) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(cÄrÄ«) ğŸ‘†â‘ â¨€(ahaá¹ƒ)
        seven | years | wandered | I
        3.3 NÄhaá¹ divÄ vÄ rattiá¹ vÄ,
        ğŸ”¼(nÄhaá¹ƒ) ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨€(diva) ğŸ”¼(vÄ) ğŸ”¼(rattiá¹ƒ) ğŸ”¼(vÄ)
        not I | by day | or | by night | or
        3.4 sukhaá¹ vindiá¹ sudukkhitÄ.
        ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(sukha) â®ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(vindi) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(sudukkhita)
        pleasant | experienced | suffering miserably

        4.1 Tato rajjuá¹ gahetvÄna,
        ğŸš¹â‘¤â¨€(ta) ğŸšºâ‘¡â¨€(rajju) ğŸ”¼(gahetvÄna)
        from that | rope | having taken
        4.2 pÄvisiá¹ vanamantaraá¹;
        â®ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(pÄvisi) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(vanamantara)
        entered | inner forest
        4.3 Varaá¹ me idha ubbandhaá¹,
        ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(vara) ğŸ‘†â‘¥â¨€(ahaá¹ƒ) ğŸ”¼(idha) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(ubbandha)
        wish | of me | now | suicide
        4.4 yaÃ±ca hÄ«naá¹ punÄcare.
        ğŸ”¼(yaÃ±ca) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(hÄ«na) â¯ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(punÄcarati)
        but whatever | deficiencies | will repeat again
        5.1 Daá¸·hapÄsaá¹ karitvÄna,
        ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(daá¸·hapÄsa) ğŸ”¼(karitvÄna)
        strong noose | having made
        5.2 rukkhasÄkhÄya bandhiya;
        ğŸšºâ‘¦â¨€(rukkhasÄkhÄ) ğŸ”¼(bandhiya)
        at branch of tree | having tied
        5.3 Pakkhipiá¹ pÄsaá¹ gÄ«vÄyaá¹,
        â®ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(pakkhipi) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(pÄsa) ğŸšºâ‘¦â¨€(gÄ«vÄ)
        placed | noose | on neck
        5.4 atha cittaá¹ vimucci meâ€ti.
        ğŸ”¼(atha) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(citta) â®ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(vimucci) ğŸ‘†â‘¥â¨€(ahaá¹ƒ) ğŸ”¼(ti)
        then | mind | was liberated | of me | quote

        Consumed by defilements,
        Pursuing beautiful perceptions;
        Did not obtain balance of mind,
        Slave of the impassioned heart.

        Thin, pale, sickly,
        Seven years I wandered;
        By day or night I did not,
        Experience comfort, suffering miserably.

        From that, having taken a rope,
        Entered into the inner forest;
        My wish is now suicide,
        But whatever deficiences will repeat again.

        Having made a strong noose,
        Having tied to a branch of a tree;
        Placed noose on neck,
        Then my mind was liberated.

        46. THE BUDDHA RELATES HOW HE ATTAINED NIRVANA

        PÄsarÄsisutta MN 26 PTS 1.161â€“1.175 (Majjhima Nikaya I 167):

        18.1 (So kho ahaá¹, bhikkhave, attanÄ jÄtidhammo samÄno jÄtidhamme ÄdÄ«navaá¹ viditvÄ ajÄtaá¹ anuttaraá¹ yogakkhemaá¹ nibbÄnaá¹ pariyesamÄno ajÄtaá¹ anuttaraá¹ yogakkhemaá¹ nibbÄnaá¹ ajjhagamaá¹, attanÄ jarÄdhammo samÄno jarÄdhamme ÄdÄ«navaá¹ viditvÄ ajaraá¹ anuttaraá¹ yogakkhemaá¹ nibbÄnaá¹ pariyesamÄno ajaraá¹ anuttaraá¹ yogakkhemaá¹ nibbÄnaá¹ ajjhagamaá¹, attanÄ byÄdhidhammo samÄno byÄdhidhamme ÄdÄ«navaá¹ viditvÄ abyÄdhiá¹ anuttaraá¹ yogakkhemaá¹ nibbÄnaá¹ pariyesamÄno abyÄdhiá¹ anuttaraá¹ yogakkhemaá¹ nibbÄnaá¹ ajjhagamaá¹, attanÄ maraá¹‡adhammo samÄno maraá¹‡adhamme ÄdÄ«navaá¹ viditvÄ amataá¹ anuttaraá¹ yogakkhemaá¹ nibbÄnaá¹ ajjhagamaá¹, attanÄ sokadhammo samÄno sokadhamme ÄdÄ«navaá¹ viditvÄ asokaá¹ anuttaraá¹ yogakkhemaá¹ nibbÄnaá¹ ajjhagamaá¹), attanÄ saá¹…kilesadhammo samÄno saá¹…kilesadhamme ÄdÄ«navaá¹ viditvÄ asaá¹…kiliá¹­á¹­haá¹ anuttaraá¹ yogakkhemaá¹ nibbÄnaá¹ pariyesamÄno asaá¹…kiliá¹­á¹­haá¹ anuttaraá¹ yogakkhemaá¹ nibbÄnaá¹ ajjhagamaá¹.
        ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(ta) ğŸ”¼(kho) ğŸ‘†â‘ â¨€(ahaá¹ƒ) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨‚(bhikkhu) ğŸš¹â‘¤â¨€(atta) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(jÄtidhamma) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(samÄna) ğŸš¹â‘¦â¨€(jÄtidhamma) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(ÄdÄ«nava) ğŸ”¼(viditvÄ) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(ajÄta) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(anuttara) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(yogakkhema) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(nibbÄna) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(pariyesamÄna) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(ajÄta) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(anuttara) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(yogakkhema) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(nibbÄna)
