          Does perception arise before understanding, or understanding arise before perception, or do they arise simultaneously?

        Translate into Pali

        MN 57 1.1-3.4 (M I 387,8-21 + 27-28 + 388,2-9):

        Once, the fortunate one was dwelling (use present tense, which in contexts like this expresses a continuing state in the past) among the Koá¸·iyas. Then (atha kho) Puá¹‡á¹‡a, a Koá¸·iyan (Koá¸·iyaputto) , a bovine, and a naked ascetic Seniya, a canine, approached (aorist : past event at a point of time) this way towards the fortunate one. Having approached, Punna(the) Koliyan (who was) a bovine, having saluted the fortunate one, sat down to one side ekam-antam : used as an indeclinable-compound). The naked ascetic Seniya, however, (the) canine, exchanged greetings with the fortunate one ; having made agreeable polite conversation (word order : agreeable conversa- tion polite), squatting (gerund) like a dog, he sat down to one side, Punna the Koliyan bovine, seated to one side (put this clause first) said this to the fortunate one: " Sir, this naked ascetic Seniya (is) a canine, a doer-of-hard-tasks. He eats (what is) thrown-on-the-ground. He (use genitive and past participle) has long (digharattam) conformed (to) that dog-vow. What (will be) his future state ? " " Enough, Punna, don’t bother with this. Don’t ask me this," [Punna asks a second and a third time : the convention being that, however reluctant, one must satisfy an inquirer who persists in asking up to three times. In the Pali of this story the question is repeated with abbreviation (pe) in place of the second statement. The fortunate one reluctantly answers.] “. . . Nevertheless I will explain to you (te). In this connection, Punna, someone develops the dog-vow perfectly (paripuá¹‡á¹‡am : accusative used as adverb) . . . Having developed the dog-vow perfectly, having developed the-virtue-of-a-dog perfectly, having developed the-mind-of-a-dog perfectly, having developed the-style-of-a- dog perfectly, after death he is reborn in the condition (acc.) of dogs. But if (sace) he has the opinion (diiá¹­á¹­hi, fem. : Lesson 20) : â€˜By this virtue or vow I shall be a god,’ that (fem.) is his wrong-opinion.” (Wrong-opinion produces as future state either purgatory or birth as an animal.)

        Once, the fortunate one was dwelling (use present tense, which in contexts like this expresses a continuing state in the past) among the Koá¸·iyas.
        ekaá¹ samayaá¹ bhagavÄ koliyesu viharati haliddavasanaá¹ nÄma koliyÄnaá¹ nigamo.

        Then (atha kho) Puá¹‡á¹‡a, a Koá¸·iyan (Koá¸·iyaputto) , a bovine, and a naked ascetic Seniya, a canine, approached (aorist : past event at a point of time) this way towards the fortunate one.
        Atha kho puá¹‡á¹‡o ca koliyaputto govatiko acelo ca seniyo kukkuravatiko yena bhagavÄ tenupasaá¹…kamiá¹su;

        Having approached, Punna(the) Koliyan (who was) a bovine, having saluted the fortunate one, sat down to one side (ekam-antam : used as an indeclinable-compound).
        upasaá¹…kamitvÄ puá¹‡á¹‡o koliyaputto govatiko bhagavantaá¹ abhivÄdetvÄ ekamantaá¹ nisÄ«di.

        The naked ascetic Seniya, however, (the) canine, exchanged greetings with the fortunate one ; having made agreeable polite conversation (word order : agreeable conversation polite), squatting (gerund) like a dog, he sat down to one side, Punna the Koliyan bovine, seated to one side (put this clause first) said this to the fortunate one: " Sir, this naked ascetic Seniya (is) a canine, a doer-of-hard-tasks.
        Ekamantaá¹ nisinno kho puá¹‡á¹‡o koliyaputto govatiko bhagavantaá¹ etadavoca: â€œayaá¹, bhante, acelo seniyo kukkuravatiko dukkarakÄrako chamÄnikkhittaá¹ bhojanaá¹ bhuÃ±jati.

        He eats (what is) thrown-on-the-ground.

        He (use genitive and past participle) has long (digharattam) conformed (to) that dog-vow.
        Tassa taá¹ kukkuravataá¹ dÄ«gharattaá¹ samattaá¹ samÄdinnaá¹.

        What (will be) his future state ? "
        Tassa kÄ gati, ko abhisamparÄyoâ€ti?

        " Enough, Punna, don’t bother with this. Don’t ask me this,"
        â€œAlaá¹, puá¹‡á¹‡a, tiá¹­á¹­hatetaá¹; mÄ maá¹ etaá¹ pucchÄ«â€ti.

        [Punna asks a second and a third time : the convention being that, however reluctant, one must satisfy an inquirer who persists in asking up to three times. In the Pali of this story the question is repeated with abbreviation (pe) in place of the second statement. The fortunate one reluctantly answers.]
        Dutiyampi kho puá¹‡á¹‡o koliyaputto govatiko â€¦peâ€¦ tatiyampi kho puá¹‡á¹‡o koliyaputto govatiko bhagavantaá¹ etadavoca: â€œayaá¹, bhante, acelo seniyo kukkuravatiko dukkarakÄrako chamÄnikkhittaá¹ bhojanaá¹ bhuÃ±jati. Tassa taá¹ kukkuravataá¹ dÄ«gharattaá¹ samattaá¹ samÄdinnaá¹. Tassa kÄ gati, ko abhisamparÄyoâ€ti?

        “. . . Nevertheless I will explain to you (te).
        â€œAddhÄ kho te ahaá¹, puá¹‡á¹‡a, na labhÄmi. Alaá¹, puá¹‡á¹‡a, tiá¹­á¹­hatetaá¹; mÄ maá¹ etaá¹ pucchÄ«ti; api ca tyÄhaá¹ byÄkarissÄmi.

        In this connection, Punna, someone develops the dog-vow perfectly (paripuá¹‡á¹‡am : accusative used as adverb) . . . Having developed the dog-vow perfectly, having developed the-virtue-of-a-dog perfectly, having developed the-mind-of-a-dog perfectly, having developed the-style-of-a- dog perfectly, after death he is reborn in the condition (acc.) of dogs.
        Idha, puá¹‡á¹‡a, ekacco kukkuravataá¹ bhÄveti paripuá¹‡á¹‡aá¹ abbokiá¹‡á¹‡aá¹, kukkurasÄ«laá¹ bhÄveti paripuá¹‡á¹‡aá¹ abbokiá¹‡á¹‡aá¹, kukkuracittaá¹ bhÄveti paripuá¹‡á¹‡aá¹ abbokiá¹‡á¹‡aá¹, kukkurÄkappaá¹ bhÄveti paripuá¹‡á¹‡aá¹ abbokiá¹‡á¹‡aá¹. So kukkuravataá¹ bhÄvetvÄ paripuá¹‡á¹‡aá¹ abbokiá¹‡á¹‡aá¹, kukkurasÄ«laá¹ bhÄvetvÄ paripuá¹‡á¹‡aá¹ abbokiá¹‡á¹‡aá¹, kukkuracittaá¹ bhÄvetvÄ paripuá¹‡á¹‡aá¹ abbokiá¹‡á¹‡aá¹, kukkurÄkappaá¹ bhÄvetvÄ paripuá¹‡á¹‡aá¹ abbokiá¹‡á¹‡aá¹ kÄyassa bhedÄ paraá¹ maraá¹‡Ä kukkurÄnaá¹ sahabyataá¹ upapajjati.

        But if (sace) he has the opinion (diiá¹­á¹­hi, fem. : Lesson 20) : â€˜By this virtue or vow I shall be a god,’ that (fem.) is his wrong-opinion.”
        Sace kho panassa evaá¹diá¹­á¹­hi hoti: â€˜iminÄhaá¹ sÄ«lena vÄ vatena vÄ tapena vÄ brahmacariyena vÄ devo vÄ bhavissÄmi devaÃ±Ã±ataro vÄâ€™ti, sÄssa hoti micchÄdiá¹­á¹­hi.

        (Wrong-opinion produces as future state either purgatory or birth as an animal.) MicchÄdiá¹­á¹­hissa kho ahaá¹, puá¹‡á¹‡a, dvinnaá¹ gatÄ«naá¹ aÃ±Ã±ataraá¹ gatiá¹ vadÄmiâ€”nirayaá¹ vÄ tiracchÄnayoniá¹ vÄ.
        Iti kho, puá¹‡á¹‡a, sampajjamÄnaá¹ kukkuravataá¹ kukkurÄnaá¹ sahabyataá¹ upaneti, vipajjamÄnaá¹ nirayanâ€ti.

        6.16 - Answers to Warder Lesson 19

        Answers to A.K. Warder “Introduction to Pali” Lesson 19

        Passage 1

        PÄyÄsisutta DN 23 PTS 2.316â€“2.358 23.11-23.67 (D II 343,8 - 346,18):

        te taá¹ƒ satthaá¹ƒ dvidhÄ vibhajiá¹ƒsu ekato paÃ±ca sakatasatÄni ekato paÃ±ca sakaá¹­asatÄni. eko tÄva satthavÄho bahuá¹ƒ tiá¹‡aÃ± ca kaá¹­á¹­haÃ± ca udakaÃ± ca ÄropetvÄ satthaá¹ƒ payÄpesi. dvÄ«hatÄ«hapÄyÄto kho pana so sattho addasÄ purisaá¹ƒ kalaá¹ƒ lohitakkhiá¹ƒ apanaddhakalÄpaá¹ƒ kumudamÄlaá¹ƒ allavatthaá¹ƒ allakesaá¹ƒ kaddamamakkhitehi cakkehi gadrabharathena patipathaá¹ƒ Ägacchantaá¹ƒ. disvÄ etad avoca : kuto bho ÄgacchasÄ« ti. amukamhÄ janapadÄ ti. kuhiá¹ƒ gamissasÄ« ti. amukaá¹ƒ nÄma janapadan ti. kacci bho purato kantÄre mahÄmegho abhippavaá¹­á¹­o ti. evam kho bho purato kantÄre mahÄmegho abhippavaá¹­á¹­o, ÄsittodakÄni vaá¹­umÄni, bahuá¹ƒ tiá¹‡aÃ± ca kaá¹­á¹­hÄÃ± ca udakaÃ± ca, chaá¸á¸etha bho purÄá¹‡Äni tiá¹‡ani katthÄni udakÄni, lahubhÄrehi sakaá¹­ehi sÄ«ghaá¹ƒ sÄ«ghaá¹ƒ gacchatha, mÄ yoggÄni kilamethÄ ti.

        atha kho so satthavÄho satthike Ämantesi : ayaá¹ƒ bho puriso evam Äha : purato kantÄre mahÄmegho abhippavaá¹­á¹­o, ÄsittodakÄni vaá¹­umÄni, bahuá¹ƒ tiá¹‡aÃ± ca katthaÃ± ca udakaÃ± ca, chaá¸á¸etha bho purÄá¹‡Äni tiá¹‡Äni kaá¹­á¹­hÄni udakÄni, lahubhÄrehi sakaá¹­ehi sÄ«ghaá¹ƒ sÄ«ghaá¹ƒ gacchatha, mÄ yoggÄni kilamethÄ ti chaá¸á¸etha bho purÄá¹‡Äni tiá¹‡Äni kaá¹­á¹­hÄni udakÄni, lahubhÄrehi sakaá¹­ehi satthaá¹ƒ pÄyÄpethÄ ti. evam bho ti kho te satthikÄ tassa satthavÄhassa paá¹­issutvÄ, chaá¸á¸etvÄ purÄá¹‡Äni tiá¹‡Äni kaá¹­á¹­hÄni udakÄni lahubhÄrehi sakaá¹­ehi satthaá¹ƒ pÄyÄpesuá¹ƒ. te paá¹­hame pi satthavÄse na addasaá¹ƒsu tiá¹‡aá¹ƒ vÄ kaá¹­á¹­haá¹ƒ vÄ udakaá¹ƒ vÄ, dutiye pi satthavÄse â€¦ tatiye pi satthavÄse â€¦ catutthe pi satthavÄse â€¦ paÃ±came pi satthavÄse â€¦ chaá¹­á¹­he pi satthavÄse â€¦ sattame pi satthavÄse na addasaá¹ƒsu tiá¹‡aá¹ƒ vÄ kaá¹­á¹­haá¹ƒ vÄ udakaá¹ƒ vÄ, sabbe va anayavyasanaá¹ƒ Äpajjiá¹ƒsu. ye ca tasmiá¹ƒ satthe ahesuá¹ƒ manussÄ vÄ pasÅ« vÄ sabbe so yakkho amanusso bhakkhesi, aá¹­á¹­hikÄnâ€™ eva sesesi.

        yadÄ aÃ±Ã±Äsi dutiyo satthavÄho : bahunikkhanto kho dÄni so sattho ti, bahuá¹ƒ tiá¹‡aÃ± ca kaá¹­á¹­haÃ± ca udakaÃ± ca ÄropetvÄ satthaá¹ƒ pÄyÄpesi. dvÄ«hatÄ«hapÄyÄto kho panâ€™ eso sattho addasÄ purisaá¹ƒ kÄlaá¹ƒ lohitakkhiá¹ƒ apanaddhakalÄpaá¹ƒ kumudamÄlaá¹ƒ allavatthaá¹ƒ allakesaá¹ƒ kaddamamamkkhitehi cakkehi gadrabharathena patipathaá¹ƒ Ägacchantaá¹ƒ. disvÄ etad avoca : kuto bho ÄgacchasÄ« ti. amukamhÄ janapadÄ ri. kuhiá¹ƒ gamissasÄ« ti. amukaá¹ƒ nÄma janapadan ti. kacci kho purato kantÄre mahÄmegho abhippavaá¹­á¹­o ti. evam bho purato kantÄre mahÄmegho abhippavaá¹­á¹­o, ÄsittodakÄni vaá¹­umÄni, bahuá¹ƒ tiá¹‡aÃ± ca kaá¹­á¹­haÃ± ca udakaÃ± ca, chaá¸á¸etha bho purÄnÄni tiá¹‡Äni kaá¹­á¹­hani udakÄni, lahubhÄrehi sakaá¹­ehi sÄ«ghaá¹ƒ sÄ«ghaá¹ƒ gacchatha, mÄ yoggÄni kilamethÄ ti.

        atha kho so satthavÄho satthike Ämantesi : ayaá¹ƒ bho puriso evam Äha : purato kantÄre mahÄmegho abhippavaá¹­á¹­o, ÄsittodakÄni vaá¹­umÄni bahuá¹ƒ tiá¹‡ÄÃ± ca kaá¹­á¹­haÃ± ca udakaÃ± ca, chaá¸á¸etha bho purÄá¹‡Äni tiá¹‡Äni kaá¹­á¹­hÄni udakÄni, lahubhÄrehi sakaá¹­ehi sÄ«ghaá¹ƒ sÄ«ghaá¹ƒ gacchatha, mÄ yoggÄni kilamethÄ ti. ayaá¹ƒ kho bho puriso nâ€™ evâ€™ amhÄkaá¹ƒ mitto na pi Ã±ÄtisÄlohito, kathaá¹ƒ mayaá¹ƒ imassa saddhÄya gamissÄma. na kho chaá¸á¸etabbÄni purÄá¹‡Äni tiá¹‡Äni kaá¹­á¹­hÄni udakÄni, yathÄkatena bhaá¹‡á¸ena satthaá¹ƒ pÄyÄpetha, na vo purÄá¹‡aá¹ƒ chaá¸á¸essÄmÄ ti. evaá¹ƒ bho ti kho te satthikÄ tassa satthavÄhassa paá¹­issutvÄ yathÄkatena bhaá¹‡á¸ena satthaá¹ƒ pÄyÄpesuá¹ƒ. te paá¹­hame pi satthavÄse na addasaá¹ƒsu tiá¹‡aá¹ƒ vÄ kaá¹­á¹­haá¹ƒ vÄ udakaá¹ƒ vÄ, dutiye pi satthavÄse â€¦ tatiye pi satthavÄse â€¦ catutthe pi satthavÄse â€¦ paÃ±came pi satthavÄse â€¦ chaá¹­á¹­he pi satthavÄse â€¦ sattame pi satthavÄse na addasaá¹ƒsu tiá¹‡aá¹ƒ vÄ kaá¹­á¹­haá¹ƒ vÄ udakaá¹ƒ vÄ, taÃ± ca satthaá¹ƒ addasaá¹ƒsu anayavyasanaá¹ƒ apannaá¹ƒ. ye va tasmiá¹ƒ satthe ahesuá¹ƒ manussÄ vÄ pasÅ« vÄ, tesaÃ± ca atthikÄnâ€™ eva addasaá¹ƒsu tena yakkhena amanussena bhakkhitÄnaá¹ƒ.

        atha kho so satthavÄho satthike Ämantesi : ayaá¹ƒ kho bho so sattho anayavyasanaá¹ƒ Äpanno yathÄ taá¹ƒ tena bÄlena satthavÄhena pariá¹‡Äyakena. tena hi bho yÄnâ€™ asmÄkaá¹ƒ satthe appasÄrÄni paá¹‡iyÄni, tÄni chaá¸á¸etvÄ, yÄni imasmiá¹ƒ satthe mahÄsÄrÄni paá¹‡iyÄni tÄni ÄdiyathÄ ti. evaá¹ƒ bho ti kho te satthikÄ tassa satthavÄhassa paá¹­issutvÄ yÄni sakasmiá¹ƒ satthe appasÄrÄni paá¹‡iyÄni tÄni chaá¸á¸etvÄ, yÄni tasmiá¹ƒ satthe mahÄsÄrÄni paá¹‡iyÄni tÄni ÄdiyitvÄ, sotthinÄ taá¹ƒ kantÄraá¹ƒ nitthariá¹ƒsu yathÄ taá¹ƒ paá¹‡á¸itena satthavÄhena pariá¹‡Äyakena.

        te taá¹ƒ satthaá¹ƒ dvidhÄ vibhajiá¹ƒsu ekato paÃ±ca sakatasatÄni ekato paÃ±ca sakaá¹­asatÄni.
        ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(ta) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(ta) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(sattha) ğŸ”¼(dvidhÄ) â®ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨‚(vibhaji) ğŸš¹â‘¤â¨€(eka) âš§â‘ â¨‚(paÃ±ca) ğŸš»â‘¡â¨‚(sakaá¹­asata)
        they | that | caravan | in two pieces | divided | from a single | five / one hundred carts
        They divided that caravan into two pieces each with 500 carts.

        eko tÄva satthavÄho bahuá¹ƒ tiá¹‡aÃ± ca kaá¹­á¹­haÃ± ca udakaÃ± ca ÄropetvÄ satthaá¹ƒ payÄpesi.
        ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(eka) ğŸ”¼(tÄva) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(satthavÄha) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(bahu) ğŸš»â‘¡â¨€(tiá¹‡a) ğŸ”¼(ca) ğŸš»â‘¡â¨€(udaka) ğŸ”¼(ca) ğŸ”¼(ÄropetvÄ) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(sattha) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤˜â¨€(payÄpeti)
        one | first | caravan leader | a lot of | straw | and | water | and | having loaded up | caravan | began the journey
        First, one caravan leader, having loaded up the caravan with lots of straw and water, began the journey.

        dvÄ«hatÄ«hapayÄto kho pana so sattho addasÄ purisaá¹ƒ kalaá¹ƒ lohitakkhiá¹ƒ apanaddhakalÄpaá¹ƒ kumudamÄlaá¹ƒ allavatthaá¹ƒ allakesaá¹ƒ kaddamamakkhitehi cakkehi gadrabharathena patipathaá¹ƒ Ägacchantaá¹ƒ. ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(dvÄ«hatÄ«hapayÄta) ğŸ”¼(kho pana) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(ta) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(sattha) â†©ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(addasÄ) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(purisa) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(kala) ğŸšºâ‘¡â¨€(lohitakkhi) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(apanaddhakalÄpa) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(allakesa) ğŸšºâ‘¡â¨€(kumudamÄlÄ) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(allavattha) ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨‚(kaddamamakkhita) ğŸš»â‘¤â¨‚(cakka) ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨€(gadrabharatha) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(patipatha) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(Ägacchanta) travelled for 2 or 3 days | and next | that | caravan | saw | person | black | with red eyes | with quiver tied behind; (or “with the hair-knot untiedâ€) | white water lily garland | with wet clothes | with wet hair | with mud splattered | with wheels | donkey coach | opposite road | approaching And next, after travelling for 2 or 3 days, that caravan encountered a dark person with red eyes, quiver tied behind, wet clothes and hair, in a donkey coach with mud splattered wheels approaching from the other direction of the road.

        disvÄ etad avoca : kuto bho ÄgacchasÄ« ti.
        ğŸ”¼(disvÄ) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(eta) ğŸ”µâ®ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(avoca) ğŸ”¼(kuto) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨€(bhavant) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤˜â¨€(Ägacchati) ğŸ”¼(ti)
        having seen | this | said : from where | sir | come along | quote
        Having seen, this was said: â€œSir, where have you come from?â€

        amukamhÄ janapadÄ ti.
        ğŸš¹â‘¤â¨€(amuka) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(janapada) ğŸ”¼(ti)
        from such and such | country | quote
        â€œFrom such and such country.â€

        kuhiá¹ƒ gamissasÄ« ti. ğŸ”¼(kuhiá¹ƒ) â­ğŸ¤˜â¨€(gamissati) ğŸ”¼(ti) where? | you will go | quote â€œWhere will you go?â€

        such and such | named | country | quote
        â€œTo such and such named country.â€

        kacci bho purato kantÄre mahÄmegho abhippavaá¹­á¹­o ti.
        ğŸ”¼(kacci) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨€(bhavant) ğŸ”¼(purato) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨‚(kantÄra) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(mahÄmegha) ğŸ”¼(abhippavaá¹­á¹­a) ğŸ”¼(ti)
        I suspect | sir | in front of | desert | a great downpour | rained upon | quote
        â€œI suspect, sir, a great downpour rained in the desert in front of us.â€

        evam kho bho purato kantÄre mahÄmegho abhippavaá¹­á¹­o, ÄsittodakÄni vaá¹­umÄni, bahuá¹ƒ tiá¹‡aÃ± ca kaá¹­á¹­hÄÃ± ca udakaÃ± ca, chaá¸á¸etha bho purÄá¹‡Äni tiá¹‡ani katthÄni udakÄni, lahubhÄrehi sakaá¹­ehi sÄ«ghaá¹ƒ sÄ«ghaá¹ƒ gacchatha, mÄ yoggÄni kilamethÄ ti.
        ğŸ”¼(evam) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨€(bhavant) ğŸ”¼(purato) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨‚(kantÄra) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(mahÄmegha) ğŸ”¼(abhippavaá¹­á¹­a) , ğŸš»â‘ â¨‚(Äsittodaka) ğŸš»â‘ â¨‚(vaá¹­uma) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(bahu) ğŸš»â‘¡â¨€(tiá¹‡a) ğŸ”¼(ca) ğŸš»â‘¡â¨€(udaka) ğŸ”¼(ca) , â¹ğŸ¤˜â¨‚(chaá¸á¸eti) ğŸ”¼(bho) ğŸš»â‘¡â¨‚(purÄá¹‡a) ğŸš»â‘¡â¨‚(tiá¹‡a kattha udaka) ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨‚(lahubhÄra) ğŸš»â‘¢â¨‚(sakaá¹­a) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(sÄ«gha sÄ«gha) â¹ğŸ¤˜â¨‚(gacchati) ğŸ”¼(mÄ) ğŸš»â‘¡â¨‚(yogga) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(kilameti)
        thus | sir | in front of | desert | a great downpour | rained upon , waterlogged | path | a lot of | straw | and | water | and , you must throw away | sir | stale | grass | wood | water | with a light load | with cart | quickly | move | do not | vehicle | exhaust
        â€œThatâ€™s right, sir, a great downpour rained in desert in front of you, the path is waterlogged, there are lots of straw and water, sir, you must throw away stale grass, wood and water, with a lightly loaded cart you must move quickly, donâ€™t wear down the vehicle.â€

        atha kho so satthavÄho satthike Ämantesi : ayaá¹ƒ bho puriso evam Äha : purato kantÄre mahÄmegho abhippavaá¹­á¹­o, ÄsittodakÄni vaá¹­umÄni, bahuá¹ƒ tiá¹‡aÃ± ca katthaÃ± ca udakaÃ± ca, chaá¸á¸etha bho purÄá¹‡Äni tiá¹‡Äni kaá¹­á¹­hÄni udakÄni, lahubhÄrehi sakaá¹­ehi sÄ«ghaá¹ƒ sÄ«ghaá¹ƒ gacchatha, mÄ yoggÄni kilamethÄ ti chaá¸á¸etha bho purÄá¹‡Äni tiá¹‡Äni kaá¹­á¹­hÄni udakÄni, lahubhÄrehi sakaá¹­ehi satthaá¹ƒ pÄyÄpethÄ ti.
        ğŸ”¼(atha bho) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(ta) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(satthavÄha) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨‚(satthika) â®ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(Ämantesi) : ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(ima) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨€(bhavant) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(purisa) ğŸ”¼(evaá¹ƒ) ğŸ”„ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(Äha) â€¦ ğŸ”¼(bho) ğŸš»â‘¡â¨‚(purÄá¹‡a) ğŸš»â‘¡â¨‚(tiá¹‡a kattha udaka) , ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨‚(lahubhÄra) ğŸš»â‘¢â¨‚(sakaá¹­a) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(sattha) ğŸ”µâ¯ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(payÄpeti) ğŸ”¼(ti)
        after that | that | caravan leader | wagon driver | discussed : this | sir | person | thus | said : (as above) | sir | you must throw away | stale | grass | wood | water | with a light load | with cart | caravan | cause to set out | quote
        After that, that caravan leader discussed with the wagon driver: â€œThis person said thus: â€˜a great downpour rained in desert in front of us, the path is waterlogged, there are lots of straw and water, sir, you must throw away stale grass, wood and water, with a lightly loaded cart you must move quickly, donâ€™t wear down the vehicle.â€™ Sir, you must throw away stale grass, wood and water, with a lightly loaded cart, you will cause the caravan to set outâ€

        evam bho ti kho te satthikÄ tassa satthavÄhassa paá¹­issutvÄ, chaá¸á¸etvÄ purÄá¹‡Äni tiá¹‡Äni kaá¹­á¹­hÄni udakÄni lahubhÄrehi sakaá¹­ehi satthaá¹ƒ pÄyÄpesuá¹ƒ.
        ğŸ”¼(evam) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨€(bhavant) ğŸ”¼(ti kho) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(ta) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(satthika) ğŸš¹â‘£â¨€(satthavÄha) ğŸ”¼(paá¹­issutvÄ) , ğŸ”¼(chaá¸á¸etvÄ) ğŸš»â‘¡â¨‚(purÄá¹‡a) ğŸš»â‘¡â¨‚(tiá¹‡a kattha udaka) ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨‚(lahubhÄra) ğŸš»â‘¢â¨‚(sakaá¹­a) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(sattha) â®ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(pÄyÄpesi)
        thus | sir | quote | indeed | they | wagon driver | (for) caravan leader | having agreed with , having thrown away stale | grass | wood | water | with a light load | with cart | caravan | caused to set out
        â€œYes, sir.â€ The wagon driver, having agreed with the caravan leader, they threw away stale grass, wood and water, and with a lightly loaded cart, (the wagon driver) caused the caravan to set out.

        te paá¹­hame pi satthavÄse na addasaá¹ƒsu tiá¹‡aá¹ƒ vÄ kaá¹­á¹­haá¹ƒ vÄ udakaá¹ƒ vÄ, dutiye pi satthavÄse â€¦ tatiye pi satthavÄse â€¦ catutthe pi satthavÄse â€¦ paÃ±came pi satthavÄse â€¦ chaá¹­á¹­he pi satthavÄse â€¦ sattame pi satthavÄse na addasaá¹ƒsu tiá¹‡aá¹ƒ vÄ kaá¹­á¹­haá¹ƒ vÄ udakaá¹ƒ vÄ, sabbe va anayavyasanaá¹ƒ Äpajjiá¹ƒsu.

        â€œTherefore, sir, having discarded whichever articles of trade of little worth for us in (our) caravan, take whichever articles of immense value in (that) caravan.â€

        evaá¹ƒ bho ti kho te satthikÄ tassa satthavÄhassa paá¹­issutvÄ yÄni sakasmiá¹ƒ satthe appasÄrÄni paá¹‡iyÄni tÄni chaá¸á¸etvÄ, yÄni tasmiá¹ƒ satthe mahÄsÄrÄni paá¹‡iyÄni tÄni ÄdiyitvÄ, sotthinÄ taá¹ƒ kantÄraá¹ƒ nitthariá¹ƒsu yathÄ taá¹ƒ paá¹‡á¸itena satthavÄhena pariá¹‡Äyakena.
        ğŸ”¼(evam) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨€(bhavant) ğŸ”¼(ti kho) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(ta) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(satthika) ğŸš¹â‘£â¨€(satthavÄha) ğŸ”¼(paá¹­issutvÄ) , ğŸš»â‘ â¨‚(ya) ğŸš¹â‘¦â¨€(saka) ğŸš¹â‘¦â¨€(sattha) ğŸš»â‘¡â¨‚(appasÄra) ğŸš»â‘¡â¨‚(paá¹‡iya) , â‘ â¨‚(ya)) ğŸš¹â‘¦â¨€(ta) ğŸš¹â‘¦â¨€(sattha)ğŸš»â‘¡â¨‚(mahÄsÄra) ğŸš»â‘¡â¨‚(paá¹‡iya) ğŸš»â‘ â¨‚(ta) ğŸ”¼(ÄdiyitvÄ) , ğŸ”¼(sotthinÄ) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(ta) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(kantÄra) â®ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨‚(nitthari) ğŸ”¼(yathÄ) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(ta) ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨€(paá¹‡á¸ita) ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨€(satthavÄha) ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨€(pariá¹‡Äyaka)
        thus | sir | quote | indeed | they | wagon driver | (for) caravan leader | having agreed with , whichever | at own | in caravan | of little worth | article of trade | that | having discarded , whichever | in that | in caravan | of immense wealth | article of trade , having taken , safely | that | desert | crossed over | according to | that | with wise | caravan leader | leader
        Yes, sir.â€ The wagon driver, having agreed with the caravan leader, having discarded whichever articles of trade of little worth in own caravan, having taken whichever articles of immense value in that caravan, safely crossed over the desert in accordance with the wise caravan leader.

        Passage 2

        KÅ«á¹­adantasutta DN 5 PTS 1.127â€“1.149 1.1-1.4, 3.1-3.5, 4.1-4.13, 5.1-6.5, 7.36-11.13 (D I 127,1 - 135,28):

        Evaá¹ me sutaá¹. Ekaá¹ samayaá¹ bhagavÄ Magadhesu cÄrikaá¹ caramÄno mahatÄ bhikkhusaá¹…ghena saddhiá¹ yena KhÄá¹‡umataá¹ nÄma MagadhÄnaá¹ brÄhmaá¹‡agÄmo tad avasari. Tatra sudaá¹ bhagavÄ KhÄá¹‡umate viharati Ambalaá¹­á¹­hikÄyaá¹. Tena kho pana samayena KÅ«á¹­adanto brÄhmaá¹‡o KhÄá¹‡umataá¹ ajjhÄvasati sattussadaá¹ satiá¹‡akaá¹­á¹­hodakaá¹ sadhaÃ±Ã±aá¹ rÄjabhoggaá¹ raÃ±Ã±Ä MÄgadhena Seniyena BimbisÄrena dinnaá¹ rÄjadÄyaá¹ brahmadeyyaá¹.

        Tena kho pana samayena KÅ«á¹­adanto brÄhmaá¹‡o upari pÄsÄde divÄseyyaá¹ upagato hoti. AddasÄ kho KÅ«á¹­adanto brÄhmaá¹‡o KhÄá¹‡umatake brÄhmaá¹‡agahapatike KhÄá¹‡umatÄ nikkhamitvÄ saá¹…ghasaá¹…ghÄ«gaá¹‡Ä«bhÅ«te yena ambalaá¹­á¹­hikÄ tenâ€™ upasaá¹…kamante. DisvÄ khattaá¹ Ämantesi: kiá¹ nu kho bho khatte KhÄá¹‡umatakÄ brÄhmaá¹‡agahapatikÄ KhÄá¹‡umatÄ nikkhamitvÄ saá¹…ghasaá¹…ghÄ«gaá¹‡Ä«bhÅ«tÄ yena Ambalaá¹­á¹­hikÄ tenâ€™ upasaá¹…kamantÄ« ti? Atthi kho bho samaá¹‡o Gotamo Sakyaputto SakyakulÄ pabbajito. Magadhesu cÄrikaá¹ caramÄno mahatÄ bhikkhusaá¹…ghena saddhiá¹ KhÄá¹‡umataá¹ anuppatto KhÄá¹‡umate viharati Ambalaá¹­á¹­hikÄyaá¹. Tam ete bhavantaá¹ Gotamaá¹ dassanÄya upasaá¹…kamantÄ« ti. Atha kho KÅ«á¹­adantassa brÄhmaá¹‡assa etad ahosi: sutaá¹ kho pana mâ€™ etaá¹: samaá¹‡o gotamo tividhayaÃ±Ã±asampadaá¹ jÄnÄtÄ« ti. Na kho panÄhaá¹ jÄnÄmi tividhaá¹yaÃ±Ã±asampadaá¹, icchÄmi cÄhaá¹ mahÄyaÃ±Ã±aá¹ yajituá¹. Yan nÅ«nÄhaá¹ samaá¹‡aá¹ Gotamaá¹ upasaá¹…kamitvÄ tividhayaÃ±Ã±asampadaá¹ puccheyyan ti.

        Atha kho kÅ«á¹­adanto brÄhmaá¹‡o khattaá¹ Ämantesi: tena hi bho khatte yena KhÄá¹‡umatakÄ brÄhmaá¹‡agahapatikÄ tenâ€™ upasaá¹…kama. upasaá¹…kamitvÄ KhÄá¹‡umatake brÄhmaá¹‡agahapatike evaá¹ vadehi: KÅ«á¹­adanto bho brÄhmaá¹‡o evam Äha : Ägamentu kira bhavanto, KÅ«á¹­adanto pi brÄhmaá¹‡o samaá¹‡aá¹ Gotamaá¹ dassanÄya upasaá¹…kamissatÄ« ti. Evaá¹ bho ti kho so khattÄ KÅ«á¹­adantassa brÄhmaá¹‡assa paá¹­issutvÄ yena KhÄá¹‡umatakÄ brÄhmaá¹‡agahapatikÄ tenâ€™ upasaá¹…kami, upasaá¹…kamitvÄ KhÄá¹‡umatake brÄhmaá¹‡agahapatike etad avoca: KÅ«á¹­adanto bho brÄhmaá¹‡o evam Äha : Ägamentu kira bhavanto, KÅ«á¹­adanto pi brÄhmaá¹‡o samaá¹‡aá¹ Gotamaá¹ dassanÄya upasaá¹…kamissatÄ« ti. Tena kho pana samayena anekÄni brÄhmaá¹‡asatÄni KhÄá¹‡umate paá¹­ivasanti: KÅ«á¹­adantassa brÄhmaá¹‡assa mahÄyaÃ±Ã±aá¹ anubhavissÄmÄ ti. Assosuá¹ kho te brÄhmaá¹‡Ä: KÅ«á¹­adanto kira brÄhmaá¹‡o samaá¹‡aá¹ Gotamaá¹ dassanÄya upasaá¹…kamissatÄ« ti. Atha kho te brÄhmaá¹‡Ä yena KÅ«á¹­adanto brÄhmaá¹‡o tenâ€™ upasaá¹…kamiá¹su, upasaá¹…kamitvÄ KÅ«á¹­adantaá¹ brÄhmaá¹‡aá¹ etad avocuá¹: saccaá¹ kira bhavaá¹ KÅ«á¹­adanto samaá¹‡aá¹ Gotamaá¹ dassanÄya upasaá¹…kamissatÄ« ti? Evaá¹ kho me bho hoti: aham pi samaá¹‡aá¹ gotamaá¹ dassanÄya upasaá¹…kamissÄmÄ« ti. MÄ bhavaá¹ KÅ«á¹­adanto samaá¹‡aá¹ Gotamaá¹ dassanÄya upasaá¹…kami. Na arahati bhavaá¹ KÅ«á¹­adanto samaá¹‡aá¹ Gotamaá¹ dassanÄya upasaá¹…kamituá¹. Sace bhavaá¹ KÅ«á¹­adanto samaá¹‡aá¹ Gotamaá¹ dassanÄya upasaá¹…kamissati, bhoto KÅ«á¹­adantassa yaso hÄyissati, samaá¹‡assa Gotamassa yaso abhivaá¸á¸hissati. Yam pi bhoto KÅ«á¹­adantassa yaso hÄyissati, samaá¹‡assa Gotamassa yaso abhivaá¸á¸hissati, iminÄ pâ€™ aá¹…gena na arahati bhavaá¹ KÅ«á¹­adanto samaá¹‡aá¹ Gotamaá¹ dassanÄya upasaá¹…kamituá¹. Samaá¹‡o tv eva Gotamo arahati bhavantaá¹ KÅ«á¹­adantaá¹ dassanÄya upasaá¹…kamitun ti. Evaá¹ vutte KÅ«á¹­adanto brÄhmaá¹‡o te brÄhmaá¹‡e etad avoca: Tena hi, bho, mama pi suá¹‡Ätha yathÄ mayam eva arahÄma taá¹ bhavantaá¹ Gotamaá¹ dassanÄya upasaá¹…kamituá¹, na tv eva arahati so bhavaá¹ Gotamo amhÄkaá¹ dassanÄya upasaá¹…kamituá¹. Samaá¹‡o khalu bho Gotamo KhÄá¹‡umataá¹ anuppatto KhÄá¹‡umate viharati Ambalaá¹­á¹­hikÄyaá¹. Ye kho pana ke ci samaá¹‡Ä vÄ brÄhmaá¹‡Ä vÄ amhÄkaá¹ gÄmakhettaá¹ Ägacchanti atithÄ« no te honti. AtithÄ« kho panâ€™ amhehi sakkÄtabbÄ garukÄtabbÄ mÄnetabbÄ pÅ«jetabbÄ. Yam pi bho samaá¹‡o Gotamo KhÄá¹‡umataá¹ anuppatto KhÄá¹‡umate viharati Ambalaá¹­á¹­hikÄyaá¹, atithâ€™ amhÄkaá¹ samaá¹‡o Gotamo. Atithi kho panâ€™ amhehi sakkÄtabbo garukÄtabbo mÄnetabbo pÅ«jetabbo. IminÄ pâ€™ aá¹…gena nâ€™ Ärahati so bhavaá¹ Gotamo amhÄkaá¹ dassanÄya upasaá¹…kamituá¹. Atha kho mayam eva arahÄma taá¹ bhavantaá¹ Gotamaá¹ dassanÄya upasaá¹…kamitun ti.

        Atha kho KÅ«á¹­adanto brÄhmaá¹‡o mahatÄ brÄhmaá¹‡agaá¹‡ena saddhiá¹ yena Ambalaá¹­á¹­hikÄ yena bhagavÄ tenâ€™ upasaá¹…kami, upasaá¹…kamitvÄ bhagavatÄ saddhiá¹ sammodi sammodanÄ«yaá¹ kathaá¹ sÄraá¹‡Ä«yaá¹ vÄ«tisÄretvÄ ekamantaá¹ nisÄ«di. Ekamantaá¹ nisinno kho KÅ«á¹­adanto brÄhmaá¹‡o bhagavantaá¹ etad avoca: â€œsutaá¹ mâ€™ etaá¹, bho Gotama: â€˜samaá¹‡o Gotamo tividhayaÃ±Ã±asampadaá¹ jÄnÄtÄ« ti. Na kho panÄhaá¹ jÄnÄmi tividhayaÃ±Ã±asampadaá¹, icchÄmi cÄhaá¹ mahÄyaÃ±Ã±aá¹ yajituá¹. SÄdhu me bhavaá¹ Gotamo tividhayaÃ±Ã±asampadaá¹ desetÅ« ti. Tena hi brÄhmaá¹‡a suá¹‡Ähi sÄdhukaá¹ manasikarohi bhÄsissÄmÄ« ti. Evaá¹, bho ti kho KÅ«á¹­adanto brÄhmaá¹‡o bhagavato paccassosi. BhagavÄ etad avoca: bhÅ«tapubbaá¹ brÄhmaá¹‡a rÄjÄ MahÄvijito nÄma ahosi aá¸á¸ho mahaddhano mahÄbhogo pahÅ«tajÄtarÅ«parajato pahÅ«tavittÅ«pakaraá¹‡o pahÅ«tadhanadhaÃ±Ã±o paripuá¹‡á¹‡akosakoá¹­á¹­hÄgÄro. Atha kho brÄhmaá¹‡a raÃ±Ã±o MahÄvijitassa rahogatassa paá¹­isallÄ«nassa evaá¹ cetaso parivitakko udapÄdi: adhigatÄ kho me vipulÄ mÄnusakÄ bhogÄ, mahantaá¹ pathavimaá¹‡á¸alaá¹ abhivijiya ajjhÄvasÄmi, yan nÅ«nÄhaá¹ mahÄyaÃ±Ã±aá¹ yajeyyaá¹, yaá¹ mama assa dÄ«gharattaá¹ hitÄya sukhÄyÄâ€™ti. Atha kho, brÄhmaá¹‡a, rÄjÄ MahÄvijito purohitaá¹ brÄhmaá¹‡aá¹ ÄmantetvÄ etad avoca: idha mayhaá¹ brÄhmaá¹‡a rahogatassa paá¹­isallÄ«nassa evaá¹ cetaso parivitakko udapÄdi: adhigatÄ kho me vipulÄ mÄnusakÄ bhogÄ, mahantaá¹ pathavimaá¹‡á¸alaá¹ abhivijiya ajjhÄvasÄmi. Yan nÅ«nÄhaá¹ mahÄyaÃ±Ã±aá¹ yajeyyaá¹, yaá¹ mama assa dÄ«gharattaá¹ hitÄya sukhÄyÄ ti. IcchÄmâ€™ ahaá¹ brÄhmaá¹‡a mahÄyaÃ±Ã±aá¹ yajituá¹. AnusÄsatu maá¹ bhavaá¹ yaá¹ mama assa dÄ«gharattaá¹ hitÄya sukhÄyÄ ti.

        Evaá¹ vutte brÄhmaá¹‡a purohito brÄhmaá¹‡o rÄjÄnaá¹ MahÄvijitaá¹ etad avoca: bhoto kho raÃ±Ã±o janapado sakaá¹‡á¹­ako sauppÄ«á¸·o, gÄmaghÄtÄ pi dissanti nigamaghÄtÄ pi dissanti nagaraghÄtÄ pi dissanti panthaduhanÄ pi dissanti. Bhavaá¹ kho pana rÄjÄ evaá¹ sakaá¹‡á¹­ake janapade sauppÄ«á¸·e balimuddhareyya, akiccakÄrÄ« assa tena bhavaá¹ rÄjÄ. SiyÄ kho pana bhoto raÃ±Ã±o evam assa: aham etaá¹ dassukhÄ«laá¹ vadhena vÄ bandhena vÄ jÄniyÄ vÄ garahÄya vÄ pabbÄjanÄya vÄ samÅ«hanissÄmÄ« ti, na kho panetassa dassukhÄ«lassa evaá¹ sammÄ samugghÄto hoti. Ye te hatÄvasesakÄ bhavissanti, te pacchÄ raÃ±Ã±o janapadaá¹ viheá¹­hessanti. Api ca kho idaá¹ saá¹vidhÄnaá¹ Ägamma evam etassa dassukhÄ«lassa sammÄ samugghÄto hoti. Tena hi bhavaá¹ rÄjÄ ye bhoto raÃ±Ã±o janapade ussahanti kasigorakkhe, tesaá¹ bhavaá¹ rÄjÄ bÄ«jabhattaá¹ anuppadetu. Ye bhoto raÃ±Ã±o janapade ussahanti vÄá¹‡ijjÄya tesaá¹ bhavaá¹ rÄjÄ pÄbhataá¹ anuppadetu, ye bhoto raÃ±Ã±o janapade ussahanti rÄjaporise tesaá¹ bhavaá¹ rÄjÄ bhattavetanaá¹ pakappetu, te ca manussÄ sakammapasutÄ raÃ±Ã±o janapadaá¹ na viheá¹­hessanti; mahÄ ca raÃ±Ã±o rÄsiko bhavissati, khemaá¹­á¹­hitÄ janapadÄ akaá¹‡á¹­akÄ anuppÄ«á¸·Ä. ManussÄ mudÄ modamÄnÄ ure putte naccentÄ apÄrutagharÄ maÃ±Ã±e viharissantÄ« ti.

        Evaá¹ me sutaá¹.
        ğŸ”¼(evaá¹ƒ) ğŸ‘†â‘¢â¨€(ahaá¹ƒ) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(suta)
        thus | by me | heard
        Thus was heard by me.

        Ekaá¹ samayaá¹ bhagavÄ Magadhesu cÄrikaá¹ caramÄno mahatÄ bhikkhusaá¹…ghena saddhiá¹ yena KhÄá¹‡umataá¹ nÄma MagadhÄnaá¹ brÄhmaá¹‡agÄmo tad avasari.
        ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(eka) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(samaya) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(bhagavant) ğŸš¹â‘¦â¨‚(magadha) ğŸšºâ‘¡â¨€(cÄrikÄ) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(caramÄna) ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨€(mahanta) ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨€(bhikkhusaá¹…gha) ğŸ”¼(saddhiá¹ƒ) ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨€(ya) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(khÄá¹‡umata) ğŸ”¼(nÄma) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(magadha) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(brÄhmaá¹‡agÄma) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(ta) â®ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(avasari)
        one | time | the Blessed One | at Magadha | walking journey | walking in | with a large | community of monastics | by where | KhÄá¹‡umata | named | Magadha | village | that | arrived
        At one occasion the Blessed One was doing a walking journey in Magadha together with a large retinue of bhikkhus and arrived where a Magadhan holy village named KhÄá¹‡umata was.

        Tatra sudaá¹ bhagavÄ KhÄá¹‡umate viharati Ambalaá¹­á¹­hikÄyaá¹.
        ğŸ”¼(tatra) ğŸ”¼(sudaá¹ƒ) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(bhagavant) ğŸš»â‘¦â¨€(khÄá¹‡umata) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(viharati) ğŸšºâ‘¦â¨€(ambalaá¹­á¹­hikÄ)
        in that place | surely | the Blessed One | at KhÄá¹‡umata | stays | Ambalaá¹­á¹­hikÄ
        At that place of course the Blessed One stays at Ambalaá¹­á¹­hikÄ (monastery) in KhÄá¹‡umata.

        Tena kho pana samayena KÅ«á¹­adanto brÄhmaá¹‡o KhÄá¹‡umataá¹ ajjhÄvasati sattussadaá¹ satiá¹‡akaá¹­á¹­hodakaá¹ sadhaÃ±Ã±aá¹ rÄjabhoggaá¹ raÃ±Ã±Ä MÄgadhena Seniyena BimbisÄrena dinnaá¹ rÄjadÄyaá¹ brahmadeyyaá¹.

        by there | and next | time | KÅ«á¹­adanta | holy man | KhÄá¹‡umata | is settled | full of life } full of grass, wood and water | full on grain, crops | crown property | by King | by of Magadha | by Seniya | by BimbisÄra | offering | royal endowment | grant
        At that time the holy man KÅ«á¹­adanta is settled at KÅ«á¹­adanta, which was a crown property full of life, grass, wood, water, grain, crops, and it was a royal endowment and grant of King Seniya BimbisÄra of Magadha.

        Tena kho pana samayena KÅ«á¹­adanto brÄhmaá¹‡o upari pÄsÄde divÄseyyaá¹ upagato hoti.

        At that time the holy man KÅ«á¹­adanta has entered into his midday rest in the top of his mansion.

        The holy man KÅ«á¹­adanta saw the Brahmans and householders of KhÄá¹‡umata, having left from KhÄá¹‡umata clustered in groups, approach Ambalaá¹­á¹­hikÄ.

        ğŸ”¼(disvÄ) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(khatta) â®ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(Ämantesi) : ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(ka) ğŸ”¼(nu kho) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨€(bhavant) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨‚(khatta) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(khÄá¹‡umataka)) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(brÄhmaá¹‡agahapatikÄ) ğŸš»â‘¤â¨€(khÄá¹‡umata) ğŸ”¼(nikkhamitvÄ saá¹ghÄsaá¹ghÄ«gaá¹‡Ä«bhÅ«te) ğŸš»â‘¢â¨€(ya) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨‚(ambalaá¹­á¹­hikÄ) ğŸš»â‘¢â¨€(ta) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨‚(upasaá¹…kamati) ğŸ”¼(ti)
        having seen | steward | addressed: why | does? | sir steward | of KhÄá¹‡umata | Brahmans and householders | from KhÄá¹‡umata | having left clustered in groups | by where | Ambalaá¹­á¹­hikÄ | by there | approach
        Having seen, (he) addressed the steward: â€œSteward sir, why do the Brahmans and householders of KhÄá¹‡umata, having left from KhÄá¹‡umata clustered in groups, approach Ambalaá¹­á¹­hikÄ?â€

        Atthi kho bho samaá¹‡o Gotamo Sakyaputto SakyakulÄ pabbajito.
        â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(atthi) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨€(bhavant) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(samaá¹‡a) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(gotama) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(sakyaputta) ğŸš»â‘¤â¨€(sakyakula) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(pabbajita)
        there exists | sir | ascetic | Gotama | young Sakyan | of the Sakyan clan | renunciant
        â€œSir, the young Saktan ascetic Gotama of the Sakyan clan, the renunciant, is there.â€

        Magadhesu cÄrikaá¹ caramÄno mahatÄ bhikkhusaá¹…ghena saddhiá¹ KhÄá¹‡umataá¹ anuppatto KhÄá¹‡umate viharati Ambalaá¹­á¹­hikÄyaá¹.
        ğŸš¹â‘¦â¨‚(magadha) ğŸšºâ‘¡â¨€(cÄrikÄ) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(caramÄna) ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨€(mahanta) ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨€(bhikkhusaá¹…gha) ğŸ”¼(saddhiá¹ƒ) ğŸš»â‘¡â¨€(khÄá¹‡umata) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(anuppatta) ğŸš»â‘¡â¨‚(khÄá¹‡umata) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(viharati) ğŸšºâ‘¡â¨‚(ambalaá¹­á¹­hikÄ)
        at Magadha | walking journey | walking in | with a large | community of monastics | KhÄá¹‡umata | arrived | KhÄá¹‡umata | dwells in | Ambalaá¹­á¹­hikÄ
        He was doing a walking journey in Magadha together with a large retinue of bhikkhus, arrived at KhÄá¹‡umata and is dwelling in Ambalaá¹­á¹­hikÄ in KhÄá¹‡umata.

        Tam ete bhavantaá¹ Gotamaá¹ dassanÄya upasaá¹…kamantÄ« ti.

        thus | said | KÅ«á¹­adanta | holy man | those | brahmans | this | said : in that is so | sir | of I | too | you please hear | since | we | evne/still/just | are worthy of | ascetic | Gotama | for seeing | to approach , no | however | worthy | venerable | Gotama | us | for seeing | to approach
        KÅ«á¹­adanta the holy man replied to what those brahmans said: â€œHowever, sir, please hear this of me, since it is worthy for us to approach the ascetic Gotama for seeing, however it is not worthy for venerable Gotama to approach us for seeing.â€

        ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(samaá¹‡a) ğŸ”¼(khalu) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(bhavant) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(gotama) ğŸš»â‘¡â¨€(khÄá¹‡umata) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(anuppatta) ğŸš»â‘¦â¨€(khÄá¹‡umata) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(viharati) ğŸšºâ‘¡â¨‚(ambalaá¹­á¹­hikÄ)

        â€œCertainly, the venerable ascetic Gotama has arrived at KhÄá¹‡umata and dwells in Ambalaá¹­á¹­hikÄ at KhÄá¹‡umata.â€

        Ye kho pana ke ci samaá¹‡Ä vÄ brÄhmaá¹‡Ä vÄ amhÄkaá¹ gÄmakhettaá¹ Ägacchanti atithÄ« no te honti.
        ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(ya) ğŸ”¼(kho pana) ğŸš»â‘ â¨‚(ka) ğŸ”¼(ci) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(samaá¹‡a) ğŸ”¼(vÄ) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(brÄhmaá¹‡a) ğŸ”¼(vÄ) ğŸ‘†â‘¥â¨‚(ahaá¹ƒ) ğŸš»â‘¡â¨€(gÄmakhetta) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨‚(Ägacchati) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨‚(atithi) ğŸ”¼(no) ğŸ¤˜â‘¥â¨€(tvaá¹ƒ) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨‚(hoti)

        thus | spoken | holy man | royal advisor | chief priest | king | MahÄvijita | this | said : for master | ğŸ’¡| king | country | troubled | oppressed , sacking of a village | too | is observed | plundering of a town | too | is observed | looting of a city | too | is observed | highway robbery | too | is observed

        â€œAnd now, my master the king will impose taxes on the troubled and the oppressed in the country, on that account my master the King is doing what ought not to be done.â€

        SiyÄ kho pana bhoto raÃ±Ã±o evam assa: aham etaá¹ dassukhÄ«laá¹ vadhena vÄ bandhena vÄ jÄniyÄ vÄ garahÄya vÄ pabbÄjanÄya vÄ samÅ«hanissÄmÄ« ti, na kho panetassa dassukhÄ«lassa evaá¹ sammÄ samugghÄto hoti.
        â¯ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(siyÄ) ğŸ”¼(kho pana) ğŸš¹â‘£â¨€(bhavant) ğŸš¹â‘£â¨€(rÄja) ğŸ”¼(evaá¹ƒ) ğŸš»â‘¥â¨€(ima) : ğŸ‘†â‘ â¨€(ahaá¹ƒ) ğŸš»â‘¡â¨€(eta) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(dassukhÄ«la) ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨€(vadha) ğŸ”¼(vÄ) ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨€(bandha) ğŸ”¼(vÄ) ğŸšºâ‘¢â¨€(jÄni) ğŸ”¼(vÄ) ğŸšºâ‘¢â¨€(garahÄ) ğŸ”¼(vÄ) ğŸš»â‘£â¨€(pabbÄjana) ğŸ”¼(vÄ) â­ğŸ‘†â¨€(samÅ«hanati) ğŸ”¼(ti) , ğŸ”¼(na) ğŸ”¼(kho pana) ğŸš»â‘¥â¨€(eta) ğŸš¹â‘¥â¨€(dassukhÄ«la) ğŸ”¼(evaá¹) ğŸ”¼(sammÄ) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(samugghÄta) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(hoti)
        could be | and now | master | king | thus | of this : I | this | robber plague | by punishing | or | by imprisoning | or | by seizing | or | by criticising | or | for banishing | or | will eradicate | quote , no | and now | of this | of robber plague | thus | completely | eradication | is
        â€˜And now, my master the king might think: â€œI will eradicate this robber plague by punishing, imprisoning, seizing, criticising for banishment.â€ However, thus is not the complete eradication of this robber plague.â€™

        Ye te hatÄvasesakÄ bhavissanti, te pacchÄ raÃ±Ã±o janapadaá¹ viheá¹­hessanti.
        ğŸš»â‘ â¨‚(ya) ğŸš»â‘ â¨‚(ta) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(hatÄvasesaka) â­ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨‚(bhavissati) , ğŸš»â‘ â¨‚(ta) ğŸ”¼(pacchÄ) ğŸš¹â‘¥â¨€(rÄja) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(janapada) â­ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨‚(viheá¹­heti)
        whoever | those | surviving | will become , they | afterwards | of king | country | will disturb
        â€œWhoever those that will survive, they will disturb the country of the king afterwards.â€

        Api ca kho idaá¹ saá¹vidhÄnaá¹ Ägamma evam etassa dassukhÄ«lassa sammÄ samugghÄto hoti.
        ğŸ”¼(api ca) ğŸ”¼(kho) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(ima) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(saá¹ƒvidhÄna) ğŸ”¼(Ägamma) ğŸ”¼(evaá¹ƒ) ğŸš»â‘¥â¨€(eta) ğŸš¹â‘¥â¨€(dassukhÄ«la) ğŸ”¼(sammÄ) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(samugghÄta) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(hoti)
        but | ğŸ’¡| this | planning | concerning | thus | of this | of robber plague | completely | eradication | is
        â€œAlternatively, here is a plan for the complete eradication of this robber plague.â€

        Tena hi bhavaá¹ rÄjÄ ye bhoto raÃ±Ã±o janapade ussahanti kasigorakkhe, tesaá¹ bhavaá¹ rÄjÄ bÄ«jabhattaá¹ anuppadetu.
        ğŸ”¼(tena hi) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨€(bhavanta) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨€(rÄja) ğŸš»â‘ â¨‚(ya) ğŸš¹â‘¥â¨€(bhavant) ğŸš¹â‘¥â¨€(rÄja) ğŸš¹â‘¦â¨€(janapada) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨‚(ussahati) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨‚(kasigorakkha) , ğŸš»â‘¥â¨‚(ta) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(bhavanta) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(rÄja) ğŸš»â‘¡â¨€(bÄ«jabhatta) â¹ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(anuppadeti)

        â€œWell then, my master the king, whoever makes an effort in cultivating crops and raising cattle in the country of the king, please give out grain and feed.â€

        Ye bhoto raÃ±Ã±o janapade ussahanti vÄá¹‡ijjÄya tesaá¹ bhavaá¹ rÄjÄ pÄbhataá¹ anuppadetu, ye bhoto raÃ±Ã±o janapade ussahanti rÄjaporise tesaá¹ bhavaá¹ rÄjÄ bhattavetanaá¹ pakappetu, te ca manussÄ sakammapasutÄ raÃ±Ã±o janapadaá¹ na viheá¹­hessanti; mahÄ ca raÃ±Ã±o rÄsiko bhavissati, khemaá¹­á¹­hitÄ janapadÄ akaá¹‡á¹­akÄ anuppÄ«á¸·Ä.
        ğŸš»â‘ â¨‚(ya) ğŸš¹â‘¥â¨€(bhavant) ğŸš¹â‘¥â¨€(rÄja) ğŸš¹â‘¦â¨€(janapada) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨‚(ussahati) ğŸš»â‘£â¨€(vÄá¹‡ijja) ğŸš»â‘¥â¨‚(ta) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(bhavanta) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(rÄja) ğŸš»â‘¡â¨€(pÄbhata) â¹ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(anuppadeti) , ğŸš»â‘ â¨‚(ya) ğŸš¹â‘¥â¨€(bhavant) ğŸš¹â‘¥â¨€(rÄja) ğŸš¹â‘¦â¨€(janapada) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨‚(ussahati) ğŸš»â‘¡â¨‚(rÄjaporisa) ğŸš»â‘¥â¨‚(ta) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(bhavanta) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(rÄja) ğŸš»â‘¡â¨€(bhattavetana) â¹ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(pakappeti) , ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(ta) ğŸ”¼(ca) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(manussa) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(sakammapasuta) ğŸš¹â‘¥â¨€(rÄja) ğŸš¹â‘¦â¨€(janapada) ğŸ”¼(na) â­ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨‚(viheá¹­heti) , ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(maha) ğŸ”¼(ca) ğŸš¹â‘£â¨€(rÄja) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(rÄsika) â­ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(bhavati) , ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(khemaá¹­á¹­hita) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(janapada) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(akaá¹‡á¹­aka) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(anuppÄ«á¸·a)
        whoever | of master | of king | in country | make an effort | for trade and commerce | of they | money and capital | please give out , whoever | of master | of king | in country | make an effort | in royal service or government position | of they | food and wages | please provide , those | and | people | self-employed | of king | of country | disturb | great | and | for king | revenue , safe and secure | country | no disturbance | not oppressed
        â€œWhoever makes an effort for trade and commerce in the country of the king, please give out money and capital. Whoever makes an effort in royal service or government position in the country of the king, please provide food and wages. And please donâ€™t disturb those who are self-employed. And there will be great revenue for king. The country is safe and secure, without disturbance or oppression.â€

        ManussÄ mudÄ modamÄnÄ ure putte naccentÄ apÄrutagharÄ maÃ±Ã±e viharissantÄ« ti.
        ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(manussa) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(mudÄ) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(modamÄna) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨‚(uras) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨‚(putta) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(naccenta) ğŸš»â‘¡â¨‚(apÄrutaghara) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨‚(maÃ±Ã±a) â­ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨‚(viharati) ğŸ”¼(ti)
        people | happy | rejoicing | hearts | children | dancing | living with open doors | thoughts | will live in | quote
        â€œHappy rejoicing dancing people will live with open doors and thoughts of children in their hearts.â€

        Passage 3

        MahÄpadÄnasutta DN 14 PTS 2.1â€“2.54 1.31.1-1.31.6, 1.31.8, 1.33.9, 1.38.1-1.38.2 (D II 16+19+21):

        JÄte kho pana bhikkhave Vipassimhi kumÄre Bandhumato raÃ±Ã±o paá¹­ivedesuá¹: putto te, deva, jÄto, taá¹ devo passatÅ« ti. AddasÄ kho, bhikkhave, BandhumÄ rÄjÄ VipassikumÄraá¹, disvÄ nemitte brÄhmaá¹‡e ÄmantÄpetvÄ etad avoca: passantu bhonto nemittÄ brÄhmaá¹‡Ä kumÄran ti. Addasaá¹su kho bhikkhave nemittÄ brÄhmaá¹‡Ä VipassikumÄraá¹, disvÄ Bandhumantaá¹ rÄjÄnaá¹ etad avocuá¹: attamano deva hohi, mahesakkho te deva putto uppanno. Sace agÄraá¹ ajjhÄvasati, rÄjÄ hoti cakkavattÄ« dhammiko dhammarÄjÄ. Sace kho pana agÄrasmÄ anagÄriyaá¹ pabbajati, arahaá¹ hoti sammÄsambuddho ti. Atha kho bhikkhave BandhumÄ rÄjÄ nemitte brÄhmaá¹‡e ahatehi vatthehi acchÄdÄpetvÄ sabbakÄmehi santappesi. Atha kho bhikkhave BandhumÄ rÄjÄ Vipassissa kumÄrassa tayo pÄsÄde kÄrÄpesi, ekaá¹ vassikaá¹ ekaá¹ hemantikaá¹ ekaá¹ gimhikaá¹; paÃ±ca kÄmaguá¹‡Äni upaá¹­á¹­hÄpesi.

        JÄte kho pana bhikkhave Vipassimhi kumÄre Bandhumato raÃ±Ã±o paá¹­ivedesuá¹: putto te, deva, jÄto, taá¹ devo passatÅ« ti.
        ğŸš¹â‘¦â¨€(jÄta) ğŸ”¼(kho pana) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨‚(bhikkhu) ğŸš¹â‘¦â¨€(vipassÄ«) ğŸš¹â‘¦â¨€(kumÄra) ğŸš¹â‘£â¨€(bandhumant) ğŸš¹â‘£â¨€(rÄja) â®ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨‚(paá¹­ivedesi) : ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(putta) ğŸ¤˜â‘¥â¨€(tvaá¹ƒ) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨€(deva) , ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(jÄta) , ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(ta) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(deva) â¹ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(passati) ğŸ”¼(ti)
        born | and now | monks | in VipassÄ« | in prince | from Bandhuma | of king | announced : son | of you , o Lord , born , him | Lord | must examine | quote
        And now, monks, when Prince VipassÄ« was born, they announced to King Bandhuma: â€œYour son is born, o Lord, may the Lord examine him.â€

        AddasÄ kho, bhikkhave, BandhumÄ rÄjÄ VipassikumÄraá¹, disvÄ nemitte brÄhmaá¹‡e ÄmantÄpetvÄ etad avoca: passantu bhonto nemittÄ brÄhmaá¹‡Ä kumÄran ti.
        â†©ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(addasÄ) ğŸ”¼(kho) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨‚(bhikkhu) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(bandhuma) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(rÄja) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨‚(VipassikumÄra) , ğŸ”¼(disvÄ) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨‚(nemitta) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨‚(brÄhmaá¹‡a) ğŸ”¼(ÄmantÄpetvÄ) ğŸš»â‘¡â¨€(eta) ğŸ”µâ®ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(avoca) : â¹ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨‚(passati) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨‚(bhavant) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨€(nemitta) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨€(brÄhmaá¹‡a) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(kumÄra)ğŸ”¼(ti)
        saw |ğŸ’¡| monks | Bandhuma | king | Prince VipassÄ« , having seen | one who interprets signs or omens | holy men | having summoned | said: he must examine | sir | one who interprets signs or omens | holy men | the young boy | quote
        Monks, King Bandhuma saw Prince VipassÄ«. Having seen, and having summoned holy men who interprets signs and omens, he said: â€œVenerable holy men who interprets signs and omens, please examine the young boy.â€

        Addasaá¹su kho bhikkhave nemittÄ brÄhmaá¹‡Ä VipassikumÄraá¹, disvÄ Bandhumantaá¹ rÄjÄnaá¹ etad avocuá¹: attamano deva hohi, mahesakkho te deva putto uppanno.
        â®ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨‚(addasa) ğŸ”¼(kho) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨‚(bhikkhu) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(nemitta) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(brÄhmaá¹‡a) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(VipassikumÄra) , ğŸ”¼(disvÄ) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(bandhumant) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(rÄja) ğŸš»â‘¡â¨€(eta) ğŸ”µâ®ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(avoca) : ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(attamana) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨€(deva) â¹ğŸ¤˜â¨€(hoti) , ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(mahesakkha) ğŸ¤˜â‘£â¨€(tvaá¹ƒ) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨€(deva) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(putta) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(uppanna)
        saw | ğŸ’¡| monks | one who interprets signs or omens | holy man | Prince VipassikumÄra , having seen | Bandhuma | king | delighted | o Lord | please be , distinguished | for you | son | born
        The holy men who interprets signs or omens saw Prince Vipassi, and having seen they said to king Bandhuma: â€œO Lord, may you be delighted, distinguished for you this son has been born.â€

        Sace agÄraá¹ ajjhÄvasati, rÄjÄ hoti cakkavattÄ« dhammiko dhammarÄjÄ.
        ğŸ”¼(sace) ğŸš»â‘¡â¨€(agÄra) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(ajjhÄvasati) , ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(rÄja) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(hoti) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(cakkavattÄ«) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(dhammika) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(dhammarÄja)
        if | household life | settled in , king | becomes | wheel turning monarch | righteous | just king
        If settled in household life, he becomes a righteous, just wheel turning monarch.

        Sace kho pana agÄrasmÄ anagÄriyaá¹ pabbajati, arahaá¹ hoti sammÄsambuddho ti.
        ğŸ”¼(sace) ğŸ”¼(kho pana) ğŸš»â‘¤â¨€(agÄra) ğŸš»â‘¡â¨€(anagÄriya) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(pabbajati) , ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(araha) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(hoti) â‘ â¨€(sammÄsambuddha) ğŸ”¼(ti)
        if | however | from household life | to homeless state | renounces , entitled to | becomes | perfectly awakened being | quote
        If, however, he renounces from household life to a homeless state, he is entitled to become a perfectly awakened being.

        Atha kho bhikkhave BandhumÄ rÄjÄ nemitte brÄhmaá¹‡e ahatehi vatthehi acchÄdÄpetvÄ sabbakÄmehi santappesi.
        ğŸ”¼(atha kho) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨‚(bhikkhu) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(bandhuma) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(rÄja) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨‚(nemitta) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨‚(brÄhmaá¹‡a) ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨‚(ahata) ğŸš»â‘¢â¨‚(vattha) ğŸ”¼(acchÄdÄpetvÄ) ğŸš¹â‘¤â¨‚(sabbakÄma) â®ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(santappesi)
        after that | monks | Bandhuma | king | one who interprets signs or omens | holy men | with clean | with clothes | having put on | from all desires | fulfilled
        After that, king Bandhuma, having clothed the holy men who interprets signs or omens with new clothes, and fulfilled all their desires.

        Atha kho bhikkhave BandhumÄ rÄjÄ Vipassissa kumÄrassa tayo pÄsÄde kÄrÄpesi, ekaá¹ vassikaá¹ ekaá¹ hemantikaá¹ ekaá¹ gimhikaá¹; paÃ±ca kÄmaguá¹‡Äni upaá¹­á¹­hÄpesi.
        ğŸ”¼(atha kho) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨‚(bhikkhu) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(bandhuma) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(rÄja) ğŸš¹â‘£â¨€(vipassÄ«) ğŸš¹â‘£â¨€(kumÄra) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨‚(ti) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨‚(pÄsÄda)â®ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(kÄrÄpesi) , ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(eka) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(vassika) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(eka) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(hemantika) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(eka) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(gimhika) ; âš§â‘ â¨‚(paÃ±ca) ğŸš»â‘ â¨‚(kÄmaguá¹‡a) â®ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(upaá¹­á¹­hÄpesi)
        after that | monks | Bandhuma | king | for Vipassi | for Prince | three | palaces | caused to be made , one | for the rainy season | one | for cold season | one | for hot season ; five | object of sensual pleasure | furnished with
        After that, monks, King Bandhuma caused three palaces to be built for Prince Vipassi: one for the rainy season, one for the cold season, one for the hot season; furnished with objects that delight the five senses.

        Translate from English

        AlagaddÅ«pamasutta MN 22 PTS 1.130â€“1.142 13.1, 13.6-13.19, 13.26-14.1 (M I 134,30 - 135,26)

        â€œ0 monks, I will teach you the doctrine having-a-raft-as- simile, for-the-purpose-of-crossing-over, not for-the-purpose-of-keeping.
        KullÅ«pamaá¹ vo, bhikkhave, dhammaá¹ desessÄmi nittharaá¹‡atthÄya, no gahaá¹‡atthÄya.
        ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(kullÅ«pama) ğŸ”¼(vo) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨‚(bhikkhu) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(dhamma) â­ğŸ‘†â¨€(deseti) , ğŸš¹â‘£â¨€(nittharaá¹‡attha) ğŸ”¼(no) ğŸš¹â‘£â¨€(gahaá¹‡attha)
        similar to a raft | indeed | monks | doctrine | I will teach , for purpose of crossing | not | for purpose of holding onto

        Just like a man who-had-followed-a-road : he might see a great flood-of-water, the nearer shore with-fear, with-danger, the further shore secure, without- danger (a-), and there might not be a boat or a causeway for going from hither across, â€” he would have (the thought) thus : " Indeed this flood of water (is) great, and the nearer shore (is) with-fear, with-danger, the further shore secure, without-danger, and there isn’t a boat or a causeway for going from hither across.
        So passeyya mahantaá¹ udakaá¹‡á¹‡avaá¹, orimaá¹ tÄ«raá¹ sÄsaá¹…kaá¹ sappaá¹­ibhayaá¹, pÄrimaá¹ tÄ«raá¹ khemaá¹ appaá¹­ibhayaá¹; na cassa nÄvÄ santÄraá¹‡Ä« uttarasetu vÄ apÄrÄ pÄraá¹ gamanÄya. Tassa evamassa: â€˜ayaá¹ kho mahÄudakaá¹‡á¹‡avo, orimaá¹ tÄ«raá¹ sÄsaá¹…kaá¹ sappaá¹­ibhayaá¹, pÄrimaá¹ tÄ«raá¹ khemaá¹ appaá¹­ibhayaá¹; natthi ca nÄvÄ santÄraá¹‡Ä« uttarasetu vÄ apÄrÄ pÄraá¹ gamanÄya.
        ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(ta) â¯ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(passati) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(mahanta) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(udakaá¹‡á¹‡ava) ğŸš»â‘¡â¨€(orima) ğŸš»â‘¡â¨€(tÄ«ra) ğŸš»â‘¡â¨€(sÄsaá¹…ka) , ğŸš»â‘¡â¨€(pÄrima) ğŸš»â‘¡â¨€(khema) ğŸš»â‘¡â¨€(appaá¹­ibhaya) ; ğŸ”¼(na) ğŸ”¼(cassa) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨‚(nÄvÄ) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(santÄraá¹‡a) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(uttarasetu) ğŸ”¼(vÄ) ğŸš»â‘¤â¨€(apÄra) ğŸš»â‘¡â¨€(pÄra) ğŸš»â‘£â¨€(gamana)
        that | will see | great | body of water | nearest | shore | unsafe | dangerous , furthest | shore | safe | not dangerous ; no | and for him | boat | ferry | going across | or | from near shore | to far shore | for travelling
        ğŸš»â‘¥â¨€(ta) ğŸ”¼(evamassa) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(ima) ğŸ”¼(kho) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(mahÄudakaá¹‡á¹‡ava) ğŸš»â‘¡â¨€(orima) ğŸš»â‘¡â¨€(tÄ«ra) ğŸš»â‘¡â¨€(sÄsaá¹…ka) , ğŸš»â‘¡â¨€(pÄrima) ğŸš»â‘¡â¨€(khema) ğŸš»â‘¡â¨€(appaá¹­ibhaya) ; ğŸ”¼(na) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(atthi) ğŸ”¼(ca) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨‚(nÄvÄ) ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(santÄraá¹‡a) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(uttarasetu) ğŸ”¼(vÄ) ğŸš»â‘¤â¨€(apÄra) ğŸš»â‘¡â¨€(pÄra) ğŸš»â‘£â¨€(gamana)
        of that | he would think thus | this | indeed | great body of water | nearest | shore | unsafe | dangerous , furthest | shore | safe | not dangerous ; no | exists | and | boat | ferry | going across | or | from near shore | to far shore | for travelling

        What now if I, having collected grass-firewood-branches- and-foliage, having bound a raft, depending on that raft, should cross thither safely ?â€
        YannÅ«nÄhaá¹ tiá¹‡akaá¹­á¹­hasÄkhÄpalÄsaá¹ saá¹…kaá¸á¸hitvÄ, kullaá¹ bandhitvÄ, taá¹ kullaá¹ nissÄya (hatthehi ca pÄdehi ca vÄyamamÄno) sotthinÄ (pÄraá¹) uttareyyanâ€™ti.
        ğŸ”¼(yannÅ«nÄhaá¹ƒ) ğŸš»â‘¡â¨€(tiá¹‡akaá¹­á¹­hasÄkhÄpalÄsa) ğŸ”¼(saá¹…kaá¸á¸hitvÄ) , ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(kulla) ğŸ”¼(bandhitvÄ) , ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(ta) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(kulla) ğŸ”¼(nissÄya) ğŸ”¼(sotthinÄ) ğŸ”µâ¯ğŸ‘†â¨€(uttarati) ğŸ”¼(ti)
        what if I were to | grass, timber, branches and leaves | having collected , raft | having bound , that | raft | depending on | safely | I should cross | quote

        Then, indeed {kho), that man, having collected grass-firewood-branches-and-foliage, having bound a raft, depending on that raft would cross thither safely.
        Atha kho so, (bhikkhave), puriso tiá¹‡akaá¹­á¹­hasÄkhÄpalÄsaá¹ saá¹…kaá¸á¸hitvÄ, kullaá¹ bandhitvÄ taá¹ kullaá¹ nissÄya (hatthehi ca pÄdehi ca vÄyamamÄno) sotthinÄ (pÄraá¹) uttareyya.
        ğŸ”¼(atha kho) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(ta) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(purisa) ğŸš»â‘¡â¨€(tiá¹‡akaá¹­á¹­hasÄkhÄpalÄsa) ğŸ”¼(saá¹…kaá¸á¸hitvÄ) , ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(kulla) ğŸ”¼(bandhitvÄ) , ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(ta) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(kulla) ğŸ”¼(nissÄya) ğŸ”¼(sotthinÄ) â¯ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(uttarati)
        then | that | man | grass, timber, branches and leaves | having collected , raft | having bound , that | raft | depending on | safely | he should cross

        Crossed, gone thither (past participles), he might have (the thought) thus: â€œIndeed this raft (is) very useful. What now if, having put (â€œ mounted â€) this raft on my head, I should go away?â€
        Tassa purisassa uttiá¹‡á¹‡assa pÄraá¹…gatassa evamassa: â€˜bahukÄro kho me ayaá¹ kullo; (imÄhaá¹ kullaá¹ nissÄya hatthehi ca pÄdehi ca vÄyamamÄno sotthinÄ pÄraá¹ uttiá¹‡á¹‡o). YannÅ«nÄhaá¹ imaá¹ kullaá¹ sÄ«se vÄ ÄropetvÄ (khandhe vÄ uccÄretvÄ) yena kÄmaá¹ pakkameyyanâ€™ti.
        ğŸš»â‘¥â¨€(ta) ğŸš¹â‘¥â¨€(purisa) ğŸš¹â‘¥â¨€(uttiá¹‡á¹‡a) ğŸš¹â‘¥â¨€(pÄraá¹…gata) ğŸ”¼(evamassa) : ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(bahukÄra) ğŸ”¼(kho) ğŸ‘†â‘£â¨€(ahaá¹ƒ) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(ima) â‘ â¨€(kulla) ; ğŸ”¼(imÄhaá¹ƒ) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(kulla) ğŸ”¼(nissÄya) ğŸ”¼(sotthinÄ) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(uttiá¹‡á¹‡a)
        of that | of man | of crossed over | of reached the other shore | this would occur to him : very useful | for me | this | raft ; this I | raft | depending on | safely | crossed over
        ğŸ”¼(yannÅ«nÄhaá¹ƒ) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(ima) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(kulla) ğŸš»â‘¦â¨€(sÄ«sa) ğŸ”¼(vÄ) ğŸ”¼(ÄropetvÄ) ğŸš»â‘¢â¨€(ya) ğŸ”¼(kÄmaá¹ƒ) ğŸ”µâ¯ğŸ‘†â¨€(pakkamati) ğŸ”¼(ti)
        what if I were to | this | raft | on head | or | having put on top of | by where | freely | I will go away | quote
        While the man was crossing over to the other shore, the thought occurs to him: …

        What do you think (of) that, monks ? Perhaps {api) that man thus-doing (-karin, bahubblhi) (with reference) to that raft (loc.) would be doing-what-should-be-done ? (nu) â€.
        Taá¹ kiá¹ maÃ±Ã±atha, bhikkhave, api nu so puriso evaá¹…kÄrÄ« tasmiá¹ kulle kiccakÄrÄ« assÄâ€ti? ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(ta) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(ka) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤˜â¨‚(maÃ±Ã±ati) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨‚(bhikkhu)
        that | what | you think | monks
        ğŸ”¼(api nu) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(ta) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(purisa) ğŸ”¼(evaá¹…kÄrÄ«) ğŸš¹â‘¦â¨€(ta) ğŸš¹â‘¦â¨€(kulla) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(kiccakÄrÄ«) â¯ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(assa) ğŸ”¼(ti)
        is? | that | man | thus doing | in that | raft | doing what should be done (with) | should be | quote

        â€œ Indeed not (no hâ€˜) this, sir bhante â€. . .â€œ
        â€œNo hetaá¹, bhanteâ€.
        ğŸ”¼(no) ğŸ”¼(hetaá¹ƒ) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨€(bhavant)
        Not | indeed | bhante

        In this connection, monks, that man, crossed, gone thither, might have (the thought) thus : â€œ. . . What now (if), having lifted this raft on to (dry) land, I should go away (?) â€œ
        â€œKathaá¹…kÄrÄ« ca so, bhikkhave, puriso tasmiá¹ kulle kiccakÄrÄ« assa? Idha, bhikkhave, tassa purisassa uttiá¹‡á¹‡assa pÄraá¹…gatassa evamassa: â€˜bahukÄro kho me ayaá¹ kullo; imÄhaá¹ kullaá¹ nissÄya hatthehi ca pÄdehi ca vÄyamamÄno sotthinÄ pÄraá¹ uttiá¹‡á¹‡o.
        ğŸ”¼(cathaá¹…kÄrÄ«) ğŸ”¼(ca) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(ta) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨‚(bhikkhu) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(purisa) ğŸš¹â‘¦â¨€(ta) ğŸš¹â‘¦â¨€(kulla) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(kiccakÄrÄ«) â¯ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(assa) ?
        doing what? | and | that | monks | man | in that | raft | doing what should be done (with) | should be ?
        ğŸ”¼(idha) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨‚(bhikkhu) ğŸš»â‘¥â¨€(ta) ğŸš¹â‘¥â¨€(purisa) ğŸš¹â‘¥â¨€(uttiá¹‡á¹‡a) ğŸš¹â‘¥â¨€(pÄraá¹…gata) ğŸ”¼(evamassa) : ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(bahukÄra) ğŸ”¼(kho) ğŸ‘†â‘£â¨€(ahaá¹ƒ) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(ima) â‘ â¨€(kulla) ; ğŸ”¼(imÄhaá¹ƒ) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(kulla) ğŸ”¼(nissÄya) ğŸ”¼(sotthinÄ) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(uttiá¹‡á¹‡a) ğŸ”¼(yannÅ«nÄhaá¹ƒ) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(ima) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(kulla) ğŸš»â‘¦â¨€(sÄ«sa) ğŸ”¼(vÄ) ğŸ”¼(ÄropetvÄ) ğŸš»â‘¢â¨€(ya) ğŸ”¼(kÄmaá¹ƒ) ğŸ”µâ¯ğŸ‘†â¨€(pakkamati) ğŸ”¼(ti)
        in this case | monks | of that | of man | of crossed over | of reached the other shore | this would occur to him : very useful | for me | this | raft ; this I | raft | depending on | safely | crossed over | what if I were to | this | raft | on head | or | having put on top of | by where | freely | I will go away | quote
        YannÅ«nÄhaá¹ imaá¹ kullaá¹ thale vÄ ussÄdetvÄ udake vÄ opilÄpetvÄ yena kÄmaá¹ pakkameyyanâ€™ti.
        ğŸ”¼(yannÅ«nÄhaá¹ƒ) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(ima) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(kulla) ğŸš»â‘¦â¨€(thala) ğŸ”¼(vÄ) ğŸ”¼(ussÄdetvÄ) ğŸš»â‘¡â¨‚(udaka) ğŸ”¼(vÄ) ğŸ”¼(opilÄpetvÄ) ğŸš»â‘¢â¨€(ya) ğŸ”¼(kÄmaá¹ƒ) ğŸ”µâ¯ğŸ‘†â¨€(pakkamati) ğŸ”¼(ti)
        what if I were to | this | raft | dry land | or | having raised up to | water | or | having submerged into | by where | freely | I will go away | quote

        â€ Thus-doing, indeed, that man would be doing-what-should-be-done with (loc.) that raft.
        Evaá¹…kÄrÄ« kho so, bhikkhave, puriso tasmiá¹ kulle kiccakÄrÄ« assa.
        ğŸ”¼(evaá¹…kÄrÄ« kho) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(ta) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨‚(bhikkhu) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(purisa) ğŸš¹â‘¦â¨€(ta) ğŸš¹â‘¦â¨€(kulla) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(kiccakÄrÄ«) â¯ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(assa)
        doing such things | indeed | that | monks | man | in that | raft | doing what should be done (with) | should be

        Likewise, indeed, monks, the doctrine is taught by me having-a-raft-as-simile, for-the-purpose-of-crossing-over, not for-the-purpose-of-keeping.
        Evameva kho, bhikkhave, kullÅ«pamo mayÄ dhammo desito nittharaá¹‡atthÄya, no gahaá¹‡atthÄya.
        ğŸ”¼(evameva) ğŸ”¼(kho) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨‚(bhikkhu) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(kullÅ«pama) ğŸ‘†â‘¢â¨€(ahaá¹ƒ) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(dhamma) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(desita) ğŸš¹â‘£â¨€(nittharaá¹‡attha) ğŸ”¼(no) ğŸš¹â‘£â¨€(gahaá¹‡attha)
        similarly | indeed | monks | similar to a raft | by me | doctrine | taught | for purpose of crossing | not | for purpose of holding onto

        By your (vo) learning (present participle, instrumental plural) the raft-simile, monks, even good mental phenomena (are) to be given up by you (vo), how much more so bad mental phenomena.â€
        KullÅ«pamaá¹ vo, bhikkhave, dhammaá¹ desitaá¹, ÄjÄnantehi dhammÄpi vo pahÄtabbÄ pageva adhammÄ.
        ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(kullÅ«pama) ğŸ¤˜â‘¢â¨‚(tvaá¹ƒ) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨‚(bhikkhu) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(dhamma) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(desita) , ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨‚(ÄjÄnanta) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(dhamma) ğŸ”¼(pi) ğŸ¤˜â‘¢â¨‚(tvaá¹ƒ) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(pahÄtabba) ğŸ”¼(pageva) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(adhamma)
        similar to a raft | by you | monks | doctrine | taught , by knowing | moral behaviour | too | by you | should be given up | all the more | misbehaviour

        6.17 - Answers to Warder Lesson 20

        Answers to A.K. Warder “Introduction to Pali” Lesson 20

        Passage 1

        MahÄpadÄnasutta DN 14 PTS 2.1â€“2.54 2.1.1-2.2.13 (D II 21,13 - 22,21):

        Atha kho, bhikkhave, VipassÄ« kumÄro bahÅ«naá¹ vassÄnaá¹ bahÅ«naá¹ vassasatÄnaá¹ bahÅ«naá¹ vassasahassÄnaá¹ accayena sÄrathiá¹ Ämantesi: â€˜yojehi, samma sÄrathi, bhaddÄni bhaddÄni yÄnÄni uyyÄnabhÅ«miá¹ gacchÄma subhÅ«midassanÄyÄâ€™ti. â€˜Evaá¹, devÄâ€™ti kho, bhikkhave, sÄrathi vipassissa kumÄrassa paá¹­issutvÄ bhaddÄni bhaddÄni yÄnÄni yojetvÄ Vipassissa kumÄrassa paá¹­ivedesi: â€˜yuttÄni kho te, deva, bhaddÄni bhaddÄni yÄnÄni, yassadÄni kÄlaá¹ maÃ±Ã±asÄ«â€™ti. Atha kho, bhikkhave, VipassÄ« kumÄro bhaddaá¹ bhaddaá¹ yÄnaá¹ abhiruhitvÄ bhaddehi bhaddehi yÄnehi uyyÄnabhÅ«miá¹ niyyÄsi. AddasÄ kho, bhikkhave, VipassÄ« kumÄro uyyÄnabhÅ«miá¹ niyyanto purisaá¹ jiá¹‡á¹‡aá¹ gopÄnasivaá¹…kaá¹ bhoggaá¹ daá¹‡á¸aparÄyanaá¹ pavedhamÄnaá¹ gacchantaá¹ Äturaá¹ gatayobbanaá¹. DisvÄ sÄrathiá¹ Ämantesi: â€˜ayaá¹ pana, samma sÄrathi, puriso kiá¹…kato? Na dÄni tena ciraá¹ jÄ«vitabbaá¹ bhavissatÄ«â€™ti. â€˜Kiá¹ pana, samma sÄrathi, ahampi jarÄdhammo, jaraá¹ anatÄ«toâ€™ti? â€˜TvaÃ±ca, deva, mayaÃ±camha sabbe jarÄdhammÄ, jaraá¹ anatÄ«tÄâ€™ti. â€˜Tena hi, samma sÄrathi, alaá¹ dÄnajja uyyÄnabhÅ«miyÄ.         Atha kho, bhikkhave, VipassÄ« kumÄro bahÅ«naá¹ vassÄnaá¹ bahÅ«naá¹ vassasatÄnaá¹ bahÅ«naá¹ vassasahassÄnaá¹ accayena sÄrathiá¹ Ämantesi: â€˜yojehi, samma sÄrathi, bhaddÄni bhaddÄni yÄnÄni uyyÄnabhÅ«miá¹ gacchÄma subhÅ«midassanÄyÄâ€™ti.
        ğŸ”¼(atha kho) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨‚(bhikkhu) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(vipassÄ«) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(kumÄra) ğŸš¹â‘¥â¨‚(bahu) ğŸš¹â‘¥â¨‚(vassa) ğŸš¹â‘¥â¨‚(bahu) ğŸš»â‘¥â¨‚(vassasata) ğŸš¹â‘¥â¨‚(bahu) ğŸš»â‘¥â¨‚(vassasahassa) ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨€(accaya) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(sÄrathi) â®ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(Ämantesi) : â¹ğŸ¤˜â¨€(yojeti) ğŸ”¼(samma) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨€(sÄrathi) ğŸš»â‘¡â¨‚(bhadda) ğŸš»â‘¡â¨‚(bhadda) ğŸš»â‘¡â¨‚(yÄna) ğŸšºâ‘¡â¨€(uyyÄnabhÅ«mi) â–¶ï¸ğŸ‘†â¨‚(gacchati) ğŸš»â‘£â¨€(subhÅ«midassana) ğŸ”¼(ti)
        after that | monks | VipassÄ« | Prince | of many | of rain | of many | of centuries | of many | of millenniums | of time | driver/leader | addressed : please attach/yoke | brother | charioteer | luxurious | carriage | pleasure grounds | we wander | for sightseeing | quote

        â€˜Evaá¹, devÄâ€™ti kho, bhikkhave, sÄrathi Vipassissa kumÄrassa paá¹­issutvÄ bhaddÄni bhaddÄni yÄnÄni yojetvÄ vipassissa kumÄrassa paá¹­ivedesi: â€˜yuttÄni kho te, deva, bhaddÄni bhaddÄni yÄnÄni, yassadÄni kÄlaá¹ maÃ±Ã±asÄ«â€™ti.

        Monks, â€œYes, Lordâ€ the charioteer of Prince VipassÄ« responded in agreement. Having yoked the luxurious carriage, he announced â€œThe luxurious carriage is yoked for you, my Lord, consider it ready now.â€

        Atha kho, bhikkhave, vipassÄ« kumÄro bhaddaá¹ bhaddaá¹ yÄnaá¹ abhiruhitvÄ bhaddehi bhaddehi yÄnehi uyyÄnabhÅ«miá¹ niyyÄsi.

        After that, monks, Prince VipassÄ«, having boarded the luxurious carriage, departed with the luxurious carriage to the pleasure grounds.

        AddasÄ kho, bhikkhave, VipassÄ« kumÄro uyyÄnabhÅ«miá¹ niyyanto purisaá¹ jiá¹‡á¹‡aá¹ gopÄnasivaá¹…kaá¹ bhoggaá¹ daá¹‡á¸aparÄyanaá¹ pavedhamÄnaá¹ gacchantaá¹ Äturaá¹ gatayobbanaá¹.
        â†©ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(addasÄ) ğŸ”¼(kho) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨‚(bhikkhu) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(vipassÄ«) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(kumÄra) ğŸšºâ‘¡â¨€(uyyÄnabhÅ«mi) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(niyyanta) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(purisa) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(jiá¹‡á¹‡a) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(gopÄnasivaá¹…ka) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(bhogga) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(daá¹‡á¸aparÄyana) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(pavedhamÄna) ğŸš»â‘¡â¨€(gacchanta) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(Ätura) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(gatayobbana)
        saw | ğŸ’¡| monks | VipassÄ« | Prince | pleasure grounds | departing | person | old | as crooked as a rafter | bent | leaning on a staff | trembling | walking | sick | passed prime
        Monks, as Prince VipassÄ« was departing to the pleasure grounds, he saw an person who was old, crooked as a rafter, bent, leaning on a staff, trembling, walking, sick and well passed his prime.

        DisvÄ sÄrathiá¹ Ämantesi: â€˜ayaá¹ pana, samma sÄrathi, puriso kiá¹…kato? KesÄpissa na yathÄ aÃ±Ã±esaá¹, kÄyopissa na yathÄ aÃ±Ã±esanâ€™ti.
        ğŸ”¼(disvÄ) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(sÄrathi) â®ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(Ämantesi) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(ima) ğŸ”¼(pana) ğŸ”¼(samma) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨€(sÄrathi) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(purisa) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(kiá¹…kata) ? ğŸ”¼(kesÄpissa) ğŸ”¼(na) ğŸ”¼(yathÄ) ğŸš¹â‘¥â¨‚(aÃ±Ã±a) ğŸ”¼(kÄyopissa) ğŸ”¼(na) ğŸ”¼(yathÄ) ğŸš¹â‘¥â¨‚(aÃ±Ã±a) ğŸ”¼(ti)

        Having seen, he addressed his charioteer: â€œBrother charioteer, what has this person done? The hair and the body is unlike anyone I have ever seen.â€

        â€˜Eso kho, deva, jiá¹‡á¹‡o nÄmÄâ€™ti.

        this | ğŸ’¡| Lord | old man | called | quote
        â€œThis, Lord, is called an old man.â€

        â€˜Kiá¹ paneso, samma sÄrathi, jiá¹‡á¹‡o nÄmÄâ€™ti?
        ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(ka) ğŸ”¼(paneso) ğŸ”¼(samma) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨€(sÄrathi) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(jiá¹‡á¹‡a) ğŸ”¼(nÄma) ğŸ”¼(ti)

        â€œAnd, brother charioteer, what is an â€˜old manâ€™?â€

        â€˜Eso kho, deva, jiá¹‡á¹‡o nÄma.
        ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(eta) ğŸ”¼(kho) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨€(deva) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(jiá¹‡á¹‡a) ğŸ”¼(nÄma)
        this | ğŸ’¡| Lord | old man | called
        â€œThis, Lord, is called an old man.â€

        Na dÄni tena ciraá¹ jÄ«vitabbaá¹ bhavissatÄ«â€™ti.
        ğŸ”¼(na) ğŸ”¼(dÄni) ğŸ”¼(tena) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(cira) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(jÄ«vitabba) â­ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(bhavati) ğŸ”¼(ti)
        not | now | because of that | long | should be lived | will become | quote
        â€œBecause of that, he will not have long to live.â€

        â€˜Kiá¹ pana, samma sÄrathi, ahampi jarÄdhammo, jaraá¹ anatÄ«toâ€™ti?
        ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(ka) ğŸ”¼(pana) ğŸ”¼(samma) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨€(sÄrathi) ğŸ‘†â‘ â¨€(ahaá¹ƒ) ğŸ”¼(pi) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(jarÄdhamma) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(jara) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(anatÄ«ta) ğŸ”¼(ti)
        what | however | brother | charioteer | I | too | liable to grow old | old | not exempt from | quote
        â€œBrother charioteer, am I too liable to grow old, not exempt from old age?â€

        â€˜TvaÃ±ca, deva, mayaÃ±camha sabbe jarÄdhammÄ, jaraá¹ anatÄ«tÄâ€™ti.
        ğŸ”¼(tvaÃ±ca) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨€(deva) ğŸ‘†â‘ â¨‚(ahaá¹ƒ) ğŸ”¼(ca) â¹ğŸ‘†â¨‚(atthi) ğŸš»â‘ â¨‚(sabba) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(jarÄdhamma) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(jara) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(anatÄ«ta) ğŸ”¼(ti)
        and you | Lord | I | and | we will | all | liable to grow old | old | not exempt from | quote
        â€œAnd you, my Lord, and I and everyone will be liable to grow old, not exempt from old age.â€

        â€˜Tena hi, samma sÄrathi, alaá¹ dÄnajja uyyÄnabhÅ«miyÄ.
        ğŸ”¼(tena hi) ğŸ”¼(samma) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨€(sÄrathi) ğŸ”¼(alaá¹ƒ) ğŸ”¼(dÄnajja) ğŸšºâ‘¥â¨€(uyyÄnabhÅ«mi)
        in that case | brother | charioteer | it is enough | for now | of pleasure grounds
        â€œin that case, brother charioteer, Iâ€™ve had enough of the pleasure grounds for now.â€

        Itova antepuraá¹ paccaniyyÄhÄ«â€™ti.
        ğŸ”¼(itova) ğŸš»â‘¡â¨€(antepura) â¹ğŸ¤˜â¨€(paccaniyyÄti) ğŸ”¼(ti)
        as soon as possible from here | kingâ€™s palace | please return | quote
        â€œPlease return to the Kingâ€™s palace as soon as possible from here.â€

        â€˜Evaá¹, devÄâ€™ti kho, bhikkhave, sÄrathi vipassissa kumÄrassa paá¹­issutvÄ tatova antepuraá¹ paccaniyyÄsi.
        ğŸ”¼(evaá¹ƒ) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨€(deva) ğŸ”¼(ti kho) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨‚(bhikkhu) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(sÄrathi) ğŸš¹â‘¥â¨€(vipassÄ«) ğŸš¹â‘¥â¨€(kumÄra) ğŸ”¼(paá¹­issutvÄ) ğŸ”¼(tatova) ğŸš»â‘¡â¨€(antepura) â®ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(paccaniyyÄsi)
        yes | Lord | quote | ğŸ’¡| monks | charioteer | of VipassÄ« | of Prince | responded in agreement | from that | kingâ€™s palace | returned
        Monks, â€œYes, Lordâ€, the charioteer of Prince VipassÄ« responded in agreement, after that he returned to the Kingâ€™s palace.

        Tatra sudaá¹, bhikkhave, VipassÄ« kumÄro antepuraá¹ gato dukkhÄ« dummano pajjhÄyati: â€˜dhiratthu kira, bho, jÄti nÄma, yatra hi nÄma jÄtassa jarÄ paÃ±Ã±ÄyissatÄ«â€™ti.
        ğŸ”¼(tatra) ğŸ”¼(sudaá¹ƒ) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨‚(bhikkhu) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(vipassÄ«) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(kumÄra) ğŸš»â‘¡â¨€(antepura) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(gata) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(dukkhÄ«) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(dummana) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(pajjhÄyati) ğŸ”¼(dhiratthu) ğŸ”¼(kira) , ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨€(bhavant) , ğŸšºâ‘ â¨€(jÄti) ğŸ”¼(nÄma) , ğŸ”¼(yatra) ğŸ”¼(hi) ğŸ”¼(nÄma) ğŸš¹â‘¥â¨€(jÄta) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(jara) â­ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(paÃ±Ã±Äyati) ğŸ”¼(ti)
        in that case | surely indeed | monks | VipassÄ« | Prince | Kingâ€™s palace | went | dejected | sad | is overcome : curse you | truly | sir | birth | named | n which case | indeed | name | of being born | odl age | is evident | quote
        In that case, monks, Prince VipassÄ« surely went to the kingâ€™s palace overcome with dejection and sadness: â€œCurse you truly, sir, that which is named â€œbirthâ€, when born, old age is inevitable.â€

        Passage 2

        AggaÃ±Ã±asutta DN 27 PTS 3.80â€“3.98 1.1-7.10, 10.1-12.9 (D III 80,1 - 86,10):

        Evaá¹ me sutaá¹â€” ekaá¹ samayaá¹ bhagavÄ sÄvatthiyaá¹ viharati pubbÄrÄme migÄramÄtupÄsÄde. Tena kho pana samayena vÄseá¹­á¹­habhÄradvÄjÄ bhikkhÅ«su parivasanti bhikkhubhÄvaá¹ Äkaá¹…khamÄnÄ. Atha kho bhagavÄ sÄyanhasamayaá¹ paá¹­isallÄnÄ vuá¹­á¹­hito pÄsÄdÄ orohitvÄ pÄsÄdapacchÄyÄyaá¹ abbhokÄse caá¹…kamati. AddasÄ kho vÄseá¹­á¹­ho bhagavantaá¹ sÄyanhasamayaá¹ paá¹­isallÄnÄ vuá¹­á¹­hitaá¹ pÄsÄdÄ orohitvÄ pÄsÄdapacchÄyÄyaá¹ abbhokÄse caá¹…kamantaá¹. DisvÄna bhÄradvÄjaá¹ Ämantesi: â€œayaá¹, Ävuso bhÄradvÄja, bhagavÄ sÄyanhasamayaá¹ paá¹­isallÄnÄ vuá¹­á¹­hito pÄsÄdÄ orohitvÄ pÄsÄdapacchÄyÄyaá¹ abbhokÄse caá¹…kamati. Ä€yÄmÄvuso bhÄradvÄja, yena bhagavÄ tenupasaá¹…kamissÄma; appeva nÄma labheyyÄma bhagavato santikÄ dhammiá¹ kathaá¹ savanÄyÄâ€ti. â€œEvamÄvusoâ€ti kho bhÄradvÄjo vÄseá¹­á¹­hassa paccassosi. Atha kho vÄseá¹­á¹­habhÄradvÄjÄ yena bhagavÄ tenupasaá¹…kamiá¹su; upasaá¹…kamitvÄ bhagavantaá¹ abhivÄdetvÄ bhagavantaá¹ caá¹…kamantaá¹ anucaá¹…kamiá¹su.

        Atha kho bhagavÄ vÄseá¹­á¹­haá¹ Ämantesi: â€œtumhe khvattha, vÄseá¹­á¹­ha, brÄhmaá¹‡ajaccÄ brÄhmaá¹‡akulÄ«nÄ brÄhmaá¹‡akulÄ agÄrasmÄ anagÄriyaá¹ pabbajitÄ, kacci vo, vÄseá¹­á¹­ha, brÄhmaá¹‡Ä na akkosanti na paribhÄsantÄ«â€ti? â€œTaggha no, bhante, brÄhmaá¹‡Ä akkosanti paribhÄsanti attarÅ«pÄya paribhÄsÄya paripuá¹‡á¹‡Äya, no aparipuá¹‡á¹‡ÄyÄâ€ti. â€œYathÄ kathaá¹ pana vo, vÄseá¹­á¹­ha, brÄhmaá¹‡Ä akkosanti paribhÄsanti attarÅ«pÄya paribhÄsÄya paripuá¹‡á¹‡Äya, no aparipuá¹‡á¹‡ÄyÄâ€ti? â€œBrÄhmaá¹‡Ä, bhante, evamÄhaá¹su: â€˜brÄhmaá¹‡ova seá¹­á¹­ho vaá¹‡á¹‡o, hÄ«nÄ aÃ±Ã±e vaá¹‡á¹‡Ä. BrÄhmaá¹‡ova sukko vaá¹‡á¹‡o, kaá¹‡hÄ aÃ±Ã±e vaá¹‡á¹‡Ä. BrÄhmaá¹‡Äva sujjhanti, no abrÄhmaá¹‡Ä. BrÄhmaá¹‡Äva brahmuno puttÄ orasÄ mukhato jÄtÄ brahmajÄ brahmanimmitÄ brahmadÄyÄdÄ. Te tumhe seá¹­á¹­haá¹ vaá¹‡á¹‡aá¹ hitvÄ hÄ«namattha vaá¹‡á¹‡aá¹ ajjhupagatÄ, yadidaá¹ muá¹‡á¸ake samaá¹‡ake ibbhe kaá¹‡he bandhupÄdÄpacce. Tayidaá¹ na sÄdhu, tayidaá¹ nappatirÅ«paá¹, yaá¹ tumhe seá¹­á¹­haá¹ vaá¹‡á¹‡aá¹ hitvÄ hÄ«namattha vaá¹‡á¹‡aá¹ ajjhupagatÄ yadidaá¹ muá¹‡á¸ake samaá¹‡ake ibbhe kaá¹‡he bandhupÄdÄpacceâ€™ti. Evaá¹ kho no, bhante, brÄhmaá¹‡Ä akkosanti paribhÄsanti attarÅ«pÄya paribhÄsÄya paripuá¹‡á¹‡Äya, no aparipuá¹‡á¹‡ÄyÄâ€ti. â€œTaggha vo, vÄseá¹­á¹­ha, brÄhmaá¹‡Ä porÄá¹‡aá¹ assarantÄ evamÄhaá¹su: â€˜brÄhmaá¹‡ova seá¹­á¹­ho vaá¹‡á¹‡o, hÄ«nÄ aÃ±Ã±e vaá¹‡á¹‡Ä; brÄhmaá¹‡ova sukko vaá¹‡á¹‡o, kaá¹‡hÄ aÃ±Ã±e vaá¹‡á¹‡Ä; brÄhmaá¹‡Äva sujjhanti, no abrÄhmaá¹‡Ä; brÄhmaá¹‡Äva brahmuno puttÄ orasÄ mukhato jÄtÄ brahmajÄ brahmanimmitÄ brahmadÄyÄdÄâ€™ti. Dissanti kho pana, vÄseá¹­á¹­ha, brÄhmaá¹‡Änaá¹ brÄhmaá¹‡iyo utuniyopi gabbhiniyopi vijÄyamÄnÄpi pÄyamÄnÄpi. Te ca brÄhmaá¹‡Ä yonijÄva samÄnÄ evamÄhaá¹su: â€˜brÄhmaá¹‡ova seá¹­á¹­ho vaá¹‡á¹‡o, hÄ«nÄ aÃ±Ã±e vaá¹‡á¹‡Ä; brÄhmaá¹‡ova sukko vaá¹‡á¹‡o, kaá¹‡hÄ aÃ±Ã±e vaá¹‡á¹‡Ä; brÄhmaá¹‡Äva sujjhanti, no abrÄhmaá¹‡Ä; brÄhmaá¹‡Äva brahmuno puttÄ orasÄ mukhato jÄtÄ brahmajÄ brahmanimmitÄ brahmadÄyÄdÄâ€™ti. Te brahmÄnaÃ±ceva abbhÄcikkhanti, musÄ ca bhÄsanti, bahuÃ±ca apuÃ±Ã±aá¹ pasavanti. CattÄrome, vÄseá¹­á¹­ha, vaá¹‡á¹‡Äâ€” khattiyÄ, brÄhmaá¹‡Ä, vessÄ, suddÄ. Khattiyopi kho, vÄseá¹­á¹­ha, idhekacco pÄá¹‡ÄtipÄtÄ« hoti adinnÄdÄyÄ« kÄmesumicchÄcÄrÄ« musÄvÄdÄ« pisuá¹‡avÄco pharusavÄco samphappalÄpÄ« abhijjhÄlu byÄpannacitto micchÄdiá¹­á¹­hÄ«. Iti kho, vÄseá¹­á¹­ha, yeme dhammÄ akusalÄ akusalasaá¹…khÄtÄ sÄvajjÄ sÄvajjasaá¹…khÄtÄ asevitabbÄ asevitabbasaá¹…khÄtÄ naalamariyÄ naalamariyasaá¹…khÄtÄ kaá¹‡hÄ kaá¹‡havipÄkÄ viÃ±Ã±ugarahitÄ, khattiyepi te idhekacce sandissanti. BrÄhmaá¹‡opi kho, vÄseá¹­á¹­ha â€¦peâ€¦ vessopi kho, vÄseá¹­á¹­ha â€¦peâ€¦ suddopi kho, vÄseá¹­á¹­ha, idhekacco pÄá¹‡ÄtipÄtÄ paá¹­ivirato hoti â€¦peâ€¦ anabhijjhÄlu, abyÄpannacitto, sammÄdiá¹­á¹­hÄ«. Iti kho, vÄseá¹­á¹­ha, yeme dhammÄ kusalÄ kusalasaá¹…khÄtÄ anavajjÄ anavajjasaá¹…khÄtÄ sevitabbÄ sevitabbasaá¹…khÄtÄ alamariyÄ alamariyasaá¹…khÄtÄ sukkÄ sukkavipÄkÄ viÃ±Ã±uppasatthÄ; suddepi te idhekacce sandissanti. Imesu kho, vÄseá¹­á¹­ha, catÅ«su vaá¹‡á¹‡esu evaá¹ ubhayavokiá¹‡á¹‡esu vattamÄnesu kaá¹‡hasukkesu dhammesu viÃ±Ã±ugarahitesu ceva viÃ±Ã±uppasatthesu ca yadettha brÄhmaá¹‡Ä evamÄhaá¹su: â€˜brÄhmaá¹‡ova seá¹­á¹­ho vaá¹‡á¹‡o, hÄ«nÄ aÃ±Ã±e vaá¹‡á¹‡Ä; brÄhmaá¹‡ova sukko vaá¹‡á¹‡o, kaá¹‡hÄ aÃ±Ã±e vaá¹‡á¹‡Ä; brÄhmaá¹‡Äva sujjhanti, no abrÄhmaá¹‡Ä; brÄhmaá¹‡Äva brahmuno puttÄ orasÄ mukhato jÄtÄ brahmajÄ brahmanimmitÄ brahmadÄyÄdÄâ€™ti. Taá¹ tesaá¹ viÃ±Ã±Å« nÄnujÄnanti. Taá¹ kissa hetu? ImesaÃ±hi, vÄseá¹­á¹­ha, catunnaá¹ vaá¹‡á¹‡Änaá¹ yo hoti bhikkhu arahaá¹ khÄ«á¹‡Äsavo vusitavÄ katakaraá¹‡Ä«yo ohitabhÄro anuppattasadattho parikkhÄ«á¹‡abhavasaá¹yojano sammadaÃ±Ã±Ävimutto, so nesaá¹ aggamakkhÄyati dhammeneva, no adhammena. Dhammo hi, vÄseá¹­á¹­ha, seá¹­á¹­ho janetasmiá¹, diá¹­á¹­he ceva dhamme abhisamparÄyaÃ±ca.

        Hoti kho so, vÄseá¹­á¹­ha, samayo yaá¹ kadÄci karahaci dÄ«ghassa addhuno accayena ayaá¹ loko saá¹vaá¹­á¹­ati. Saá¹vaá¹­á¹­amÄne loke yebhuyyena sattÄ Äbhassarasaá¹vattanikÄ honti. Te tattha honti manomayÄ pÄ«tibhakkhÄ sayaá¹pabhÄ antalikkhacarÄ subhaá¹­á¹­hÄyino ciraá¹ dÄ«ghamaddhÄnaá¹ tiá¹­á¹­hanti. Hoti kho so, vÄseá¹­á¹­ha, samayo yaá¹ kadÄci karahaci dÄ«ghassa addhuno accayena ayaá¹ loko vivaá¹­á¹­ati. Vivaá¹­á¹­amÄne loke yebhuyyena sattÄ ÄbhassarakÄyÄ cavitvÄ itthattaá¹ Ägacchanti. Tedha honti manomayÄ pÄ«tibhakkhÄ sayaá¹pabhÄ antalikkhacarÄ subhaá¹­á¹­hÄyino ciraá¹ dÄ«ghamaddhÄnaá¹ tiá¹­á¹­hanti. EkodakÄ«bhÅ«taá¹ kho pana, vÄseá¹­á¹­ha, tena samayena hoti andhakÄro andhakÄratimisÄ. Na candimasÅ«riyÄ paÃ±Ã±Äyanti, na nakkhattÄni tÄrakarÅ«pÄni paÃ±Ã±Äyanti, na rattindivÄ paÃ±Ã±Äyanti, na mÄsaá¸á¸hamÄsÄ paÃ±Ã±Äyanti, na utusaá¹vaccharÄ paÃ±Ã±Äyanti, na itthipumÄ paÃ±Ã±Äyanti, sattÄ sattÄtveva saá¹…khyaá¹ gacchanti. Atha kho tesaá¹, vÄseá¹­á¹­ha, sattÄnaá¹ kadÄci karahaci dÄ«ghassa addhuno accayena rasapathavÄ« udakasmiá¹ samatani; seyyathÄpi nÄma payaso tattassa nibbÄyamÄnassa upari santÄnakaá¹ hoti; evameva pÄturahosi. SÄ ahosi vaá¹‡á¹‡asampannÄ gandhasampannÄ rasasampannÄ, seyyathÄpi nÄma sampannaá¹ vÄ sappi sampannaá¹ vÄ navanÄ«taá¹ evaá¹vaá¹‡á¹‡Ä ahosi. SeyyathÄpi nÄma khuddamadhuá¹ aneá¸·akaá¹; evamassÄdÄ ahosi.

        Atha kho, vÄseá¹­á¹­ha, aÃ±Ã±ataro satto lolajÄtiko: â€˜ambho, kimevidaá¹ bhavissatÄ«â€™ti rasapathaviá¹ aá¹…guliyÄ sÄyi. Tesaá¹ rasapathaviá¹ aá¹…guliyÄ sÄyataá¹ acchÄdesi, taá¹‡hÄ ca tesaá¹ okkami. Atha kho te, vÄseá¹­á¹­ha, sattÄ rasapathaviá¹ hatthehi ÄluppakÄrakaá¹ upakkamiá¹su paribhuÃ±jituá¹. Yato kho te, vÄseá¹­á¹­ha, sattÄ rasapathaviá¹ hatthehi ÄluppakÄrakaá¹ upakkamiá¹su paribhuÃ±jituá¹. Atha tesaá¹ sattÄnaá¹ sayaá¹pabhÄ antaradhÄyi. Sayaá¹pabhÄya antarahitÄya candimasÅ«riyÄ pÄturahesuá¹. CandimasÅ«riyesu pÄtubhÅ«tesu nakkhattÄni tÄrakarÅ«pÄni pÄturahesuá¹. Nakkhattesu tÄrakarÅ«pesu pÄtubhÅ«tesu rattindivÄ paÃ±Ã±Äyiá¹su. Rattindivesu paÃ±Ã±ÄyamÄnesu mÄsaá¸á¸hamÄsÄ paÃ±Ã±Äyiá¹su. MÄsaá¸á¸hamÄsesu paÃ±Ã±ÄyamÄnesu utusaá¹vaccharÄ paÃ±Ã±Äyiá¹su. EttÄvatÄ kho, vÄseá¹­á¹­ha, ayaá¹ loko puna vivaá¹­á¹­o hoti.

        Evaá¹ me sutaá¹â€” ekaá¹ samayaá¹ bhagavÄ sÄvatthiyaá¹ viharati pubbÄrÄme migÄramÄtupÄsÄde.
        ğŸ”¼(evaá¹ƒ) ğŸ‘†â‘¢â¨€(ahaá¹ƒ) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(suta) - ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(eka) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(samaya) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(bhagavant) ğŸšºâ‘¦â¨€(sÄvatthÄ«) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(viharati) ğŸš¹â‘¦â¨€(pubbÄrÄma) ğŸš¹â‘¦â¨€(migÄramÄtupÄsÄda)

        Thus heard by me - at one time the Blessed One stays at SÄvatthÄ«, at PubbÄrÄma MigÄramÄtupÄsÄda (a monastery).

        And in that occasion, VÄseá¹­á¹­ha and BhÄradvÄja are staying for a trial period with monks, seeking monkhood.

        Atha kho bhagavÄ sÄyanhasamayaá¹ paá¹­isallÄnÄ vuá¹­á¹­hito pÄsÄdÄ orohitvÄ pÄsÄdapacchÄyÄyaá¹ abbhokÄse caá¹…kamati.
        ğŸ”¼(atha kho) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(bhagavant) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(sÄyanhasamaya) ğŸš»â‘ â¨‚(paá¹­isallÄna) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(vuá¹­á¹­hita) ğŸš¹â‘¤â¨€(pÄsÄda) ğŸ”¼(orohitvÄ) ğŸšºâ‘¦â¨€(pÄsÄdapacchÄyÄ) ğŸš¹â‘¦â¨€(abbhokÄsa) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(caá¹…kamati)
        after that | the Blessed One | late afternoon | seclusion | emerged from | from mansion | having descended from | at shaded part of the mansion | open space | walks up and down
        After that, the Blessed One emerged from seclusion in the late afternoon, having descended from the mansion, and walking up and down in the shade of the mansion.

        AddasÄ kho vÄseá¹­á¹­ho bhagavantaá¹ sÄyanhasamayaá¹ paá¹­isallÄnÄ vuá¹­á¹­hitaá¹ pÄsÄdÄ orohitvÄ pÄsÄdapacchÄyÄyaá¹ abbhokÄse caá¹…kamantaá¹.
        â†©ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(addasÄ) ğŸ”¼(kho) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(vÄseá¹­á¹­ha) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(bhagavant) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(sÄyanhasamaya) ğŸš»â‘ â¨‚(paá¹­isallÄna) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(vuá¹­á¹­hita) ğŸš¹â‘¤â¨€(pÄsÄda) ğŸ”¼(orohitvÄ) ğŸšºâ‘¦â¨€(pÄsÄdapacchÄyÄ) ğŸš¹â‘¦â¨€(abbhokÄsa) ğŸš»â‘¡â¨€(caá¹…kamanta)
        saw | ğŸ’¡| VÄseá¹­á¹­ha | the Blessed One | late afternoon | seclusion | emerged from | from mansion | having descended from | at shaded part of the mansion | open space | walks up and down
        VÄseá¹­á¹­ha saw the Blessed One emerged from seclusion in the late afternoon, having descended from the mansion, and walking up and down in the shade of the mansion.

        DisvÄna bhÄradvÄjaá¹ Ämantesi: â€œayaá¹, Ävuso bhÄradvÄja, bhagavÄ sÄyanhasamayaá¹ paá¹­isallÄnÄ vuá¹­á¹­hito pÄsÄdÄ orohitvÄ pÄsÄdapacchÄyÄyaá¹ abbhokÄse caá¹…kamati.
        ğŸ”¼(disvÄna) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(bhÄradvÄja) â®ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(Ämantesi) : ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(ima) ğŸ”¼(Ävuso) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨€(bhÄradvÄja) , ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(bhagavant) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(sÄyanhasamaya) ğŸš»â‘ â¨‚(paá¹­isallÄna) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(vuá¹­á¹­hita) ğŸš¹â‘¤â¨€(pÄsÄda) ğŸ”¼(orohitvÄ) ğŸšºâ‘¦â¨€(pÄsÄdapacchÄyÄ) ğŸš¹â‘¦â¨€(abbhokÄsa) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨€(caá¹…kamati)
        having seen | BhÄradvÄja | addressed : friend | BhÄradvÄja , the Blessed One | late afternoon | seclusion | emerged from | from mansion | having descended from | at shaded part of the mansion | open space | walks up and down having seen, he addressed BhÄradvÄja: â€œThis, friend BhÄradvÄja, Blessed One emerged from seclusion in the late afternoon, having descended from the mansion, and walking up and down in the shade of the mansion.â€

        Ä€yÄmÄvuso bhÄradvÄja, yena bhagavÄ tenupasaá¹…kamissÄma; appeva nÄma labheyyÄma bhagavato santikÄ dhammiá¹ kathaá¹ savanÄyÄâ€ti. ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(ÄyÄma) ğŸ”¼(Ävuso) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨€(bhÄradvÄja) , ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨€(ya) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(bhagavant) ğŸš¹â‘¢â¨€(ta) â­ğŸ‘†â¨‚(upasaá¹…kamati) ; ğŸ”¼(appeva) ğŸ”¼(nÄma) â¯ğŸ‘†â¨‚(labhati) ğŸš¹â‘¤â¨€(bhagavant) ğŸš»â‘ â¨‚(santika) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(dhammÄ«) ğŸš»â‘ â¨€(katha) ğŸš»â‘£â¨€(savana) ğŸ”¼(ti) endeavour | friend | BhÄradvÄja , by where | the Blessed One | by there | we will approach ; hopefully | for sure | we will receive | from Blessed One | in presence of | teaching | talk | for hearing
        â€œWe endeavour, friend BhÄradvÄja, and will approach the Blessed One; hopefully we will surely receive from the Blessed One a teaching in his presence from hearing his words.â€

        â€œEvamÄvusoâ€ti kho bhÄradvÄjo vÄseá¹­á¹­hassa paccassosi.

        after that | the Blessed One | VÄseá¹­á¹­ha | addressed : Youse | you are , VÄseá¹­á¹­ha , brahmans by birth | brahmans by family | belonging to the brahman family | from household life | to homeless state | renounced , I suspect | surely , brahman | no | insult | not | abuse | quote

        surely | indeed , VÄseá¹­á¹­ha , brahmans | ancient | not recollecting | thus | said : brahmans | Bhante | spoke thus : brahman | only | best of | caste , inferior | other | castes , brahman | only | good | caste , bad | other | castes , brahman | only | is purified , not | non-Brahmans , brahman | only | of Brahma | son | natural | from foremost | born | born from Brahma | created by Brahma | heir of Brahma | quote
        â€œSurely indeed, VÄseá¹­á¹­ha, the brahmans are not recollecting their origins when they said thus: â€œOnly the brahman is the best caste, other castes are inferior, only the brahman is a good caste, other castes are bad, only the brahman is is purified, not non-Brahmans, only the brahman is a natural foremost son of Brahma, born from Brahma, created by Brahma, heir of Brahma.â€

        Dissanti kho pana, vÄseá¹­á¹­ha, brÄhmaá¹‡Änaá¹ brÄhmaá¹‡iyo utuniyopi gabbhiniyopi vijÄyamÄnÄpi pÄyamÄnÄpi.

        And yet, VÄseá¹­á¹­ha, we observe of the Brahmans brahman women menstruating, pregnant, giving birth.

        Te ca brÄhmaá¹‡Ä yonijÄva samÄnÄ evamÄhaá¹su: â€˜brÄhmaá¹‡ova seá¹­á¹­ho vaá¹‡á¹‡o, hÄ«nÄ aÃ±Ã±e vaá¹‡á¹‡Ä; brÄhmaá¹‡ova sukko vaá¹‡á¹‡o, kaá¹‡hÄ aÃ±Ã±e vaá¹‡á¹‡Ä; brÄhmaá¹‡Äva sujjhanti, no abrÄhmaá¹‡Ä; brÄhmaá¹‡Äva brahmuno puttÄ orasÄ mukhato jÄtÄ brahmajÄ brahmanimmitÄ brahmadÄyÄdÄâ€™ti.
        ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(ta) ğŸ”¼(ca) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(brÄhmaá¹‡a) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(yonija) ğŸ”¼(eva) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(samÄna) ğŸ”¼(evaá¹) ğŸ”„ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨‚(Äha) : ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(brÄhmaá¹‡a) ğŸ”¼(eva) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(seá¹­á¹­ha) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(vaá¹‡á¹‡a) , ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(hÄ«na) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(aÃ±Ã±a) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(vaá¹‡á¹‡a) , ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(brÄhmaá¹‡a) ğŸ”¼(eva) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(sukka) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(vaá¹‡á¹‡a) , ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(kaá¹‡ha) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(aÃ±Ã±a) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(vaá¹‡á¹‡a) , ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(brÄhmaá¹‡a) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨‚(sujjhati) ğŸ”¼(no) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(abrÄhmaá¹‡a) , ğŸš¹â‘ â¨€(brÄhmaá¹‡a) ğŸš¹â‘¥â¨€(brahma) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(putta) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(orasa) ğŸš¹â‘¤â¨€(mukha) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(jÄta) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(brahmaja) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(brahmanimmita) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(brahmadÄyÄda) ğŸ”¼(ti)
        those | and | brahmans | born from a womb | even | just like | thus | said : brahmans | Bhante | spoke thus : brahman | only | best of | caste , inferior | other | castes , brahman | only | good | caste , bad | other | castes , brahman | only | is purified , not | non-Brahmans , brahman | only | of Brahma | son | natural | from foremost | born | born from Brahma | created by Brahma | heir of Brahma | quote
        And those brahmans that are born from a womb said like thus: â€œOnly the brahman is the best caste, other castes are inferior, only the brahman is a good caste, other castes are bad, only the brahman is is purified, not non-Brahmans, only the brahman is a natural foremost son of Brahma, born from Brahma, created by Brahma, heir of Brahma.â€

        Te brahmÄnaÃ±ceva abbhÄcikkhanti, musÄ ca bhÄsanti, bahuÃ±ca apuÃ±Ã±aá¹ pasavanti.
        ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(ta) ğŸš¹â‘¥â¨‚(brahma) ğŸ”¼(eva) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨‚(abbhÄcikkhati) , ğŸ”¼(musÄ) ğŸ”¼(ca) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨‚(bhÄsati) , ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(bahu) ğŸ”¼(ca) ğŸš¹â‘¡â¨€(apuÃ±Ã±a) â–¶ï¸ğŸ¤Ÿâ¨‚(pasavati)
        those | of Brahma | exclusively | falsely accuse , untruthfully | and | speak , much | and | demerit | generate
        â€œThose of the Brahma falsely accuse, speak untruthfully and generate much demerit.â€

        CattÄrome, vÄseá¹­á¹­ha, vaá¹‡á¹‡Äâ€” khattiyÄ, brÄhmaá¹‡Ä, vessÄ, suddÄ.
        ğŸ”¼(cattÄrome) ğŸš¹â“ªâ¨€(vÄseá¹­á¹­ha) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(vaá¹‡á¹‡a) - ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(khattiya) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(brÄhmaá¹‡a) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(vessa) ğŸš¹â‘ â¨‚(sudda)
        these four | VÄseá¹­á¹­ha | castes - the ruling/warrior caste, the religious caste, the merchant/farming caste, the working/peasant caste.
        â€œVÄseá¹­á¹­ha, there are four castes - khattiya (ruling/warrior caste), brÄhmaá¹‡a (religious caste), vessa (merchant/farming caste), and sudda (working/peasant caste).â€

        Khattiyopi kho, vÄseá¹­á¹­ha, idhekacco pÄá¹‡ÄtipÄtÄ« hoti adinnÄdÄyÄ« kÄmesumicchÄcÄrÄ« musÄvÄdÄ« pisuá¹‡avÄco pharusavÄco samphappalÄpÄ« abhijjhÄlu byÄpannacitto micchÄdiá¹­á¹­hÄ«.
